lines.value: james norman hall 22 april 1887 - 5 july 1951 was an american author best known for the novel mutiny on the bounty with co author charles nordhoff
lines.name: English

lines.value: during world war i hall had the distinction of serving in the militaries of three western allies great britain as an infantryman and then flying for france and later the united states
lines.name: English

lines.value: hall was born in colfax iowa where he attended the local schools
lines.name: English

lines.value: hall graduated from grinnell college in 1910
lines.name: English

lines.value: he wrote the song sons of old grinnell which is part of the college songbook
lines.name: English

lines.value: after graduation he became a social worker in boston massachusetts for the society for prevention to cruelty to children while trying to establish himself as a writer and studying for a master's degree from harvard university
lines.name: English

lines.value: hall was on vacation in the united kingdom in the summer of 1914 when world war i began
lines.name: English

lines.value: posing as a canadian he enlisted in the british army serving in the royal fusiliers as a machine gunner during the battle of loos
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was discharged after his true nationality was discovered and he returned to the united states and wrote his first book kitchener's mob 1916 recounting his wartime experiences
lines.name: English

lines.value: kitchener's mob sold moderately well in america following its publication and after a speaking tour to promote the book hall returned to europe in 1916 on assignment with atlantic monthly magazine
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was to have written a series of stories about the group of american volunteers serving in the lafayette escadrille but after spending some time with the american fliers hall himself became caught up in the adventure and enlisted in the french air service
lines.name: English

lines.value: by then the original escadrille had been expanded to the lafayette flying corps which trained american volunteers to serve in regular french squadrons
lines.name: English

lines.value: during his time in french aviation hall was awarded the croix de guerre with five palms and the medaille militaire
lines.name: English

lines.value: when the united states entered the war in 1917 hall was made a captain in the army air service
lines.name: English

lines.value: there he met another american pilot charles nordhoff
lines.name: English

lines.value: after being shot down over enemy lines hall spent the last months of the war as a german prisoner of war
lines.name: English

lines.value: after being released he was awarded the french legion d'honneur and the american distinguished service cross after the war hall spent much of his life on the island of tahiti where he and nordhoff who had also moved there wrote a number of successful adventure books including the bounty trilogy
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition to the various bounty films other film adaptations of his fiction include the hurricane 1937 which starred his nephew jon hall passage to marseille 1944 featuring humphrey bogart and botany bay 1953 with alan ladd
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1940 hall published a book of poems with the title oh millersville
lines.name: English

lines.value: it appeared under the pseudonym fern gravel and the poems were written in the voice of a girl of about 10 years of age
lines.name: English

lines.value: the book was critically well received and the hoax was not exposed until 1946 when hall published an article entitled fern gravel a hoax and a confession in the atlantic monthly
lines.name: English

lines.value: he wrote that he had been inspired by a dream in which he saw himself back in his iowa childhood with a group of children among whom was a girl named fern who wanted her poems written down
lines.name: English

lines.value: when he awoke hall wrote fern's poems which are simply worded but nicely detailed first person observations of small town life
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1925 hall married sarah lala winchester who was part polynesian
lines.name: English

lines.value: they had two children the academy award winning cinematographer conrad hall 1926-2003 and nancy hall rutgers born 1930
lines.name: English

lines.value: hall died in 1951 in tahiti and is buried on the hillside property just above the modest wooden house he and lala lived in for many years
lines.name: English

lines.value: his grave bears a line of verse he wrote in iowa at the age of 11 look to the northward stranger just over the hillside there have you ever in your travels seen a land more passing fair hall's papers including manuscripts and wartime correspondence are housed in the grinnell college special collections and archives
lines.name: English

lines.value: vernal g riffe jr june 25 1925 - july 31 1997 was an american politician of the democratic party
lines.name: English

lines.value: riffe served for many years in the ohio house of representatives and was the longest serving speaker of the ohio house of representatives in the history of that institution holding that office for 20 years
lines.name: English

lines.value: riffe a moderate democrat was an exceptionally strong speaker even bringing republican members of the house under his sway by threatening to fund the campaigns of their democratic opponents for reelection
lines.name: English

lines.value: riffe who hailed from the impoverished appalachian region of southeastern ohio fought hard to bring money for development to his corner of the state
lines.name: English

lines.value: riffe's efforts resulted in the creation of shawnee state university in portsmouth sometimes referred to as vern riffe u he also brought funding to southern ohio for the building of a major highway ohio 32 disparaged as the highway to nowhere which starts in the countryside near athens ohio in the east and winds its way westward across southern ohio finally ending in rural clermont county east of cincinnati
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the time of its construction it traversed no major population centers stopping short of both cincinnati and athens
lines.name: English

lines.value: today it is referred to as the appalachian highway or the james a rhodes appalachian highway
lines.name: English

lines.value: riffe has been honored by several state agencies in ohio
lines.name: English

lines.value: the vernal riffe chair a professorship in government at the ohio state university is named after him
lines.name: English

lines.value: ohio state's department of biochemistry is housed in the vernal g riffe building
lines.name: English

lines.value: the vern riffe center for government and the arts located across high street from the ohio statehouse in downtown columbus provides office space for the governor of ohio members of the ohio house of representatives and many state agencies
lines.name: English

lines.value: the vern riffe center for the arts in portsmouth is located at shawnee state university
lines.name: English

lines.value: riffe served as a member of the ohio house for 36 years from 1959 to 1995 and served as speaker from 1975 until 1994
lines.name: English

lines.value: because of his power to raise funds riffe's departure from the political scene was a major financial blow to the ohio democratic party
lines.name: English

lines.value: riffe's son vernal g skip riffe iii is a retired county commissioner in scioto county ohio
lines.name: English

lines.value: skip holds the current record of serving the most consecutive terms a total of 24 years
lines.name: English

lines.value: his grandson vernal g nick riffe iv ran for porter township trustee in 2009
lines.name: English

lines.value: he finished third
lines.name: English

lines.value: his daughter cathy e skiver is a retired elementary school teacher
lines.name: English

lines.value: verna riffe biemel riffe's second daughter currently serves with the vinney hospice of montefiore and mary beth hewitt riffe's third daughter is a former teacher
lines.name: English

lines.value: riffe's wife thelma l riffe is also deceased august 4 2010
lines.name: English

lines.value: both are buried at memorial burial park in wheelersburg ohio
lines.name: English

lines.value: honorary federal marshal bestowed in 1996
lines.name: English

lines.value: the vern riffe center for the arts located on the campus of shawnee state the vern riffe school located in portsmouth ohio and vern riffe center for government and the arts in columbus ohio
lines.name: English

lines.value: an autobiographical book whatever's fair co written by cliff treyens a former columbus dispatch writer was published in the spring of 2007 celebrating the life and career of riffe
lines.name: English

lines.value: a gathering of family friends and former political colleagues was held the day before riffe's birthday june 25 at the portsmouth welcome center to introduce the book
lines.name: English

lines.value: hms vanguard was a 70-gun third rate ship of the line of the royal navy launched on 16 april 1748
lines.name: English

lines.value: she was built by philemon ewer at his east cowes yard on the isle of wight to the draught specified by the 1745 establishment at a cost of £8009
lines.name: English

lines.value: she was the fourth vessel of the royal navy to bear the name vanguard
lines.name: English

lines.value: she took part in the capture of louisbourg in 1758 under admiral edward boscawen and in the capture of quebec in 1759 under admiral charles saunders
lines.name: English

lines.value: the following year she pursued two french frigates along with hms diana
lines.name: English

lines.value: the atlante commanded by jean vauquelin and the pomone sunk and the important personnel were taken prisoner
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1762 under the command of sir george rodney she took part in the capture of martinique
lines.name: English

lines.value: vanguard was sold out of the navy in 1774

lines.value: coddle sometimes dublin coddle is an irish dish which is often made to use up leftovers and therefore without a specific recipe
lines.name: English

lines.value: however it most commonly consists of layers of roughly sliced bangers pork sausages and rashers thinly sliced somewhat fatty back bacon with chunky potatoes sliced onion salt pepper and herbs parsley or chives
lines.name: English

lines.value: traditionally it can also include barley and guinness
lines.name: English

lines.value: coddle is particularly associated with the capital of ireland dublin
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was reputedly a favourite dish of the writers sean o'casey and jonathan swift and it appears in several references to dublin including the works of james joyce
lines.name: English

lines.value: the dish is braised in the stock produced by boiling the pieces of bacon and sausages
lines.name: English

lines.value: some traditional recipes favour the addition of a small amount of guinness to the pot but this is very rare in modern versions of the recipe
lines.name: English

lines.value: the dish is cooked in a pot with a well fitting lid in order to steam the ingredients left uncovered by the broth
lines.name: English

lines.value: the only seasoning s are usually salt pepper and occasionally parsley
lines.name: English

lines.value: coddle could be considered irish comfort food and it is inexpensive easy to prepare and quick to cook
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is often eaten in the winter months
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the days when catholics were not allowed to eat meat on fridays this meal was often eaten on thursdays and it allowed a family to use up any remaining sausages or rashers
lines.name: English

lines.value: the name comes from the verb coddle meaning to cook food in water below boiling see coddled egg which in turn derives from caudle which comes from the french term meaning to boil gently parboil or stew
lines.name: English

lines.value: the is a short staff weapon used in okinawa and feudal japan
lines.name: English

lines.value: today the tanbo is used by various martial arts schools
lines.name: English

lines.value: the tanbo is short hardwood staff that is used in the same way as the approximately 1-meter-long hanbo
lines.name: English

lines.value: short staffs smaller than 1 meter can be called tanbo
lines.name: English

lines.value: there is no official length for a tanbo as different ryu martial arts schools use tanbo of various lengths
lines.name: English

lines.value: tanbo can be individually sized using variations of the hand to elbow method
lines.name: English

lines.value: the tanbo is used in several martial arts including jujutsu aikido kobudo hapkido yoseikan budo cuong nhu
lines.name: English

lines.value: tanbo are swung using the elbow and shoulder or manipulated with the wrist
lines.name: English

lines.value: many of the motions are similar to sword strokes
lines.name: English

lines.value: the tanbo can be deadly in skilled hands
lines.name: English

lines.value: the main use is to attack the outer edges of the human bones with speed and accuracy
lines.name: English

lines.value: applying this concept virtually every part of the target can be hit with this weapon
lines.name: English

lines.value: to use this weapon effectively the opponent may be imagined as a 2-dimensional object standing in front of the attacker and the objective is to strike various targets i.e the top and back of the head collarbone hands elbows ribs hip kneecaps and calves
lines.name: English

lines.value: soft tissues can be targeted and the attacker can then aim at the abdomen throat eyes thighs and groin
lines.name: English

lines.value: the tanbo can also be used for thrusting checks or deflections pummeling the enemy with the ends blocking strikes while holding both ends joint locks chokes and parrying various sorts of attacks
lines.name: English

lines.value: speed distance accuracy timing and control are the key components in the successful use of this weapon
lines.name: English

lines.value: human anatomy was learned in ancient warrior studies as well
lines.name: English

lines.value: because this weapon was used in close combat pressure point striking was also important
lines.name: English

lines.value: striking areas of the human anatomy to disable an opponent was integral
lines.name: English

lines.value: the maynard pioneer museum and park is a museum and park located within maynard arkansas
lines.name: English

lines.value: the museum was established in 1979
lines.name: English

lines.value: the centerpiece of the museum is a log cabin dating to the late 19th and early 20th century with original furnishings and historic newspaper clippings
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are also a variety of period photographs donated by local randolph county residents
lines.name: English

lines.value: a museum annex was built in 1982 housing examples of period furniture and other objects
lines.name: English

lines.value: every year the maynard pioneer museum holds pioneer day
lines.name: English

lines.value: students from maynard high school set up booths and games for the day
lines.name: English

lines.value: the events include a you might be a redneck joke competition and a pet parade

lines.value: gordini () is a division of renault sport technologies renault sport
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the past it was a sports car manufacturer and performance tuner established in 1946 by amedee gordini nicknamed le sorcier the sorcerer
lines.name: English

lines.value: gordini became a division of renault in 1968 and of renault sport in 1976
lines.name: English

lines.value: amedee gordini tuned cars and competed in motor races since the 1930s
lines.name: English

lines.value: his results prompted simca the french assembler of fiat to hire him for its motorsport program and to develop road cars
lines.name: English

lines.value: their association continued after world war ii
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1946 gordini introduced the first cars bearing his name fiat engined single seaters raced by him and jose scaron achieving several victories
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the late 1940s the company opened a workshop at the boulevard victor in paris entering sports car and grand prix races
lines.name: English

lines.value: gordini and simca started to diverge in 1951 because of political conflicts
lines.name: English

lines.value: gordini competed in formula one from 1950 to 1956 with a brief return in 1957 with an eight cylinder engine although it achieved a major success in formula two during that period
lines.name: English

lines.value: after its formula one program ended gordini worked with renault as an engine tuner entering renault gordini cars at the 24 hours of le mans between 1962 and 1969
lines.name: English

lines.value: it also tuned engines for alpine a rival sports car manufacturer also associated with renault
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1957 gordini and renault manufactured the dauphine gordini a modified version of the renault dauphine which was a sales success
lines.name: English

lines.value: gordini tuned renault cars also won various rallies during the 1950s and 1960s
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1963 the gordini company planned to move its headquarters to noisy le roi
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the end of 1968 gordini retired and sold a 70% majority stake from his firm to renault
lines.name: English

lines.value: renault gordini was moved to viry chatillon in 1969 and became a sport division of renault before being merged with alpine to form renault sport in 1976
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 1 january 1976 rene vuaillat became director of gordini
lines.name: English

lines.value: the gordini company name became wholly owned by renault in 1977
lines.name: English

lines.value: renault sold gordini badged performance versions of models including the renault 5 the renault 8 the renault 12 and the renault 17
lines.name: English

lines.value: in november 2009 renault announced that it would be reviving the gordini name for an exclusive line of hot hatches in a similar fashion to fiat's revival of its abarth name
lines.name: English

lines.value: modern models to bear the name include the renault twingo and the renault clio
lines.name: English

lines.value: since its early renault models the most characteristic colour scheme of gordini cars has been bleu de france the french motor racing colour with white stripes although different combinations have been used over the years
lines.name: English

lines.value: danilo elvis turcios funez born on 8 may 1978 in sonaguera honduras is a honduran football midfielder who currently plays for upnfm in the honduran second division
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was a member of the national squad at the 2000 summer olympics in sydney australia and the 2010 fifa world cup in south africa
lines.name: English

lines.value: nicknamed el enano the dwarf because of his short build turcios began his professional career with universidad of his native honduras in 1996 making his debut in the 1997 apertura then he played with fc motagua winning his first honduran championship before moving to deportivo maldonado of uruguay in 2001
lines.name: English

lines.value: after a year with maldonado he moved to defensor sporting where he would last even less time moving later in the year to penarol
lines.name: English

lines.value: turcios moved on to the liga mx mexico primera division in 2004 signing with estudiantes tecos
lines.name: English

lines.value: after one season with the guadalajara based club he returned home to honduras to play with olimpia
lines.name: English

lines.value: outside of a one season stint with guatemalan side comunicaciones in 2006 turcios was a regular fixture in olimpia's line up from 2005 2012
lines.name: English

lines.value: he signed with atlanta silverbacks of the north american soccer league in february 2012
lines.name: English

lines.value: he played the 2012 apertura season for real sociedad but left the club claiming they ended his contract and demanding money
lines.name: English

lines.value: he did not plan to retire after the season hinting to a return to motagua which was later denied by the club
lines.name: English

lines.value: he finally joined honduran second division side upnfm for the 2013 clausura
lines.name: English

lines.value: turcios made his debut for honduras in a november 1999 friendly match against trinidad & tobago and has earned a total of 87 caps scoring 7 goals
lines.name: English

lines.value: he has represented his country in 33 fifa world cup qualification matches at the 2000 summer olympics and the 2010 fifa world cup
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also played at the 2001 and 2009 uncaf nations cups as well as at the 2000 2003 and 2005 concacaf gold cups
lines.name: English

lines.value: also he played at the 2001 copa america
lines.name: English

lines.value: his final international was a june 2010 fifa world cup match against switzerland
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ver is a river in hertfordshire england
lines.name: English

lines.value: the river begins in the grounds of lynch lodge kensworth lynch on west side of the a5 trunk road and stays on the west side for some half mile or so then crosses through a pipe into the grounds of markyate cell exits the grounds and recrosses the a5 once again piped through markyate exits above ground at the southern end of markyate and on through flamstead redbourn st albans and park street and joins the river colne at bricket wood
lines.name: English

lines.value: the romans built the city of verulamium alongside it at a time when it was navigable expressing their preference for building in valleys rather than on hills
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ver is a chalk stream which is partly a seasonal winterbourne north of redbourn
lines.name: English

lines.value: however many of its natural features have been compromised as a result of being canalised during the construction of the artificial lakes at verulamium park in st albans in the 1930s following the archaeological excavations of verulamium by sir mortimer wheeler and his wife tessa wheeler
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the 1960s and 1970s it suffered serious problems as a result of water extraction upstream
lines.name: English

lines.value: although these abated temporarily after the closure of one of the pumping stations the upstream part of the river is drying up completely during the summer and the rest of the river may suffer the same fate within a few years compare the current situation with the great flow of water that was reported to exist in 1885 with a depth of 12 feet at dolittle mill on the redbourn road ).
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2004 a proposal for remedial work was being developed for the st albans lakes
lines.name: English

lines.value: the river south of redbourn has been the site of several watermills down the centuries mainly for grinding corn but also put to such diverse uses as paper making fulling cloth silk spinning and diamond lapping
lines.name: English

lines.value: eleven mills are known to have existed of which a number can still be seen today either as mills working or otherwise or converted for example into private homes or parts of public houses
lines.name: English

lines.value: particularly worthy of note are ye olde fighting cocks public house in st albans which claims to be the oldest pub in england was moved in 1539 to the side of the ver next to the abbey mill at the bottom of the abbey orchard and remains in this location today
lines.name: English

lines.value: disused watercress beds can be seen at various points along the river's length most notably in the unspoilt stretch between redbourn and st albans the entire ver valley was a national centre for the watercress growing industry
lines.name: English

lines.value: the poplar and willow plantations around pre mill and the former pre hotel on the a5183 just west of st albans on the edge of the gorhambury estate which are a significant feature of the landscape indicate a more modern industry that of cricket bat manufacturing
lines.name: English

lines.value: cromoglicic acid inn also referred to as cromolyn usan cromoglycate former ban or cromoglicate is traditionally described as a mast cell stabilizer and is commonly marketed as the sodium salt sodium cromoglicate or cromolyn sodium
lines.name: English

lines.value: this drug prevents the release of inflammatory chemicals such as histamine from mast cells
lines.name: English

lines.value: because of their convenience and perceived safety leukotriene receptor antagonists have largely replaced it as the non corticosteroid treatment of choice in the treatment of asthma
lines.name: English

lines.value: cromoglicic acid requires administration four times daily and does not provide additive benefit in combination with inhaled corticosteroids
lines.name: English

lines.value: cromolyn sodium was discovered by roger altounyan who was himself a lifelong asthma sufferer
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is considered a breakthrough drug in management of asthma as the patients can be freed from steroids in many cases however it is mainly effective as a prophylaxis for allergic and exercise induced asthma not as a treatment for acute attacks
lines.name: English

lines.value: altounyan was investigating certain plants and herbs which have bronchodilating properties
lines.name: English

lines.value: one such plant was khella ammi visnaga which had been used as a muscle relaxant since ancient times in egypt
lines.name: English

lines.value: altounyan deliberately inhaled derivatives of the active ingredient khellin to determine if they could block his asthma attacks
lines.name: English

lines.value: after several years of trial he isolated an effective and safe asthma preventing compound called cromolyn sodium
lines.name: English

lines.value: cromoglicic acid is available in multiple forms
lines.name: English

lines.value: cromolyn works because it prevents the release of mediators that would normally attract inflammatory cells and because it stabilizes the inflammatory cells
lines.name: English

lines.value: mct mast cells found in the mucosa are stabilised nedocromil is another mast cell stabilizer that also works in controlling asthma
lines.name: English

lines.value: the underlying mechanism of action is not fully understood for while cromoglicate stabilizes mast cells this mechanism is probably not why it works in asthma
lines.name: English

lines.value: pharmaceutical companies have produced 20 related compounds that are equally or more potent at stabilising mast cells and none of them have shown any anti asthmatic effect
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is more likely that these work by inhibiting the response of sensory c fibers to the irritant capsaicin inhibiting local axon reflexes involved in asthma and may inhibit the release of preformed t cell cytokines and mediators involved in asthma
lines.name: English

lines.value: see review by garland 1991 it is known to somewhat inhibit chloride channels 37% ± 7% and thus may inhibit the finally it may act by inhibiting calcium influx
lines.name: English

lines.value: cromoglicate is classified as a chromone
lines.name: English

lines.value: cromolyn is also being tested as a drug to treat insulin induced lipoatrophy
lines.name: English

lines.value: cromolyn is also known to bind s100p protein and disrupt the interaction with rage
lines.name: English

lines.value: brotherhood of lost dogs was a short lived band formed in mid 2004 by former eve 6 frontman max collins brian young of fountains of wayne and the posies and joe bass howard formerly of the posies

lines.value: datu is a title which denotes the rulers variously described in historical accounts as chiefs sovereign princes and monarchs ) of numerous indigenous peoples throughout the philippine archipelago
lines.name: English

lines.value: the title is still used today especially in mindanao sulu and palawan <ref group="notes">'por otra parte mientras en las indias la cultura precolombiana habia alcanzado un alto nivel en filipinas la civilizacion islena continuaba manifestandose en sus estados mas primitivos
lines.name: English

lines.value: sin embargo esas sociedades primitivas independientes totalmente las unas de las otras estaban en cierta manera estructuradas y se apreciaba en ellas una organizacion jerarquica embrionaria y local pero era digna de ser atendida
lines.name: English

lines.value: precisamente en esa organizacion local es como siempre de donde nace la nobleza
lines.name: English

lines.value: el indio aborigen jefe de tribu es reconocido como noble y las pruebas irrefutables de su nobleza se encuentran principalmente en las hojas de servicios de los militares de origen filipino que abrazaron la carrera de las armas cuando para hacerlo necesariamente era preciso demostrar el origen nobiliario del individuo
lines.name: English

lines.value: de caidenas y vicent vicente las pruebas de nobleza y genealogia en filipinas y los archivios en donde se pueden encontrar antecedentes de ellas in heraldica genealogia y nobleza en los editoriales de hidalguia 1953-1993 40 anos de un pensamiento
lines.name: English

lines.value: madrid 1993 hidalguia p 232
lines.name: English

lines.value: but it was used much more extensively in early philippine history particularly in the regions of central and southern luzon the visayas and mindanao
lines.name: English

lines.value: in early philippine history datus and a small group of their close relatives formed the apex stratum of the traditional three tier social hierarchy of lowland philippine societies
lines.name: English

lines.value: only a member of this birthright aristocracy called maginoo nobleza maharlika or timagua by various early chroniclers could become a datu members of this elite could hope to become a datu by demonstrating prowess in war and or exceptional leadership
lines.name: English

lines.value: both now and in early philippine history filipino worldview had a conception of the self or individual being deeply and holistically connected to a larger community expressed in the language of filipino psychology as kapwa this indigenous conception of self strongly defined the roles and obligations played by individuals within their society.<ref name="mulder2013"> this differentiation of roles and obligations is also more broadly characteristic of malayo polynesian and austronesian cultures where as mulder explains ...social life is rooted in the immediate experience of a hierarchically ordered social arrangement based on the essential inequality of individuals and their mutual obligations to each other this essential inequality of individuals and their mutual obligations to each other informed the reciprocal relationships expressed in the filipino value of utang na loob that defined the three tiered social structure typical among early philippine peoples

lines.value: when travellers whether traders or colonizers came to the philippines from cultures which were under a sovereign monarch these travellers often initially referred to the rulers of philippine polities as monarchs implying them to have powers as sovereigns

lines.value: some early examples were the song dynasty traders who came to the philippines and referred to the ruler of ma i as a huang meaning king an appellation later adopted by the ming dynasty courts when dealing with the philippine archipelago cultures of their own time such as botuan and luzon
lines.name: English

lines.value: later the spanish expeditions of magellan in the 1520s and legaspi in the 1570s initially referred to paramount datus lakans rajahs sultans etc as kings although the spanish stopped using this term when the spanish under the command of martin de goiti first forayed out towards the polities in bulacan and pampanga in late 1571 and realized that these kapampanan datus had a choice not to obey the wishes of the paramount datus of tondo lakandula and maynila rajahs matanda and sulayman leading lakandula and sulayman to explain that there was no single king over these lands and that the influence of tondo and maynila over the kapampangan polities did not include either territorial claim or absolute command

lines.value: that is to say a deposed sovereign may legitimately confer titles of nobility with or without predicates and the honorifics that pertain to his heraldic patrimony as head of his dynasty
lines.name: English

lines.value: the qualities that render a deposed sovereign a subject of international law are undeniable and in fact constitute an absolute personal right the subject may never divest himself of and that needs no ratification or recognition from any other authority

lines.value: a reigning sovereign or head of state may use the term recognition\ to demonstrate the existence of such a right but the term is a mere declaration and not a constitutive act

lines.value: the leaf scars left on twigs after the leaves have fallen have a distinctive horseshoe shape complete with seven nails
lines.name: English

lines.value: the flowers are usually white with a yellow to pink blotch at the base of the petals they are produced in spring in erect panicles 10 30 cm tall with about 20 50 flowers on each panicle
lines.name: English

lines.value: usually only 1 5 fruit develop on each panicle the shell is a green spiky capsule containing one rarely two or three nut like seeds called conkers or horse chestnuts
lines.name: English

lines.value: each conker is 2 4 cm diameter glossy nut brown with a whitish scar at the base
lines.name: English

lines.value: the common name horse chestnut often unhyphenated is reported as having originated from the erroneous belief that the tree was a kind of chestnut though in fact only distantly related together with the observation that the fruit could help panting horses
lines.name: English

lines.value: aesculus hippocastanum is native to a small area in the pindus mountains mixed forests and balkan mixed forests of south east europe
lines.name: English

lines.value: however it can be found in many parts of europe as far north as gastrikland in sweden as well as in many parks and cities in the united states and canada
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is widely cultivated in streets and parks throughout the temperate world and has been particularly successful in places like ireland the united kingdom and new zealand where they are commonly found in parks streets and avenues
lines.name: English

lines.value: cultivation for its spectacular spring flowers is successful in a wide range of temperate climatic conditions provided summers are not too hot with trees being grown as far north as edmonton alberta canada the faroe islands reykjavik iceland and harstad norway
lines.name: English

lines.value: in britain and ireland the seeds are used for the popular children's game conkers
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the first world war there was a campaign to ask for everyone including children to collect horse chestnuts and donate them to the government
lines.name: English

lines.value: the conkers were used as a source of starch for fermentation using the clostridium acetobutylicum method devised by chaim weizmann to produce acetone for use as a solvent for the production of cordite which was then used in military armaments
lines.name: English

lines.value: weizmann's process could use any source of starch but the government chose to ask for conkers to avoid causing starvation by depleting food sources
lines.name: English

lines.value: but conkers were found to be a poor source and the factory only produced acetone for three months however they were collected again in world war ii for the same reason
lines.name: English

lines.value: the seeds especially those that are young and fresh are slightly poisonous containing alkaloid saponins and glucosides
lines.name: English

lines.value: although not dangerous to touch they cause sickness when eaten consumed by horses they can cause tremors and lack of coordination
lines.name: English

lines.value: though the seeds are said to repel spiders there is little evidence to support these claims
lines.name: English

lines.value: the presence of saponin may repel insects but it is not clear whether this is effective on spiders
lines.name: English

lines.value: horse chestnuts have been threatened by the leaf mining moth cameraria ohridella whose larvae feed on horse chestnut leaves
lines.name: English

lines.value: the moth was described from macedonia where the species was discovered in 1984 but took 18 years to reach britain
lines.name: English

lines.value: the flower is the symbol of the city of kiev capital of ukraine
lines.name: English

lines.value: although the horse chestnut is sometimes known as the buckeye this name is generally reserved for the new world members of the aesculus genus
lines.name: English

lines.value: in germany horse chestnuts are often found in beer gardens particularly in bavaria
lines.name: English

lines.value: prior to the advent of mechanical refrigeration brewers would dig cellars for lagering
lines.name: English

lines.value: to further protect the cellars from the summer heat they would plant chestnut trees which have spreading dense canopies but shallow roots which would not intrude on the caverns
lines.name: English

lines.value: the practice of serving beer at these sites evolved into the modern beer garden
lines.name: English

lines.value: the seed extract standardized to around 20 percent aescin escin is used for its venotonic effect vascular protection anti inflammatory and free radical scavenging properties
lines.name: English

lines.value: primary indication is chronic venous insufficiency
lines.name: English

lines.value: a recent cochrane review found the evidence suggests that horse chestnut seed extract is an efficacious and safe short term treatment for chronic venous insufficiency but definitive randomized controlled trials are required to confirm the efficacy
lines.name: English

lines.value: aescin reduces fluid leaks to surrounding tissue by reducing both the number and size of membrane pores in the veins
lines.name: English

lines.value: two preparations are considered whole horsechestnut extract whole hce and purified b-aescin
lines.name: English

lines.value: historically whole hce has been used both for oral and iv routes as of year 2001
lines.name: English

lines.value: the rate of adverse effects are low in a large german study 0.6% consisting mainly of gastrointestinal symptoms
lines.name: English

lines.value: dizziness headache and itching have been reported
lines.name: English

lines.value: one serious safety issue is rare cases of acute anaphylactic reactions presumably in a context of whole hce
lines.name: English

lines.value: purified b-aescin would be expected to have a better safety profile
lines.name: English

lines.value: another is the risk of acute renal failure when patients who had undergone cardiac surgery were given high doses of horse chestnut extract i.v for postoperative oedema
lines.name: English

lines.value: the phenomenon was dose dependent as no alteration in renal function was recorded with 340 ug kg−1 mild renal function impairment developed with 360 ug kg−1 and acute renal failure with 510 ug kg−1
lines.name: English

lines.value: this almost certainly took place in a context of whole hce
lines.name: English

lines.value: three clinical trials were since performed to assess the effects of aescin on renal function
lines.name: English

lines.value: a total of 83 subjects were studied 18 healthy volunteers given 10 or 20 mg iv
lines.name: English

lines.value: for 6 days 40 in patients with normal renal function given 10 mg iv
lines.name: English

lines.value: two times per day except two children given 0.2 mg kg 12 patients with cerebral oedema and normal renal function given a massive iv
lines.name: English

lines.value: dose on the day of surgery 49.2 ± 19.3 mg and 15.4 ± 9.4 mg daily for the following 10 days and 13 patients with impaired renal function due to glomerulonephritis or pyelonephritis who were given 20 25 mg iv
lines.name: English

lines.value: daily for 6 days
lines.name: English

lines.value: in all studies renal function was monitored daily resorting to the usual tests of renal function bun serum creatinine creatinine clearance urinalysis
lines.name: English

lines.value: in a selected number of cases paraaminohippurate and labelled edta clearance were also measured
lines.name: English

lines.value: no signs of development of renal impairment in the patients with normal renal function or of worsening of renal function in the patients with renal impairment were recorded it is concluded that aescin has excellent tolerability in a clinical setting
lines.name: English

lines.value: raw horse chestnut seed leaf bark and flower are toxic due to the presence of esculin and should not be ingested
lines.name: English

lines.value: horse chestnut seed is classified by the fda as an unsafe herb
lines.name: English

lines.value: the glycoside and saponin constituents are considered toxic
lines.name: English

lines.value: aesculus hippocastanum is used in the pseudoscientific bach flower remedies
lines.name: English

lines.value: when the buds are used it is referred to as chestnut bud and when the flowers are used it is referred to as white chestnut
lines.name: English

lines.value: quercetin 34'-diglucoside a flavonol glycoside can also be found in horse chestnut seeds
lines.name: English

lines.value: leucocyanidin leucodelphinidin and procyanidin a2 can also be found in horse chestnut
lines.name: English

lines.value: a famous specimen of the horse chestnut was the anne frank tree in the centre of amsterdam which she mentioned in her diary and which survived until august 2010 when a heavy wind blew it over
lines.name: English

lines.value: eleven young specimens sprouted from seeds from this tree were transported to the united states
lines.name: English

lines.value: after a long quarantine in indianapolis each tree was shipped off to a new home at a notable museum or institution in the united states such as the 9/11 memorial park central hs in little rock and two holocaust centers
lines.name: English

lines.value: one of them was planted outdoors in march 2013 in front of the children's museum of indianapolis where they were originally quarantined
lines.name: English

lines.value: the horse chestnut is a favourite subject for bonsai
lines.name: English

lines.value: the mece principle pronounced me see is a grouping principle for separating a set of items into subsets that are mutually exclusive me and collectively exhaustive ce
lines.name: English

lines.value: the mece principle is useful in the business mapping process where the optimum arrangement of information is exhaustive and does not double count at any level of the hierarchy
lines.name: English

lines.value: examples of mece arrangements include categorizing people by year of birth assuming all years are known
lines.name: English

lines.value: a non mece example would be categorization by nationality because nationalities are neither mutually exclusive some people have dual nationality nor collectively exhaustive some people have none
lines.name: English

lines.value: strategy consultants use mece problem structuring to break down client problems into logical clean buckets of analysis that they can then hand out as work streams to consulting staff on the project
lines.name: English

lines.value: given their extensive use of mece in breaking down client problems they also expect to see interview candidates demonstrate strong mece problem structuring during case interviews
lines.name: English

lines.value: the mece concept has been criticized for not being exhaustive as it doesn't exclude superfluous extraneous items
lines.name: English

lines.value: also mece thinking can be too limiting as mutual exclusiveness is not necessarily desirable
lines.name: English

lines.value: for instance while it may be desirable to classify the answers to a question in a mece framework so as to consider all of them exactly once forcing the answers themselves to be mece can be unnecessarily limiting
lines.name: English

lines.value: another attribute of mece thinking is that by definition it precludes redundancies
lines.name: English

lines.value: however there are cases where redundancies are desirable or even necessary
lines.name: English

lines.value: clan mackintosh clann mhic an toisich is a scottish clan from inverness in the scottish highlands
lines.name: English

lines.value: the chiefs of the clan mackintosh are also chiefs of clan chattan a historic confederation of clans
lines.name: English

lines.value: the scottish gaelic word toisiche means leader and can also be translated as chief
lines.name: English

lines.value: the seanachies of the clan mackintosh claim that the first chief of the clan was shaw second son of duncan macduff earl of fife of the royal house of dal riata
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1160 shaw macduff accompanied malcolm iv of scotland on an expedition to suppress a rebellion in morayshire
lines.name: English

lines.value: in about 1163 he was also made constable of inverness castle and was granted land in the findhorn valley
lines.name: English

lines.value: the heart land of the clan was the lands of petty which was also the burial place of the chiefs
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1179 shaw macduff was succeeded by his son who was also called shaw and was confirmed in his patrimony by william the lion
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1263 during the scottish norwegian war ferquhar mackintosh the fifth chief led his clan at the battle of largs against the army of haakon iv of norway
lines.name: English

lines.value: however he was killed in a duel in 1265 leaving his infant son angus as heir
lines.name: English

lines.value: angus mackintosh was brought up in the court of his uncle alexander of islay lord of the isles chief of clan donald
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1291 a splendid match was arranged for angus when he married eva the only daughter of dougal dal chief of the clan chattan which brought angus the lands of glenloy and loch arkaig
lines.name: English

lines.value: angus and eva lived on the lands of clan chattan at tor castle but they later withdrew to rothiemurchus
lines.name: English

lines.value: after this the clan chattan developed into a unique confederation of independent scottish clans that was led by the mackintosh chiefs
lines.name: English

lines.value: however their leadership was unsuccessfully challenged over the centuries by the clan macpherson who were part of the confederation
lines.name: English

lines.value: from this point onwards clan mackintosh and chattan history is inextricably entwined
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the wars of scottish independence the sixth chief of clan mackintosh supported robert the bruce
lines.name: English

lines.value: clan mackintosh were involved in many clan battles mostly against clan cameron with whom they had an extensive feud which lasted over 350 years the battle of drumlui was fought in 1337 it was a dispute between the clan mackintosh and clan cameron over land at glenlui and loch arkaig
lines.name: English

lines.value: the camerons were defeated but started a 350-year feud
lines.name: English

lines.value: the battle of invernahoven was fought in 1370 between the clan cameron and the chattan confederation of clan mackintosh clan macpherson and clan davidson
lines.name: English

lines.value: the battle of the north inch in 1396 was fought between the chattan confederation that was led by the mackintoshes and the clan cameron and was one of the most important battles between these two clans
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ninth chief of clan mackintosh ferquhar had to surrender the chiefship in favour of malcolm mackintosh son by the second marriage of william mackintosh the seventh chief
lines.name: English

lines.value: malcolm mackintosh was a strong leader who greatly extended the influence of his clan
lines.name: English

lines.value: he feuded with the clan comyn in a dispute that had its origins when the comyns had feuded with robert the bruce
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1424 the comyns forcibly took possession of some of the mackintosh lands at meikle geddes and rait but malcolm mackintosh retaliated and put many of the comyns to the sword
lines.name: English

lines.value: this was in turn retaliated by the comyns who invaded the mackintosh homeland of moy and unsuccessfully tried to drown the mackintoshes on their island of moy
lines.name: English

lines.value: a feast of reconciliation was held at the comyn's castle of rait however here the mackintoshes slaughtered their comyn hosts
lines.name: English

lines.value: the mackintoshes fought at the battle of lochaber in 1429 which was between forces led by alexander of islay earl of ross 3rd lord of the isles and the royalist army of james i of scotland
lines.name: English

lines.value: the battle of palm sunday 1429 was fought between the clan cameron against the clan mackintosh and the chattan confederation
lines.name: English

lines.value: the battle of craig cailloch was fought in 1441 the clan mackintosh at the instigation of alexander lord of the isles began to invade and raid the clan cameron lands
lines.name: English

lines.value: a battle took place at craig cailloch between the camerons and the mackintoshes in which mackintosh's second son lachlann badenoch was wounded and gille chaluim his brother killed
lines.name: English

lines.value: the battle of clachnaharry was fought in 1454 between the clan mackintosh and the clan munro led by john munro of milntown
lines.name: English

lines.value: the raid on ross took place in 1491 in the scottish highlands between the clan mackenzie against several other clans including the clan macdonald of lochalsh clan macdonald of clanranald the clan cameron and the chattan confederation of clan mackintosh
lines.name: English

lines.value: the victors then proceeded to inverness where they stormed the inverness castle and mackintosh placed a garrison in it
lines.name: English

lines.value: the battle of bun garbhain was fought in 1570 between the clan cameron and clan mackintosh
lines.name: English

lines.value: domhnall dubh camshron xv chief of clan cameron had died leaving an infant son ailean at the head of the clan
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the battle the chief of mackintosh is believed to have been killed by donald taillear dubh na tuaighe cameron son of the xiv chief of clan cameron with a fearsome lochaber axe
lines.name: English

lines.value: the battle of glenlivet was fought in 1594 where the clan mackintosh and chattan confederation fought on the side of the earl of argyll along with clan campbell clan stewart of atholl and clan forbes
lines.name: English

lines.value: they were defeated by the earl of huntly's forces which consisted of clan gordon clan comyn and clan cameron
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the scottish civil war the mackintoshes fought for james graham 1st marquis of montrose throughout his campaign for charles i of england
lines.name: English

lines.value: the stand off at the fords of arkaig took place in 1665 between the chattan confederation led by the clan mackintosh against the clan cameron
lines.name: English

lines.value: the battle of mulroy was fought in 1668
lines.name: English

lines.value: clan cameron and clan mackintosh were at peace and cameron chief sir eobhann was responsible for keeping the peace between his men and their former enemies
lines.name: English

lines.value: however when the chief sir eobhann camshron was away in london a feud broke out between clan macdonald of keppoch and their enemies clan mackintosh and clan mackenzie
lines.name: English

lines.value: as the cameron chief was away he was not able to hold back his clan and the combined forces of cameron and macdonald defeated the mackintoshes and mackenzies
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the jacobite rising of 1715 the mackintoshes remained loyal to the stuart cause
lines.name: English

lines.value: lachlan mackintosh led eight hundred clansmen in support of the jacobites under his cousin mackintosh of borlum
lines.name: English

lines.value: however they were defeated at the battle of preston 1715
lines.name: English

lines.value: after this many clansmen were transported to the americas
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the jacobite rising of 1745 angus mackintosh twenty second chief of clan mackintosh was a captain in the british black watch regiment
lines.name: English

lines.value: however in his absence his wife lady anne farquharson mackintosh raised men to fight for the jacobite charles edward stuart
lines.name: English

lines.value: command was given to macgillivray of dunmaglas of the clan macgillivray
lines.name: English

lines.value: they contributed to the jacobite victory at the battle of falkirk muir in 1746
lines.name: English

lines.value: following this victory charles arrived at moy on 16 february 1746 where he was received by lady mackintosh
lines.name: English

lines.value: the prince's bed is still at moy hall
lines.name: English

lines.value: an attempt was made by five hundred government troops to capture prince charles at moy but they were deceived by just five of the lady mackintosh's retainers into believing that they had blundered into the entire jacobite army and fled
lines.name: English

lines.value: this incident became known as the rout of moy
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the battle of culloden the mackintoshes and their allies in the chattan confederation suffered heavy losses
lines.name: English

lines.value: the present chief is john lachlan mackintosh of mackintosh born 1969 formally styled as the mackintosh
lines.name: English

lines.value: he succeeded as chief in 1995 and currently resides in singapore
lines.name: English

lines.value: the mackintosh is an integrated humanities(ih and history teacher in the humanities faculty at nanyang girls high school and married to a language arts teacher and academic miss vanessa heng in march 2014 after their engagement in 2013
lines.name: English

lines.value: castles held by the clan mackintosh have included
lines.name: English

lines.name: English
