lines.name: English

lines.value: arthur carl wilhelm heffter 15 june 1859 in leipzig - 8 february 1925 in berlin was a german pharmacologist and chemist
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was the first chairman of the german society of pharmacologists and was largely responsible for the first handbook of experimental pharmacology
lines.name: English

lines.value: he isolated mescaline from the peyote cactus in 1897 the first such isolation of a naturally occurring psychedelic substance in pure form
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition he conducted experiments on its effects by comparing the effects of peyote and mescaline on himself
lines.name: English

lines.value: * heffter research institute
lines.name: English

lines.value: the governor general's award for english language fiction is a canadian literary award that annually recognizes one canadian writer for a fiction book written in english
lines.name: English

lines.value: beginning 1987 it is one of fourteen governor general's awards for literary merit seven each for creators of english and french language books
lines.name: English

lines.value: originally presented by the canadian authors association the governor general's awards program became a project of the canada council for the arts in 1959
lines.name: English

lines.value: the age requirement is 18 and up.the program was created in 1937 and inaugurated that november for 1936 publications in two english language categories conventionally called the 1936 governor general's awards
lines.name: English

lines.value: the winners alone were announced until 1979 when canada council released in advance a shortlist of three nominees
lines.name: English

lines.value: omitted only for 1981 the advance shortlist has numbered three to six from 1997 always five
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ogaden national liberation front abbreviated onlf ; ) is a separatist rebel group fighting for the right to self determination for somalis in the somali region of ethiopia
lines.name: English

lines.value: the onlf established in 1984 demands for the autonomy of this region and has claimed responsibility for several attacks since the beginning of 1994 aimed at ethiopian forces in the area which the government considers a region under the new federal system
lines.name: English

lines.value: the area of the ogaden region stretches at least about 330000 square kilometres and has over 7 million people mainly from the absame somali tribe
lines.name: English

lines.value: the onlf claims that ethiopia is an occupying government despite the ogaden being represented in the ethiopian federal government by groups including the opposition somali people's democratic party spdp
lines.name: English

lines.value: the onlf is composed mainly of members of the ogaden clan specifically the makaahiil tribe of the ogaden
lines.name: English

lines.value: the armed wing of the onlf is the ogaden national liberation army onla
lines.name: English

lines.value: the onlf was founded in 1984 by six people abdirahman mahdi the chairman of the western somali liberation movement youth union mohamed ismail omar of the western somali liberation front wslf sheikh ibrahim abdalla mohamed wslf abdi ibrahim ghehleh wslf-trade union abdirahman yusuf magan wslf and abdulahi muhammed sa'adi wslf
lines.name: English

lines.value: the onlf is currently led by chairman mohammed omar osman who was elected to the post at a 1998 national convention
lines.name: English

lines.value: onlf was formed after the defeat of somalia in the 1977 ogaden war
lines.name: English

lines.value: onlf systematically recruited wslf members and replaced wslf in the ogaden as somalian support for the wslf dwindled and finally ended in the late 1980s
lines.name: English

lines.value: by the time mengistu regime fell the onlf had fully consolidated its position among ethnic somalis in ogaden and joined the transitional government
lines.name: English

lines.value: the onlf announced elections in december 1992 for district five what became the somali region in ethiopia and won 80% of the seats of the local parliament
lines.name: English

lines.value: onlf nominated abdullahi muhumed sa'di for the region's presidency and other members for the vice presidency and the executive body the regional parliament elected them in a majority vote
lines.name: English

lines.value: onlf elected officials ruled the territory until the transitional government ended with the adoption of a new constitution
lines.name: English

lines.value: at that time the ruling ethiopian people's revolutionary democratic front pushed for a new partner in the region which led to the founding of the ethiopian somali democratic league esdl at hurso in 1993
lines.name: English

lines.value: the esdl then won the somali seats in the 1995 general elections pushing the onlf out of power
lines.name: English

lines.value: the onlf then accused the ethiopian government of oppressing its members while onlf was accused of killing other somali politicians and elders
lines.name: English

lines.value: the onlf continues to operate in the ogaden
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ethiopian military has stepped up its actions against onlf following the organizations stated that it would attack the malaysian oil company petronas which plans to extract oil from the ogaden basin
lines.name: English

lines.value: even though there are some developments including a new university in the somali state region new schools hospital and somali language television programs full development has been restrained in the area because of the fighting between onlf and government forces
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2005 ethiopia proposed peace talks with onlf
lines.name: English

lines.value: onlf accepted on the condition that talks be held in a neutral country and with the presence of a neutral arbiter from the international community but the talks broke down due to ethiopia's insistence that the two parties meet directly in a location in or around the horn of africa
lines.name: English

lines.value: onlf became a part of the alliance for freedom and democracy on may 22 2006 but the alliance has not achieved any progress since its creation
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 12 august 2006 13 members of the onlf were killed and several commanders were claimed captured as they crossed into ethiopia from somalia
lines.name: English

lines.value: the onlf repudiated this claim stating that it was intended to reassure prospective oil prospecting companies from malaysia and china that ethiopia is in control of the ogaden territory
lines.name: English

lines.value: the onlf mostly recruits from the ogaden subclan which constitutes roughly 2/3 of the regional population
lines.name: English

lines.value: however many other somali clans and sub clans reside in the area and animosity between the pro onlf ogadenis and other somali clans in the area remains very deeply rooted
lines.name: English

lines.value: for many calling the region ogaden is rightly or wrongly associated with majority rule by the ogaden clans respectively with their claim for power within the somali regional state
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ethiopian government has exploited these rivalries by arming minority somali militias to fight the majority onlf
lines.name: English

lines.value: yet some ogaden members have pushed for other somali clans getting represented in the regional government
lines.name: English

lines.value: writer mohamed mohamud abdi states that the territory has been under occupation since the scramble for africa and that the inhabitants have been unable to choose their own name ogadenia for the land
lines.name: English

lines.value: supporters of the onlf generally aspire to create an independent sovereign somali majority state consisting primarily of what is now ethiopia's somali region
lines.name: English

lines.value: onlf supporters generally refer to the entire area of this future state as ogaden or ogadenia even though the name is controversial among some groups because of its clan affiliation
lines.name: English

lines.value: the onlf ostensibly exists to allow the inhabitants of ethiopia's somali region the ability to freely determine their own future and has thus has taken few public positions with regards to how a future state of ogadenia would be administered
lines.name: English

lines.value: that said the onlf has fostered the creation of a national consciousness among ethiopia's somali inhabitants by adopting a national flag for ogadenia and promoting an ogaden national anthem qaran before the adoption of qaran the ogaden national anthem used by some separatists was abab
lines.name: English

lines.value: furthermore the onlf has an official political programme in which it commits to among other things protecting freedom of religion democratic activity and the women children and minorities of ogaden
lines.name: English

lines.value: the nomadic lifestyle of somali people has led to their occupation of disproportionally larger territory than other ethnic groups in the horn of africa who have greater populations than somalis especially the neighboring oromos
lines.name: English

lines.value: small and big conflicts have occurred between somalis oromos and afars in the disputed border regions for several centuries
lines.name: English

lines.value: the somali region of ethiopia often labeled ogaden also used to be known as hararghe in the pre 1991 map of ethiopia
lines.name: English

lines.value: the pre 1991 map showed somalis inhabiting a large part of today's northeast oromia while the post 1991 map shows the ogaden region occupying oromia's pre 1991 bale region
lines.name: English

lines.value: ogaden nationalists have stated that dire dawa and various towns including mieso bardoda babille fanyaanbiiro jinacsani and other regions were incorporated into oromia by the oromo peoples democratic organization opdo following a 2004 plebiscite
lines.name: English

lines.value: some oromo liberation fighters believe a large chunk of ogaden's territory belongs to them
lines.name: English

lines.value: in february 2009 300 people were killed and over 100000 people displaced during a conflict outside the border town of moyale between an oromo clan and a somali clan
lines.name: English

lines.value: unlike other ethiopian ethnic groups like the oromo and gurage the somali ethnic group in general and the ogaden sub clan in particular do not have religious diversity
lines.name: English

lines.value: around 99% of the ogaden people practice islam
lines.name: English

lines.value: on november 28 2006 the onlf threatened that it would not allow ethiopian troops to stage into somalia from their territories
lines.name: English

lines.value: on december 23 the onlf claimed to have attacked an ethiopian column near baraajisale heading to somalia destroying 4 of 20 vehicles inflicting casualties and driving the convoy back
lines.name: English

lines.value: no independent source has confirmed the attack
lines.name: English

lines.value: on january 10 2007 onlf condemned ethiopia's entry into the war in somalia stating that meles zenawi's invasion of somalia demonstrates that his government has been an active participant in the somali conflict with a clear agenda aimed at undermining the somali sovereignty
lines.name: English

lines.value: however the somalia government thanked the ethiopian government for its assistance in mogadishu
lines.name: English

lines.value: on january 15 onlf rebels attacked ethiopian soldiers in kebri dahar gerbo and fiq
lines.name: English

lines.value: five ethiopian soldiers and one onlf rebel were reported killed
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to the chicago tribune as of 2007 human rights groups and media reports accuse ethiopia &ndash a key partner in washington's battle against terrorism in the volatile horn of africa &ndash of burning villages pushing nomads off their lands and choking off food supplies in a harsh new campaign of collective punishment against a restive ethnic somali population in the ogaden a vast wilderness of rocks and thorns bordering chaotic somalia
lines.name: English

lines.value: in april 2007 the ethiopian government imposed a total commercial trade embargo on the war affected area of somali region the fiq degehabur gode korahe and werder zones where the ogadeni somali live prohibiting all commercial truck movement in the region and across the border into somalia as well as the free movement of livestock by foot
lines.name: English

lines.value: a tightly restricted and monitor tour by western journalist in the embattled region on the invitation of the regional administration reported on more alleged crimes by the ethiopian government
lines.name: English

lines.value: a report by a newsweek reporter detailed how ethiopian military troops stormed a village southeast of degahabur accused the villagers of sympathizing with the onlf then razing the village and torturing and murdering many of the inhabitants
lines.name: English

lines.value: on april 24 2007 members of the onlf attacked a camp for employees of zhongyuan petroleum engineering a chinese oil exploration company in obale somali region killing approximately 65 ethiopians and 9 chinese nationals
lines.name: English

lines.value: the onlf claimed it had completely destroyed the camp
lines.name: English

lines.value: most of the ethiopians killed in the attack were daily laborers guards and other support staff
lines.name: English

lines.value: some members of the ethiopian security officials were also killed during the surprise attack however those killed by the onlf included 30 civilians the onlf attack was perpetuated as the onlf has a policy of not allowing the ethiopian government to extract resources as this will not be shared with the impoverished and suppressed population of the ogaden the ogaden is largely a marginalized region as rebels have battled successive governments claiming discrimination and most recently crimes against humanity this was backed by a human rights watch report into alleged abuses
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was the most deadly single attack by the onlf
lines.name: English

lines.value: on april 27 ethiopian government spokesperson reported that onlf rebels had detonated a grenade killing one person who was attending a funeral of family member killed during the prior attack
lines.name: English

lines.value: shortly after the attack the ethiopian army launched a military crackdown in ogaden
lines.name: English

lines.value: the latest action of this crackdown resulted in the death of foreign relations chief dr mohammed sirad dolal at the town of danan as he met with other onlf members
lines.name: English

lines.value: reportedly this has led to the onlf splitting into two factions with one group allied to current onlf chairman mohammed omar osman and the other led by senior leader abdiwali hussein gas who appointed salahudin ma'ow as the new onlf chairman and declared that he will bring mohammed omar osman to court
lines.name: English

lines.value: in may 2007 a grenade attack by onlf rebels in the somali region of ethiopia claimed the lives of at least 11 somalis
lines.name: English

lines.value: during a national holiday ceremony held at the ogaden town of jijiga the grenade thrown at the podium of the stadium also wounded somali regional president abdulahi hassan mohammed in the leg
lines.name: English

lines.value: bereket simon an adviser to prime minister meles blamed the onlf as well as eritrea since it arms the onlf
lines.name: English

lines.value: however the onlf denied the accusations
lines.name: English

lines.value: the bombing triggered a huge stampede in the stadium which led to the death of around six children
lines.name: English

lines.value: ethiopia says dozens more somali civilians have been killed by onlf over the years including women and children
lines.name: English

lines.value: as of 2009 no oil has been found in the ogaden
lines.name: English

lines.value: the us energy information administration has been quoted as estimating that ethiopia has 428000 barrels of crude oil reserves
lines.name: English

lines.value: however experts believe the real prize is the estimated 4 trillion cubic feet of natural gas
lines.name: English

lines.value: this potential has drawn large companies such as petronas from malaysia and lundin petroleum based in sweden to the inhospitable and nearly roadless ogaden
lines.name: English

lines.value: various media sources have wrongly stated that there is oil in ogaden but there has been no oil discovery in the ogaden
lines.name: English

lines.value: contrary to popular claims the ogaden region is a resource poor desert and has lacked development for centuries under nomadic tribes that the federal ethiopian government receives very little income from the region
lines.name: English

lines.value: due to the nomadic nature of the natives and due to the onlf insurgency the current ethiopian government is said to spend a large portion of the budget for infrastructure development in the ogaden region despite the government getting proportionally very little tax revenue from the locals
lines.name: English

lines.value: an onlf grenade attack on a cultural gathering in jijiga killed four middle school students on may 28 2007
lines.name: English

lines.value: in a separate attack fifty civilians were injured including the regional president abdullahi hassan and three artists were killed on may 28 2007 by the onlf
lines.name: English

lines.value: an onlf attack on the town of the debeweyin woreda in the korahe zone also left ten civilians dead including two schoolteachers and a pregnant woman
lines.name: English

lines.value: a second attack on the town of shilavo left five civilians dead while an onlf planted landmine near aware in the degehabur zone exploded killing three civilians traveling by automobile
lines.name: English

lines.value: another onlf unit struck in the district of lahelow near the ethiopia somalia border targeting members of the isma'il gum'adle sub clan twelve of whom were slain
lines.name: English

lines.value: regional security chief abdi mohammed omar asserted that over a two months period some 200 civilians had been killed by the onlf
lines.name: English

lines.value: ethiopia has been recently accused of human rights abuses
lines.name: English

lines.value: in response the ministry of foreign affairs says there is a double standard on terrorism since the onlf group has killed many ethiopians and western nations have not condemned its killings
lines.name: English

lines.value: ethiopia has been described as a partner in the united states fight against terrorists including al qaeda
lines.name: English

lines.value: in a communique the onlf claimed to have captured seven towns in the somali region on 10 november 2009 after two days of heavy fighting
lines.name: English

lines.value: the onlf reported these towns as obolka near harar hamaro east of fiq higlaaley and gunogabo near degehabur yucub 40 kilometers from werder galadiid 35 kilometers from kebri dahar and boodhaano near gode
lines.name: English

lines.value: bereket simon denied to reuters that the onlf had succeeded in capturing any towns adding their attacks last week were simply the desperate act of a dying force and about 245 of their fighters were killed
lines.name: English

lines.value: donald argee barksdale march 31 1923 - march 8 1993 was an american professional basketball player
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was a pioneer as an african american basketball player becoming the first to be named ncaa all american the first to play on a united states men's olympic basketball team and the first to play in a national basketball association all star game
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was inducted into the naismith memorial basketball hall of fame
lines.name: English

lines.value: born in oakland california to argee barksdale a pullman porter and desoree nee rowe barksdale don attended nearby berkeley high school where the basketball coach cut him from the team for three straight years because he wanted no more than one black player
lines.name: English

lines.value: barksdale honed his basketball playing skills in parks and then played for two years at marin junior college across san francisco bay before earning a scholarship to ucla
lines.name: English

lines.value: a 6'6 center for the bruins in 1947 he became the first african american to be named consensus all american
lines.name: English

lines.value: barksdale was a member of alpha phi alpha fraternity
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1948 he was the first african american on the us olympic basketball team
lines.name: English

lines.value: he joined the team in basketball at the 1948 summer olympics and became the first african american to win an olympic gold medal in basketball
lines.name: English

lines.value: barksdale who had been playing with the amateur athletic union's oakland bittners was given an at large berth from the independent bracket but not without heavy lobbying by fred maggiora a member of the olympic basketball committee and a politician in oakland which was adjacent to barksdale's hometown
lines.name: English

lines.value: about eight years later maggiora told barksdale that some committee members responses to the idea of having a black olympian was hell no that will never happen but maggiora wouldn't let the committee bypass barksdale
lines.name: English

lines.value: this guy fought fought and fought barksdale said and i think finally the coach of the phillips 66ers omar browning said that son of a bitch is the best basketball player in the country outside of bob kurland so i don't know how we can turn him down so they picked me but maggiora said he went through holy hell for it - closed door meetings and begging the 1948 olympic team had five kentucky wildcats basketball players who had just won that school's first national championship in the 1948 ncaa division i men's basketball tournament
lines.name: English

lines.value: the rest of the olympic team consisting of aau champion phillips 66ers and kentucky team members later scrimmaged on stoll field then the home of the kentucky football team in front of 14000 spectators the largest crowd to watch basketball in kentucky at that time
lines.name: English

lines.value: barksdale became the first african american to play against kentucky in lexington
lines.name: English

lines.value: he could not stay at the hotel with the rest of the team but instead stayed with a black host family
lines.name: English

lines.value: adolph rupp the legendary kentucky coach was assistant coach on the 1948 team under omar browning
lines.name: English

lines.value: [rupp] turned out to be my closest friend barksdale said
lines.name: English

lines.value: we went to london and won all 12 games and got the gold medal but he had to brush off indignities just about every step of the way
lines.name: English

lines.value: later coach rupp told barksdale son i wish things weren't like that but there's nothing you or i can do about it barksdale agreed
lines.name: English

lines.value: he lived by a very simple philosophy
lines.name: English

lines.value: he wasn't interested in protest he was interested in playing basketball
lines.name: English

lines.value: he had faced prejudice before and he knew that he would face it again
lines.name: English

lines.value: after college he played for the oakland aau team until the nba began to integrate
lines.name: English

lines.value: while playing professional basketball he started a career in radio broadcasting
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1948 he became the first black radio disc jockey in the san francisco bay area
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also worked in television and owned a beer distributorship
lines.name: English

lines.value: he became the first african american beer distributor and the first african american television host in the bay area with a show called sepia review on kron tv
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1951 he signed a lucrative contract with the baltimore bullets and entered the nba as a 28-year-old rookie
lines.name: English

lines.value: he would be one of the first african americans to play in the nba after nathaniel clifton chuck cooper earl lloyd and hank dezonie had joined the league in 1950
lines.name: English

lines.value: while with the bullets he became the first african american to appear in an nba all star game in 1953
lines.name: English

lines.value: shortly afterward he was traded to the boston celtics
lines.name: English

lines.value: two years later his playing career was cut short by ankle injuries
lines.name: English

lines.value: after his basketball career ended he returned to radio started his own recording label and opened two nightclubs in oakland
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1983 he launched the save high school sports foundation which is credited with helping to save oakland school athletic programs from collapse
lines.name: English

lines.value: he succumbed to throat cancer at the age of 69 on march 8 1993 in oakland california
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was survived by his sons donald and derek
lines.name: English

lines.value: a documentary on barksdale's life bounce the don barksdale story was released in 2007
lines.name: English

lines.value: the documentary was produced by doug harris for athletes united for peace a berkeley based youth sports and media organization
lines.name: English

lines.value: on february 24 2012 barksdale was announced as a member of the 2012 induction class of the naismith memorial basketball hall of fame
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was directly elected by the hall's early african american pioneers committee and formally entered the hall as a contributor on september 7
lines.name: English

lines.value: james alfred pearce december 14 1805december 20 1862 was an american politician
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was a member of the us house of representatives representing the second district of maryland from 1835 to 1839 and 1841 to 1843
lines.name: English

lines.value: he later served as a us senator from maryland from 1843 until his death in 1862
lines.name: English

lines.value: pearce was in born alexandria virginia the son of gideon pearce and julia dick and the grandson of elisha c dick
lines.name: English

lines.value: when he turned four years old his mother died his father moved to louisiana to become a sugar planter leaving his son in alexandria to the care of grandparents
lines.name: English

lines.value: pearce attended a private academy in alexandria and entered the college of new jersey now princeton university in 1819
lines.name: English

lines.value: he graduated in 1822 at the age of seventeen with honors and started studying law in baltimore under judge john glenn and attorney david hoffman 1784-1854 an american legal ethics pioneer and author of fifty resolutions in regard to professional deportment 1836
lines.name: English

lines.value: there was a requirement for aspiring jurists set by the maryland legislature for at least three years of legal studies under the guidance of practicing lawyers in 1831 it was lowered to two years
lines.name: English

lines.value: ahead of time in 1824 pearce passed exams and was admitted to the maryland bar commencing practice in cambridge maryland for a year
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1825 pearce moved with his father in louisiana and briefly engaged in sugar planting business then he returned to kent county maryland in 1828 where he started the practice of law in chestertown
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1829 pearce married martha j laird they were raising 3 children in chestertown maryland until 1845 when martha died
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1847 pearce remarried his new wife became matilda cox ringgold they had one child
lines.name: English

lines.value: his son james alfred pearce jr became a judge for the maryland court of appeals
lines.name: English

lines.value: from 1831 until 1835 pearce was a member of the maryland house of delegates
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was elected as a whig to the twenty fourth and twenty fifth congresses serving from march 4 1835 until march 3 1839 but was an unsuccessful candidate for reelection in 1838 to the twenty sixth congress losing to philip thomas
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was again elected to congress in 1840 and served one term from march 4 1841 until march 3 1843
lines.name: English

lines.value: pearce was again elected as a whig to the united states senate in 1843 and was reelected in 1849 1855 and 1861 the last time as a democrat and served from march 4 1843 until his death in 1862
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the senate pearce served for nineteen years as chairman of the committee on the library twenty-ninth through thirty seventh congresses
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also served in 1861 for two months as chairman of the committee on finance
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1847-1862 he served as a member of the executive committee of the regents of the smithsonian institution
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was involved with the coast survey which is among the us governmental oldest scientific organizations and the united states botanic garden
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the us senate pearce became known as an erudite and pragmatist
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1850 he developed the so called pearce plan a part of compromise of 1850
lines.name: English

lines.value: the pearce plan provided a solution for the boundary dispute between texas and the federal government
lines.name: English

lines.value: pearce wrote a bill that granted texas $10 million in compensation for agreeing with the state borders charted by the government
lines.name: English

lines.value: after being approved by congress the bill was signed by president millard fillmore
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1850 president fillmore offered pearce first to become a judge of the united states district court for the district of maryland and then - secretary of the interior
lines.name: English

lines.value: pearce chose to stay in the senate
lines.name: English

lines.value: political polarization caused by the issues of nativism prohibition and anti slavery fragmented in 1852 the whig party and in 1856 pearce joined the democratic party and supported james buchanan's nomination for presidency
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the sectional crisis pearce stood against the dissolution of the union
lines.name: English

lines.value: however he was hesitant to discuss the slavery issue being a slaveholder himself
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the civil war broke out he did not resign
lines.name: English

lines.value: in march 1862 he appeared in the senate for the last time
lines.name: English

lines.value: pearce died in chestertown on december 20 1862 and is interred in new chester cemetery
lines.name: English

lines.value: his deathbed from the hynson ringgold house was preserved and now exhibited in the historic geddes piper house c
lines.name: English

lines.value: 1770 in chestertown maryland
lines.name: English

lines.value: * list of united states congress members who died in office 1790-1899
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the traditional chilota mythology of chiloe the trauco is a humanoid creature of small stature similar to a dwarf or goblin who lives in the deep forests
lines.name: English

lines.value: it has an ugly face and legs without feet
lines.name: English

lines.value: the trauco is a mythical entity who inhabits the woods of chiloe an island in the south of chile
lines.name: English

lines.value: it has a powerful magnetism that attracts young and middle aged women
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to myth the trauco's wife is the wicked and ugly fiura
lines.name: English

lines.value: the trauco carries a small stone headed hatchet that he uses to strike trees in the forest to symbolize his sexual potency
lines.name: English

lines.value: whomever the trauco chooses will go to him even if she is sleeping and fall enraptured at his feet
lines.name: English

lines.value: no woman can resist his magical attraction all have sexual intercourse with him
lines.name: English

lines.value: some men of chiloe fear the trauco as his gaze can be deadly
lines.name: English

lines.value: when a single woman is pregnant and no one steps forward as the father people assume that the trauco is the father
lines.name: English

lines.value: because the trauco is irresistible the woman is considered blameless
lines.name: English

lines.value: the trauco is sometimes invoked to explain sudden or unwanted pregnancies especially in unmarried women
lines.name: English

lines.value: the trauco appears in the luke coles book series by josh walker where he functions as an antagonist in some of the subplots
lines.name: English

lines.value: the central bank of manchou (; japanese hepburn manshu chuo ginko was the central bank of the japan sponsored state of manchukuo
lines.name: English

lines.value: the bank was established by the bank of manchukuo act at hsinking on 11 june 1932 as a joint stock company with a capital of 30000000 yuan with the government holding at least 25% and at most 50% at any time
lines.name: English

lines.value: the bank officially opened its doors for business on july 1 as the amalgamation of the four note issuing banks active in manchuria prior to that time namely the bank of the three eastern provinces the bank of kirin the bank of heilungkiang and the frontier bank controlled by local warlord chang tso lin
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was later revealed by audits that acquiring the four previous banks of manchuria to be financially irresponsible as the bank of manchuo held a deficit if 30000000 yuan in combined liabilities but the action was deemed necessary as it was the only way to get rid of the overabundant currency issued by those banks in manchuria in order to create a better foundation for the new manchukuo yuan
lines.name: English

lines.value: when the bank of manchuo was created it had a sufficient number of gold reserves for the new currency and paid out a dividend of 6% to investors the stable value of the manchukuo yuan was a major contributing factor for the development of the economy of manchukuo
lines.name: English

lines.value: the principal functions of the bank were to act as a repository for the funds of the manchukuo state treasury control the money market unify the monetary system of manchukuo and stabilize its currency
lines.name: English

lines.value: however the bank also engaged in ordinary banking business such as granting agricultural industrial and commercial credit
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition the bank served as japan's agent in manchukuo with the withdrawal of the korean bank of chosen from the region
lines.name: English

lines.value: with its head office in hsinking the bank had nearly 140 branches throughout manchukuo china and japan proper
lines.name: English

lines.value: pursuant to the currency law of 1932 which authorized the creation of the bank manchukuo adopted a unit of currency the manchukuo yuan containing 23.91 grams of pure silver the metal on which chinese currencies traditionally were based
lines.name: English

lines.value: the bank was required by its charter to hold as a reserve against its issued notes at least 30% of the value of such issue in gold and silver bullion reliable foreign currencies and deposits with foreign banks in gold and silver accounts
lines.name: English

lines.value: the bank's notes were not required to be redeemable in specie
lines.name: English

lines.value: due to worldwide fluctuations in the price of silver during the 1930s manchukuo took the yuan off a silver standard in 1935 and subsequently pegged the yuan to and later reached approximate exchange parity with the japanese yen
lines.name: English

lines.value: the bank initially issued approximately 150 million yuan in notes in 1932
lines.name: English

lines.value: by 1936 their aggregate value exceeded 200 million yuan rising to 300 million in 1937 400 million in 1938 and 620 million by the end of 1939
lines.name: English

lines.value: throughout this period about half the value of the issued notes was backed by specie reserves
lines.name: English

lines.value: the notes issued were in five denominations one hundred ten five and one yuan and five chiao one-half yuan
lines.name: English

lines.value: to keep up with the inflationary pressures typically experienced by japanese controlled areas towards the end of world war ii a 1000 yuan note was issued in 1944
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1948 after the end of world war ii approximately 12 billion yuan of central bank of manchou notes were redeemed by the tung pei bank
lines.name: English

lines.value: as with chinese coinage of the time manchukuo's coinage was based on the decimal system one tenth of the yuan being called the chiao one hundredth called a fen and one thousandth a li under the currency law the central bank of manchukuo was authorized to mint 1 chiao and 5 fen coins of a nickel copper alloy and 1 fen and 5 li coins of a copper tin zinc alloy
lines.name: English

lines.value: manchukuo was established in march 1932 with puyi assuming the title of chief executive of the new state using the era name of datong
lines.name: English

lines.value: following the traditional dating system based on the year of the ruler's reign the year 1932 became the first year of datong
lines.name: English

lines.value: two years later manchukuo was changed into an empire with pu yi ascending the throne as emperor of manchukuo under the reign title kangde
lines.name: English

lines.value: accordingly 1934 was designated the first year of kangde while 1942 was the ninth year of kangde
lines.name: English

lines.value: jla earth 2 is a 2000 dc comics graphic novel written by grant morrison with art by frank quitely
lines.name: English

lines.value: it follows the first post crisis encounter between the justice league of america and their evil counterparts from an antimatter universe the crime syndicate of amerika
lines.name: English

lines.value: the crime syndicate traditionally originated from earth 3 however as the concept of a multiverse was eliminated in crisis on infinite earths so was the pre crisis earth 3
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the time jla earth 2 was published generally only two universes existed a primary universe made of ordinary matter where the mainstream stories took place and an antimatter universe where the crime syndicate originated
lines.name: English

lines.value: alexander luthor in this story was from the antimatter universe and he designated the primary universe as earth 2 upon discovering it hence the book title
lines.name: English

lines.value: dc comics later revived the concept of multiverse in infinite crisis and 52
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a result the earth 2 concept introduced in this book no longer exists and the term earth 2 has a different meaning in the current continuity
lines.name: English

lines.value: alexander luthor the lone hero from the antimatter universe breaks the barrier between earths 1 and 2 seeking the jla's help
lines.name: English

lines.value: he imprisons and takes the place of his evil positive matter counterpart
lines.name: English

lines.value: meanwhile the jla investigate a plane crash where all the dead passengers have hearts on the right side of their bodies and money bearing the slogan in mammon we trust and the face of benedict arnold
lines.name: English

lines.value: this leads them to alexander luthor who informs them of the other earth and asks for 48 hours of their time to help the oppressed world
lines.name: English

lines.value: the jla except for aquaman and the martian manhunter follow luthor to the alternate earth
lines.name: English

lines.value: the crime syndicate are introduced
lines.name: English

lines.value: each is an evil counterpart of a jla member
lines.name: English

lines.value: ultraman calls a meeting discovers luthor's absence and begins plotting to take over the positive matter universe while power ring and johnny quick discuss the possibility of counterparts to themselves
lines.name: English

lines.value: green lantern forms a force field around the moon trapping the csa in their lunar base
lines.name: English

lines.value: the jla and luthor begin to set the world right
lines.name: English

lines.value: batman works to clear gotham city of crime with the antimatter universe version of his father police chief thomas wayne who survived the famous shooting that spawned batman while bruce and his mother were killed
lines.name: English

lines.value: in this universe bruce had a brother thomas jr who blamed his father for the deaths and became owlman out of revenge
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ruthless crime lord boss gordon is also brought to justice
lines.name: English

lines.value: owlman correctly concludes that 24 hours after the jla appeared on the antimatter earth the csa will be transported to the positive matter earth in order to correct a dimensional equilibrium
lines.name: English

lines.value: when this occurs the csa attack the white house and destroy much of washington dc then are easily subdued by aquaman and the martian manhunter who take down the most powerful csa members with startling ease
lines.name: English

lines.value: meanwhile the jla's attempts to reform the antimatter earth unravel quickly the opposite nature of this world means that evil and corruption are the natural order of things and any attempt to improve the society is doomed to failure
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is also why the csa fell so easily to aquaman and martian manhunter justice is destined to prevail on the positive matter earth
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is revealed that luthor has been manipulated by ultraman's servant the antimatter brainiac
lines.name: English

lines.value: luthor's actions in bringing the two earths into contact will unintentionally result in the two earths merging into the same space and destroying each other with the jla and csa being powerless to stop it due to their being on earths where they by the nature of the respective universes cannot win
lines.name: English

lines.value: brainiac anticipated this and has prepared himself to collect the energy released by the destroyed earths evolving into an nth level intelligence and essentially becoming a god
lines.name: English

lines.value: attempting to stop the collision superman discovers that this brainiac is a biological organism superman's code against killing prevents him from harming brainiac
lines.name: English

lines.value: convinced now that only evil could win on the antimatter earth superman and wonder woman refrain from trying to defeat brainiac themselves
lines.name: English

lines.value: flash switches the teams back to their respective earths
lines.name: English

lines.value: upon arrival a vengeful ultraman gives brainiac a laser vision lobotomy to ensure that he never poses a threat again
lines.name: English

lines.value: the two earths return to their own spaces and each team ponders their counterparts on the other side of the dimensional barrier
lines.name: English

lines.value: * in the justice league two parter episode a better world featured an alternative world ruled by a villainous justice league counterparts called the justice lords
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the episode the justice league are carried to another earth in which the lords lobotomize the villains and lock them in arkham asylum
lines.name: English

lines.value: they fought against the justice league but at the final they were defeated by the league with the special help of batman and lex luthor
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to the production team they originally wanted to make an adaptation of jla earth 2 featuring the crime syndicate of america but the idea was finally scrapped in favor of the justice lords
lines.name: English

lines.value: * forever evil a similar storyline in the new 52
lines.name: English

lines.value: the northern cavefish or northern blindfish amblyopsis spelaea is found in caves through kentucky and southern indiana
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is listed as a threatened species in the united states and the iucn lists the species as near threatened
lines.name: English

lines.value: during a 2013 study of amblyopsis spelaea scientists found that the species was divided into two distinct evolutionary lineages one north of the ohio river in indiana and one south of the river in kentucky
lines.name: English

lines.value: the southern population retained the name a
lines.name: English

lines.value: spelaea and the northern was redesignated amblyopsis hoosieri in a 2014 paper published in the journal zookeys
lines.name: English

lines.value: neither species is found north of the white river flowing east to west south of bedford indiana
lines.name: English

lines.value: twist is poker jargon for a round with specific rules which is sometimes used in the poker variant stud poker
lines.name: English

lines.value: one can replace any round of or add a round to a stud poker game with a twist round in which each player is offered the option to replace exactly one card in his hand with a new one from the remaining deck stub
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is similar to the draw phase of draw poker differing in the following way if the player chooses to replace a downcard he discards it and is dealt a replacement card also face down if he wishes to replace an upcard he discards it and receives the replacement face up.on a twist round players make the decision of which card to replace in turn starting with the player who bet first on the preceding round usually the player whose upcards make the best hand discarding the card they choose to replace if any
lines.name: English

lines.value: after everyone has made their decision the replacement cards are dealt starting at the dealer's left as usual
lines.name: English

lines.value: sometimes replacement cards are bought by requiring a player to add a fixed amount to the pot to be able to get a replacement
lines.name: English

lines.value: colemanballs is a term coined by private eye magazine to describe verbal gaffes perpetrated by sports commentators
lines.name: English

lines.value: coleman refers to the surname of the former bbc broadcaster david coleman and the suffix balls as in to balls up and has since spawned derivative terms in unrelated fields such as warballs spurious references to the september 11 2001 attacks and dianaballs sentimental references to diana princess of wales and borisballs boris johnson
lines.name: English

lines.value: any other subject can be covered as long as it is appropriately suffixed by balls
lines.name: English

lines.value: the all encompassing term mediaballs has since been used by private eye as its coverage of gaffes has expanded
lines.name: English

lines.value: the term balls was first associated with coleman in 1957 when he was at bbc midlands sutton coldfield presenting a saturday night 15-minute roundup of the day's football in the midlands
lines.name: English

lines.value: a technical hitch occurred and there was a black out but coleman could be heard calling out to the technician in the studio trust you to make a balls of that coleman's association with these verbal slips is so strong that he is often given erroneous credit for the earliest example specifically referenced as a colemanballs in fact the broadcaster responsible was a fellow bbc commentator ron pickering
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the 1976 summer olympics in montreal pickering commentated on a race involving the cuban double gold medallist alberto juantorena whose muscular build and nine foot stride contributed to his nickname el caballo the horse
lines.name: English

lines.value: pickering said and there goes juantorena down the back straight opening his legs and showing his class
lines.name: English

lines.value: an early example of what might now be classed as a colemanballs occurred in the 1949 oxford cambridge boat race when bbc commentator john snagge said i can't see who's in the lead but it's either oxford or cambridge
lines.name: English

lines.value: clive james in a television review for the observer collected in visions before midnight reported frank bough as introducing a boxing match by saying harry commentator is your carpenter referring to harry carpenter
lines.name: English

lines.value: james missed the famous moment as he writes
lines.name: English

lines.value: another regular contributor to the section until his retirement was motor racing commentator murray walker
lines.name: English

lines.value: his excitable delivery led to so many mistakes that they began to be labelled murrayisms
lines.name: English

lines.value: examples include we've had cars going off left right and centre do my eyes deceive me or is senna's lotus sounding rough and with half of the race gone there is half of the race still to go
lines.name: English

lines.value: however only walker himself could utter a murrayism while colemanballs remained the more generic term attributable to any commentator
lines.name: English

lines.value: irish commentator george hamilton's penchant for the phrase danger here has even spawned a website in honour of his gaffes on the microphone particularly while commenting on international football matches involving the republic of ireland including this one in an ireland versus spain qualifier match
lines.name: English

lines.value: he's pulling him off
lines.name: English

lines.value: the spanish manager is pulling his captain off in rugby union murray mexted has made many notable contributions to the field of memorable commentators gaffes
lines.name: English

lines.value: private eye's colemanballs column has now expanded to include occasional quotes from sportsmen themselves e.g frank bruno's that's cricket harry you get these sort of things in boxing politicians john major's when your back's against the wall it's time to turn round and fight and malapropisms from other public figures
lines.name: English

lines.value: in terms of classification of the individual examples these fall into a number of distinct groups including tautologies such as stronsay is an island surrounded by sea and coleman's own he's 31 this year &ndash last year he was 30 unintentional s where the viewer listener knows what is meant such as brendan foster by himself with 20000 people or i am not a man of faith but my wife is and complete nonsense such as here they come every colour of the rainbow black white brown
lines.name: English

lines.value: others include the addition of pointless words or non sequiturs intended to add effect as in he came in from the outfield there like an absolute rabbit
lines.name: English

lines.value: one category with many examples is the use of the word literal to mean figurative as in and he missed the goal by literally a million miles
lines.name: English

lines.value: in most cases it is possible to see the speaker's underlying intent even if the delivery has left something to be desired
lines.name: English

lines.value: yet another group is that of unintended puns such as there were 150 drug related deaths in glasgow last year an all time high
lines.name: English

lines.value: perhaps the most famous colemanballs is that of brian johnston announcing that the bowler's holding the batsman's willey on a bbc radio test match special although this may be apocryphal
lines.name: English

lines.value: in america jerry coleman a former baseball player not related to david coleman became known for similar statements as an announcer such as rich folkers is throwing up in the bullpen and winfield goes back to the wall he hits his head on the wall
lines.name: English

lines.value: and it rolls off
lines.name: English

lines.value: it's rolling all the way back to second base
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is a terrible thing for the padres in spite of these statements which earned him the nickname the master of the malaprop he was honored by the baseball hall of fame with the ford frick award their lifetime achievement award for announcers
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the philippines courtside reporter chino trinidad referred to philippine basketball association commentators bill velasco and butch maniego as bull and bitch with a spoonerism
lines.name: English

lines.value: private eye has issued compilations of colemanballs in book form
lines.name: English

lines.value: marie louise maria ludovica leopoldina franziska therese josepha lucia italian maria luigia leopoldina francesca teresa giuseppa lucia 12 december 1791 - 17 december 1847 was an austrian archduchess who reigned as duchess of parma from 1814 until her death
lines.name: English

lines.value: she was napoleon's second wife and as such empress of the french from 1810 to 1814
lines.name: English

lines.value: as the eldest child of the habsburg emperor francis ii of austria and his second wife maria theresa of naples and sicily marie louise grew up during a period of continuous conflict between austria and revolutionary france
lines.name: English

lines.value: a series of military defeats at the hands of napoleon bonaparte had inflicted a heavy human toll on austria and led francis to dissolve the holy roman empire
lines.name: English

lines.value: the end of the war of the fifth coalition resulted in the marriage of napoleon and marie louise in 1810 which ushered in a brief period of peace and friendship between austria and the french empire
lines.name: English

lines.value: marie louise agreed to the marriage despite being raised to despise france
lines.name: English

lines.value: she was adored by napoleon who had been eager to marry a member of one of europe's leading royal houses to cement his relatively young empire
lines.name: English

lines.value: with napoleon she bore a son styled the king of rome at birth later duke of reichstadt who briefly succeeded him as napoleon ii
lines.name: English

lines.value: napoleon's fortunes changed dramatically in 1812 after his failed invasion of russia
lines.name: English

lines.value: the european powers including austria resumed hostilities towards france in the war of the sixth coalition which ended with the abdication of napoleon and his exile to elba
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 1814 treaty of fontainebleau handed over the duchies of parma piacenza and guastalla to empress marie louise
lines.name: English

lines.value: she ruled the duchies until her death
lines.name: English

lines.value: marie louise married morganatically twice after napoleon's death in 1821
lines.name: English

lines.value: her second husband was count adam albert von neipperg married 1821 an equerry she met in 1814
lines.name: English

lines.value: she and neipperg had three children
lines.name: English

lines.value: after neipperg's death she married count charles rene de bombelles her chamberlain in 1834
lines.name: English

lines.value: marie louise died in parma in 1847
lines.name: English

lines.value: archduchess marie louise of austria who was given the latin baptismal name of maria ludovica leopoldina francisca theresa josepha lucia was born at the hofburg palace in vienna on 12 december 1791 to archduke francis of austria and his second wife maria theresa of naples and sicily
lines.name: English

lines.value: she was named after her grandmother marie louise holy roman empress
lines.name: English

lines.value: her father became holy roman emperor a year later as francis ii
lines.name: English

lines.value: marie louise was a great granddaughter of empress maria theresa through both her parents as they were first cousins
lines.name: English

lines.value: she was also a maternal granddaughter of queen maria carolina of naples marie antoinette's favorite sister
lines.name: English

lines.value: marie louise's formative years were during a period of conflict between france and her family
lines.name: English

lines.value: she was brought up to detest france and french ideas
lines.name: English

lines.value: marie louise was influenced by her grandmother maria carolina who despised the french revolution which ultimately caused the death of her sister marie antoinette
lines.name: English

lines.value: maria carolina's kingdom of naples had also come into direct conflict with french forces led by napoleon bonaparte
lines.name: English

lines.value: the war of the third coalition brought austria to the brink of ruin which increased marie louise's resentment towards napoleon
lines.name: English

lines.value: the imperial family was forced to flee vienna in 1805
lines.name: English

lines.value: marie louise took refuge in hungary and later galicia before returning to vienna in 1806
lines.name: English

lines.value: her father relinquished the title of holy roman emperor but remained emperor of austria
lines.name: English

lines.value: to make her more marriageable her parents had her tutored in many languages
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition to her native german she became fluent in english french italian latin and spanish
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1807 when marie louise was 15 her mother died after suffering a miscarriage
lines.name: English

lines.value: less than a year later emperor francis married his first cousin maria ludovika beatrix of austria este who was four years older than marie louise
lines.name: English

lines.value: nonetheless maria ludovika beatrix took on a maternal role towards her stepdaughter
lines.name: English

lines.value: she was also bitter towards the french who had deprived her father of the duchy of modena
lines.name: English

lines.value: another war broke out between france and austria in 1809 which resulted in defeat for the austrians again
lines.name: English

lines.value: the imperial family had to flee vienna again before the city surrendered on may 12
lines.name: English

lines.value: their journey was hampered by bad weather and they arrived in buda wet through and nearly worn out with fatigue
lines.name: English

lines.value: after escaping an assassination attempt in vienna while negotiating the treaty of schonbrunn on 12 october 1809 emperor napoleon decided that he needed an heir to cement his relatively young empire
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also sought the validation and legitimization of his empire by marrying a member of one of the leading royal families of europe
lines.name: English

lines.value: he began proceedings to divorce josephine de beauharnais who did not bear him a son and began searching for a new empress
lines.name: English

lines.value: his wish to marry grand duchess anna pavlovna of russia the youngest daughter of tsar paul i of russia caused alarm in austria who were afraid of being sandwiched between two great powers allied with each other
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the persuasion of count metternich a marriage between napoleon and marie louise was suggested by emperor francis to the count of narbonne but no official overture was made by the austrians
lines.name: English

lines.value: though officials in paris and austria were beginning to accept the possibility of the union marie louise was kept uninformed of developments
lines.name: English

lines.value: frustrated by the russians delaying the marriage negotiations napoleon rescinded his proposal in late january 1810 and began negotiations to marry marie louise with the austrian ambassador the prince of schwarzenberg
lines.name: English

lines.value: schwarzenberg signed the marriage contract on 7 february
lines.name: English

lines.value: marie louise was informed of the marriage by metternich
lines.name: English

lines.value: when asked for consent she replied i wish only what my duty commands me to wish
lines.name: English

lines.value: marie louise was married by proxy to napoleon on march 11 1810 at the augustinian church vienna
lines.name: English

lines.value: napoleon was represented by archduke charles the bride's uncle
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to the french ambassador the marriage was celebrated with a magnificence that it would be hard to surpass by the side of which even the brilliant festivities that have preceded it are not to be mentioned she became empress of the french and queen of italy
lines.name: English

lines.value: marie louise departed vienna on march 13 probably expecting never to return
lines.name: English

lines.value: upon arriving in france she was placed in the custody of napoleon's sister who had her put through a symbolic old ritual
lines.name: English

lines.value: tradition dictated that a royal bride coming to france must keep nothing of her homeland especially her clothes
lines.name: English

lines.value: accordingly marie louise was stripped of her gown corset stockings and chemise leaving her completely naked
lines.name: English

lines.value: napoleon's sister then made the nude teenager take a bath
lines.name: English

lines.value: she was then redressed in french bridal clothes
lines.name: English

lines.value: marie antoinette had been put through a similar ritual when she arrived in france in 1770
lines.name: English

lines.value: she met napoleon for the first time on march 27 in compiegne remarking to him you are much better looking than your portrait the civil wedding was held at the saint joseph's church on 1 april 1810
lines.name: English

lines.value: the next day napoleon and marie louise made the journey to paris in the coronation coach
lines.name: English

lines.value: the imperial guard cavalry led the procession followed by the herald at arms and then the carriages
lines.name: English

lines.value: the marshals of france rode on each side near the doors of the carriages
lines.name: English

lines.value: the procession arrived at the tuileries palace and the imperial couple made their way to the salon carre chapel in the louvre for the religious wedding ceremony
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ceremony was conducted by the cardinal grand almoner of france
lines.name: English

lines.value: a bridal march was composed for the occasion by ferdinando paer
lines.name: English

lines.value: by this marriage napoleon became the great nephew in law of louis xvi and marie antoinette
lines.name: English

lines.value: marie louise was an obedient wife and settled in quickly in the french court
lines.name: English

lines.value: she developed a close friendship with her premiere dame d'honneur the duchess of montebello while most of the daily affairs were handled by her dame d'atour jeanne charlotte du lucay
lines.name: English

lines.value: napoleon initially remarked that he had married a womb to an aide but their relationship soon grew
lines.name: English

lines.value: he spared no pains to please her and claimed at one point to prefer marie louise to his first wife josephine while he had loved josephine and though he claimed josephine remained his greatest friend even after their amicable divorce he had not respected her whereas with marie louise there was never a lie never a debt &mdash presumably a reference to josephine's rumoured extramarital affairs and reputation as a spendthrift
lines.name: English

lines.value: marie louise wrote to her father i assure you dear papa that people have done great injustice to the emperor
lines.name: English

lines.value: the better one knows him the better one appreciates and loves him however the marriage was not without tension napoleon sometimes remarked to aides that marie louise was too shy and timid compared to the outgoing and passionate josephine with whom he remained in close contact upsetting marie louise
lines.name: English

lines.value: the excitement surrounding the wedding ushered in a period of peace and friendship between france and austria who had been largely at war for the last two decades
lines.name: English

lines.value: the people of vienna who hated napoleon only months before were suddenly in full praise of the french emperor
lines.name: English

lines.value: flattering letters were sent between napoleon and emperor francis empress maria ludovika beatrix and archduke charles during the wedding festivities
lines.name: English

lines.value: during public occasions marie louise spoke little due to reserve and timidity which some observers mistook for haughtiness
lines.name: English

lines.value: she was regarded as a virtuous woman and never interfered in politics
lines.name: English

lines.value: privately she was polite and gentle
lines.name: English

lines.value: marie louise became pregnant by july 1810 and gave birth to a son on 20 march 1811
lines.name: English

lines.value: the boy napoleon francois joseph charles bonaparte was given the title king of rome in accordance with the practice where the heir apparent to the holy roman empire was called the king of the romans
lines.name: English

lines.value: napoleon was delighted that his wife survived the ordeal and said i had rather never have any more children than see her suffer so much again marie louise was devoted to her son she had him brought to her every morning and visited him in his apartment in the course of the day
lines.name: English

lines.value: in may 1812 a month before the french invasion of russia marie louise accompanied napoleon to dresden where she met her father and stepmother
lines.name: English

lines.value: emperor francis told napoleon he could count on austria for the triumph of the common cause a reference to the impending war
lines.name: English

lines.value: a minor rivalry began to develop between marie louise and the empress of austria who was jealous at being upstaged in appearance by her stepdaughter
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was also in dresden where she met count adam albert von neipperg for the first time
lines.name: English

lines.value: napoleon left dresden on may 29 to take charge of his army
lines.name: English

lines.value: marie louise then travelled to prague where she spent a few weeks with the austrian imperial family before returning to saint cloud on july 18
lines.name: English

lines.value: she kept in touch with napoleon throughout the war
lines.name: English

lines.value: the invasion of russia ended disastrously for france
lines.name: English

lines.value: more than half of the grande armee was destroyed by the russian winter and guerrilla attacks
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the failed malet coup of october 1812 napoleon hastened his return to france and reunited with his wife on the night of december 18
lines.name: English

lines.value: the weakened french position triggered the sixth coalition
lines.name: English

lines.value: prussia and the united kingdom joined russia in declaring war on france but austria stayed out due to relations between the imperial families
lines.name: English

lines.value: on march 30 marie louise was appointed regent as napoleon set off for battle in germany
lines.name: English

lines.value: the regency was only de jure as all decisions were still taken by napoleon and implemented by his most senior officials including lebrun joseph bonaparte talleyrand and savary
lines.name: English

lines.value: marie louise tried unsuccessfully to get her father to ally with france
lines.name: English

lines.value: austria too joined the opposition to france
lines.name: English

lines.value: she maintained a correspondence with napoleon informing him of increasing demands for peace in paris and the provinces
lines.name: English

lines.value: napoleon was decisively defeated in leipzig on october 19 and returned to saint cloud on november 9
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 23 january 1814 marie louise was appointed regent for the second time
lines.name: English

lines.value: on january 25 at 03:00 in the morning napoleon embraced marie louise and his son for the last time
lines.name: English

lines.value: he left to lead a hastily formed army to stave off the allied invasion from the north
lines.name: English

lines.value: as the allies neared paris marie louise was reluctant to leave
lines.name: English

lines.value: she felt that as the daughter of the sovereign of austria one of the allied members she would be treated with respect by allied forces with the possibility of her son succeeding the throne should napoleon be deposed
lines.name: English

lines.value: she was also afraid that her departure would strengthen the royalist supporters of the bourbons
lines.name: English

lines.value: marie louise was finally persuaded to leave by henri clarke who received the order from napoleon i would prefer to know that they [the empress and the king of rome] are both at the bottom of the seine rather than in the hands of the foreigners on march 29 the court left paris
lines.name: English

lines.value: the allies entered the city the following day
lines.name: English

lines.value: marie louise and the court moved to blois which was safe from the allies
lines.name: English

lines.value: she did not expect her father to dethrone napoleon and deprive her son of the crown of france
lines.name: English

lines.value: on april 3 the senate at the instigation of talleyrand announced the deposition of the emperor
lines.name: English

lines.value: marie louise was unaware of this until april 7 and was astonished to discover the turn of events
lines.name: English

lines.value: she wanted to return to paris but was dissuaded from doing so by physician jean nicolas corvisart and the duchess of montebello
lines.name: English

lines.value: napoleon abdicated the throne on 11 april 1814 in fontainebleau
lines.name: English

lines.value: the treaty of fontainebleau exiled him to elba allowed marie louise to retain her imperial rank and style and made her ruler of the duchies of parma piacenza and guastalla with her son as heir
lines.name: English

lines.value: this arrangement was later revised at the congress of vienna
lines.name: English

lines.value: marie louise was strongly dissuaded from rejoining her husband by her advisors who fed her accounts that napoleon was distraught with grief over the death of josephine
lines.name: English

lines.value: on april 16 her father arrived at blois to meet her
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the advice of emperor francis marie louise departed rambouillet with her son for vienna on april 23
lines.name: English

lines.value: at vienna she stayed at schonbrunn where she received frequent visits from her sisters but rarely from her father and stepmother
lines.name: English

lines.value: she met her grandmother maria carolina who disapproved of her deserting her husband
lines.name: English

lines.value: distressed at being seen as a heartless wife and indifferent mother she wrote on 9 august 1814 i am in a very unhappy and critical position i must be very prudent in my conduct
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are moments when that thought so distracts me that i think that the best thing i could do would be to die
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the summer of 1814 emperor francis sent count adam albert von neipperg to accompany marie louise to the spa town of aix les bains to prevent her from joining napoleon on elba
lines.name: English

lines.value: neipperg was a confidant of metternich and an enemy of napoleon
lines.name: English

lines.value: marie louise fell in love with neipperg
lines.name: English

lines.value: he became her chamberlain and her advocate at the congress of vienna
lines.name: English

lines.value: news of the relationship was not received well by the french and the austrian public
lines.name: English

lines.value: when napoleon escaped in march 1815 and reinstated his rule the allies once again declared war
lines.name: English

lines.value: marie louise was asked by her stepmother to join in the processions to pray for the success of the austrian armies but rejected the insulting invitation
lines.name: English

lines.value: she passed a message to napoleon's private secretary claude francois de meneval who was about to return to france i hope he will understand the misery of my position i shall never assent to a divorce but i flatter myself that he will not oppose an amicable separation and that he will not bear any ill feeling towards me this separation has become imperative it will in no way affect the feelings of esteem and gratitude that i preserve napoleon was defeated for the last time at the battle of waterloo and was exiled to saint helena from october 1815
lines.name: English

lines.value: napoleon made no further attempt to contact her personally
lines.name: English

lines.value: the congress of vienna recognised marie louise as ruler of parma piacenza and guastalla but prevented her from bringing her son to italy
lines.name: English

lines.value: it also made her duchess of parma for her life only as the allies did not want a descendant of napoleon to have a hereditary claim over parma
lines.name: English

lines.value: marie louise departed for parma on 7 march 1816 accompanied by neipperg
lines.name: English

lines.value: she entered the duchy on april 18
lines.name: English

lines.value: she wrote to her father people welcomed me with such enthusiasm that i had tears in my eyes she largely left the running of day to day affairs to neipperg who received instructions from metternich
lines.name: English

lines.value: in december 1816 marie louise removed the incumbent prime minister and installed neipperg
lines.name: English

lines.value: she and neipperg had three children her first son then known as franz was given the title duke of reichstadt in 1818
lines.name: English

lines.value: franz lived at the austrian court where he was shown great affection by his grandfather but was constantly undermined by austrian ministers and nationalists who did their best to sideline him to become an irrelevance
lines.name: English

lines.value: there were fears that he might be smuggled over to france to regain the throne as he could be easily disguised as a girl
lines.name: English

lines.value: franz grew resentful at his austrian relatives and his mother for their lack of support and began identifying as napoleon ii and surrounding himself with french courtiers
lines.name: English

lines.value: the relationship with his mother broke down to such an extent that he once remarked if josephine had been my mother my father would not have been buried at saint helena and i should not be at vienna
lines.name: English

lines.value: my mother is kind but weak she was not the wife my father deserved josephine was however before anything could become of napoleon ii he died at the age of 21 in vienna in 1832 after suffering from tuberculosis
lines.name: English

lines.value: 1831 saw the outbreak of the carbonari led uprisings in italy
lines.name: English

lines.value: in parma protesters gathered in the streets to denounce the austrian appointed prime minister josef von werklein
lines.name: English

lines.value: marie louise did not know what to do and wanted to leave the city but was prevented from doing so by the protesters who saw her as someone who would listen to their demands
lines.name: English

lines.value: she managed to leave parma between 14 and 15 february and a provisional government led by count filippo luigi linati was formed
lines.name: English

lines.value: at piacenza she wrote to her father asking him to replace werklein
lines.name: English

lines.value: francis sent in austrian troops which crushed the rebellion
lines.name: English

lines.value: to avoid further turmoil marie louise granted amnesty to the dissidents on september 29
lines.name: English

lines.value: metternich sent charles rene de bombelles to marie louise's household in 1833
lines.name: English

lines.value: six months after his arrival on 17 february 1834 she married him again morganatically
lines.name: English

lines.value: marie louise fell ill on 9 december 1847
lines.name: English

lines.value: her condition worsened for the next few days
lines.name: English

lines.value: on december 17 she passed out after vomiting and never woke up again
lines.name: English

lines.value: she died in the evening
lines.name: English

lines.value: the cause of death was determined to be pleurisy
lines.name: English

lines.value: her body was transferred back to vienna and buried at the imperial crypt
lines.name: English

lines.value: her arms as duchess of parma are used as the logo of the perfume company acqua di parma
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is in homage to the role she played in helping to develop the perfume and glass industry of parma
lines.name: English

lines.value: goodrich is a city in polk county texas united states
lines.name: English

lines.value: the population was 271 at the 2010 census
lines.name: English

lines.value: goodrich is located at 30.607139 -94.946995
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to the united states census bureau the city has a total area of all of it land
lines.name: English

lines.value: as of the census of 2000 there were 243 people 90 households and 66 families residing in the city
lines.name: English

lines.value: the population density was 343.9 people per square mile 132.1/km²
lines.name: English

lines.value: there were 119 housing units at an average density of 168.4/sq mi 64.7/km²
lines.name: English

lines.value: the racial makeup of the city was 71.19% white 14.40% african american 2.88% asian 9.05% from other races and 2.47% from two or more races
lines.name: English

lines.value: hispanic or latino of any race were 14.81% of the population
lines.name: English

lines.value: there were 90 households out of which 35.6% had children under the age of 18 living with them 56.7% were married couples living together 11.1% had a female householder with no husband present and 25.6% were non families
lines.name: English

lines.value: 23.3% of all households were made up of individuals and 6.7% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older
lines.name: English

lines.value: the average household size was 2.70 and the average family size was 3.19
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the city the population was spread out with 28.0% under the age of 18 9.1% from 18 to 24 27.6% from 25 to 44 19.3% from 45 to 64 and 16.0% who were 65 years of age or older
lines.name: English

lines.value: the median age was 36 years
lines.name: English

lines.value: for every 100 females there were 94.4 males
lines.name: English

lines.value: for every 100 females age 18 and over there were 92.3 males
lines.name: English

lines.value: the median income for a household in the city was $23125 and the median income for a family was $26786
lines.name: English

lines.value: males had a median income of $23438 versus $10625 for females
lines.name: English

lines.value: the per capita income for the city was $9354
lines.name: English

lines.value: about 25.7% of families and 34.6% of the population were below the poverty line including 33.3% of those under the age of eighteen and 29.6% of those sixty five or over
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city of goodrich is served by the goodrich independent school district and home to the goodrich high school hornets
lines.name: English
