lines.value: anklam [] formerly known as tanglim and wendenburg is a town in the western pomerania region of mecklenburg vorpommern germany
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is situated on the banks of the peene river just 8 km from its mouth in the kleines haff the western part of the stettin lagoon
lines.name: English

lines.value: anklam has a population of 14603 2005 and was the capital of the former ostvorpommern district
lines.name: English

lines.value: since september 2011 it has been part of the district of vorpommern greifswald
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the early middle ages there was an important scandinavian and wendish settlement in the area near the present town now known as altes lager menzlin
lines.name: English

lines.value: anklam proper began as an associated wendish fortress
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the middle ages the town was a part of the duchy of pomerania
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the german expansion eastwards the abandoned fortress was developed into a settlement named tanglim after its new founder
lines.name: English

lines.value: the site possesses importance as the head of navigation on the peene
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was elevated to town status in 1244 and became a member of the hanseatic league the same year or in 1483
lines.name: English

lines.value: the town remained small and non influential but achieved a measure of wealth and prosperity with its membership
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a town of considerable military importance it suffered greatly during the thirty years war when swedish and imperial troops battled over it across a twenty year span
lines.name: English

lines.value: amid this and subsequent wars it also endured repeated outbreaks of fire and plague
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was occupied by imperial forces from 1627 to 1630 and thereafter by swedish forces
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the war anklam became part of swedish pomerania in 1648
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1676 it was captured by frederick william of brandenburg
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1713 anklam was looted by soldiers of the russian empire
lines.name: English

lines.value: that it was not burned to the ground as ordered by peter the great was in large part due to the resistance of christian thomesen carl carlson after whom a street is named in remembrance
lines.name: English

lines.value: the southern parts of the town were ceded to prussia by the 1720 treaty of stockholm while a smaller section north of the peene remained swedish
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was damaged again during the seven years war in the 1750s and 60s with its fortifications being effectively dismantled in 1762
lines.name: English

lines.value: sweden yielded its remaining part of the town in 1815 when all of western pomerania became part of the prussian province of pomerania
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the 19th century anklam was connected with berlin and stettin by rail and developed its manufacture of linen and woolen goods leather beer and soap
lines.name: English

lines.value: its 1871 population was 10739 which had risen to 14602 by the turn of the century
lines.name: English

lines.value: by the time of the first world war it possessed a military school and developed iron foundries and sugar factories
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1939 the wehrmacht took over the military school and constructed a military prison on the grounds
lines.name: English

lines.value: anklam was nearly completely destroyed by several bombing raids of the us air force in 1943 and 1944 and in the last days of world war ii when the advancing soviets burned and leveled most of the town
lines.name: English

lines.value: after prussia and its pomeranian province were dissolved and most of pomerania was allocated to poland under the terms of the potsdam conference anklam became part of the east german state of mecklenburg vorpommern
lines.name: English

lines.value: that was soon to be dissolved too and anklam was within the district of neubrandenburg
lines.name: English

lines.value: the town was rebuilt in the rather uniform socialist style
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the 1990 reunification of germany anklam became part of the state of mecklenburg vorpommern recreated at that time
lines.name: English

lines.value: anklam was a prosperous medieval city but suffered severely during the thirty years war the seven years war and the second world war as well as from periodic fires
lines.name: English

lines.value: nonetheless anklam has some significant buildings remaining
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 12th-century church of st mary was rebuilt in the 15th century had a modern spire added in the 19th and was repaired in 1947
lines.name: English

lines.value: anklam is connected with the autobahn 20 coastal highway
lines.name: English

lines.value: * anklam railway station is served by national and local services to angermunde berlin dresden eberswalde frankfurt munich prague and stralsund
lines.name: English

lines.value: * johann franz buddeus 1667-1729 philosopher theologian professor in halle and jena
lines.name: English

lines.value: anklam is twinned with
lines.name: English

lines.value: * swedish pomerania
lines.name: English

lines.value: the five year plans for the development of the national economy of the soviet union ussr (, pjatiletnije plany razvitiya narodnogo khozyaystva sssr consisted of a series of nationwide centralized economic plans in the soviet union beginning in the late 1920s
lines.name: English

lines.value: the soviet state planning committee gosplan developed these plans based on the theory of the productive forces that formed part of the ideology of the communist party for development of the soviet economy
lines.name: English

lines.value: fulfilling the current plan became the watchword of soviet bureaucracy see overview of the soviet economic planning process
lines.name: English

lines.value: most other communist states including the people's republic of china adopted a similar method of planning
lines.name: English

lines.value: nazi germany emulated the practice in its four year plan 1936-1939 designed by the nsdap to bring germany to war readiness
lines.name: English

lines.value: although the republic of indonesia under suharto is known for its anti communist purge his government also adopted the same method of planning
lines.name: English

lines.value: this series of five year plans in indonesia was termed repelita rencana pembangunan lima tahun plans i to vi ran from 1969 to 1998
lines.name: English

lines.value: several soviet five year plans did not take up the full period of time assigned to them some were pronounced successfully completed earlier than expected while others failed and were abandoned
lines.name: English

lines.value: altogether gosplan launched thirteen five year plans
lines.name: English

lines.value: the initial five year plans aimed to achieve rapid industrialization of the soviet union and thus placed a major focus on heavy industry
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first one accepted in 1928 for the period from 1929 to 1933 finished one year early
lines.name: English

lines.value: the last five year plan for the period from 1991 to 1995 was not completed since the soviet union dissolved in 1991
lines.name: English

lines.value: joseph stalin inherited and upheld the new economic policy nep from vladimir lenin
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1921 lenin had persuaded the 10th party congress to approve the nep as a replacement for the war communism that had been set up during the russian civil war
lines.name: English

lines.value: in war communism the state had assumed control of all means of production exchange and communication
lines.name: English

lines.value: all land had been declared nationalized by the decree on land finalized in the 1922 land code which also set collectivization as the long term goal
lines.name: English

lines.value: although the peasants had been allowed to work the land they held the production surplus was bought by the state on the state's terms the peasants cut production whereupon food was requisitioned
lines.name: English

lines.value: money gradually came to be replaced by barter and a system of coupons
lines.name: English

lines.value: the nep took over from the failed attempts of war communism
lines.name: English

lines.value: during this time the state had controlled all large enterprises i.e factories mines railways as well as enterprises of medium size but small private enterprises employing fewer than 20 people were allowed
lines.name: English

lines.value: the requisitioning of farm produce was replaced by a tax system a fixed proportion of the crop and the peasants were free to sell their surplus at a state regulated price although they were encouraged to join state farms sovkhozes set up on land expropriated from nobles after the 1917 revolution in which they worked for a fixed wage like workers in a factory
lines.name: English

lines.value: money came back into use with new bank notes being issued and backed by gold
lines.name: English

lines.value: the nep had been lenin's response to a crisis
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1920 industrial production had been 13% and agricultural production 20% of the 1913 figures
lines.name: English

lines.value: between february 21 and march 17 1921 the sailors in kronstadt had mutinied
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition the russian civil war which had been the main reason for the introduction of war communism had virtually been won and so controls could be relaxed
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the 1920s there was a great debate between bukharin tomsky and rykov on the one hand and trotsky zinoviev and kamenev on the other
lines.name: English

lines.value: the former group considered that the nep provided sufficient state control of the economy and sufficiently rapid development while the latter argued in favour of more rapid development and greater state control taking the view among other things that profits should be shared among all people and not just among a privileged few
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1925 at the 14th party congress stalin as he usually did in the early days stayed in the background but sided with the bukharin group
lines.name: English

lines.value: however later in 1927 he changed sides supporting those in favour of a new course with greater state control
lines.name: English

lines.value: each five year plan dealt with all aspects of development capital goods those used to produce other goods like factories and machinery consumer goods e.g chairs carpets and irons agriculture transportation communications health education and welfare
lines.name: English

lines.value: however the emphasis varied from plan to plan although generally the emphasis was on power electricity capital goods and agriculture
lines.name: English

lines.value: there were base and optimum targets
lines.name: English

lines.value: efforts were made especially in the third plan to move industry eastward to make it safer from attack during world war ii
lines.name: English

lines.value: soviet workers believed in the need for constant struggle struggle and struggle to achieve a communist society
lines.name: English

lines.value: these five year plans outlined programs for huge increases in the output of industrial goods
lines.name: English

lines.value: stalin warned that without an end to economic backwardness the advanced countries...will crush us
lines.name: English

lines.value: from 1928 to 1940 the number of soviet workers in industry construction and transport grew from 4.6 million to 12.6 million and factory output soared
lines.name: English

lines.value: stalin's first five year plan helped make the ussr a leading industrial nation
lines.name: English

lines.value: during this period the first purges were initiated targeting many people working for gosplan
lines.name: English

lines.value: these included vladimir bazarov the 1931 menshevik trial centered around vladimir groman
lines.name: English

lines.value: stalin announced the start of the first five year plan for industrialization on october 1 1928 and it lasted until december 31 1932
lines.name: English

lines.value: stalin described it as a new revolution from above
lines.name: English

lines.value: when this plan began the ussr was fifth in industrialization and with the great success of the first five year plan moved up to second with only the united states in first
lines.name: English

lines.value: this plan was achieved with great success in less time than had been predicted
lines.name: English

lines.value: when the plan was initially proposed it was instantly rejected as being too modest
lines.name: English

lines.value: the target goals were then increased by a reported 50%
lines.name: English

lines.value: much of the emphasis was placed on heavy industry
lines.name: English

lines.value: in fact 86% of all industrial investments during this time went directly to heavy industry
lines.name: English

lines.value: officially the first five year plan for industry was fulfilled to the extent of 93.7% in just four years and three months
lines.name: English

lines.value: the means of production in regards to heavy industry exceeded the quota registering 103.4%
lines.name: English

lines.value: the light or consumer goods industry reached up to 84.9% of its assigned quota
lines.name: English

lines.value: however there is some speculation regarding the legitimacy of these numbers as the nature of soviet statistics are notoriously misleading or exaggerated
lines.name: English

lines.value: another issue was that quality was sacrificed in order to achieve quantity and because of this production results generated wildly varied items
lines.name: English

lines.value: this great industrial push created a lack in consumer goods and shortages in rationing
lines.name: English

lines.value: propaganda used before during and after the first five year plan compared industry to battle
lines.name: English

lines.value: this was highly successful
lines.name: English

lines.value: they used terms such as fronts campaigns and breakthroughs while at the same time workers were forced to be working harder than ever before and were organized into shock troops and those who rebelled or failed to keep up with their work were treated as traitors as if they were in wartime
lines.name: English

lines.value: the posters and flyers used to promote and advertise the plan were also reminiscent of wartime propaganda
lines.name: English

lines.value: a popular military metaphor emerged from the economic success of the first five year plan there are no fortresses bolsheviks cannot storm stalin especially liked this
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first five year plan was not just about economics
lines.name: English

lines.value: this plan was a revolution that intended to transform all aspects of society
lines.name: English

lines.value: the way of life for the majority of the people changed drastically during this revolutionary time
lines.name: English

lines.value: the plan was also referred to as the great turn
lines.name: English

lines.value: individual peasant farming gave way to a more efficient system of collective farming
lines.name: English

lines.value: peasant property and entire villages were incorporated into the state economy which had its own market forces
lines.name: English

lines.value: there was however a strong resistance to this at first
lines.name: English

lines.value: the peasants led an all out attack to protect individual farming however stalin rightly did not see the peasants as a threat
lines.name: English

lines.value: despite being the largest segment of the population they had no real strength and thus could pose no serious threat to the state
lines.name: English

lines.value: by the time this was done the collectivization plan resembled a very bloody military campaign against the peasant's traditional lifestyle
lines.name: English

lines.value: this great social transformation along with the incredible economic boom occurred at the same time that the entire soviet system we know today developed its definitive form in the decade of 1930
lines.name: English

lines.value: many scholars believe that a few other important factors such as foreign policy and internal security went into the execution of the five year plan
lines.name: English

lines.value: while ideology and economics were a major part preparation for the upcoming war also affected all of the major parts of the five year plan
lines.name: English

lines.value: the war effort really picked up in 1933 when hitler came to power in germany
lines.name: English

lines.value: the stress this caused on internal security and control in the five year plan is difficult to document
lines.name: English

lines.value: stalin was very creative when it came time to announcing the results of the first five year plan
lines.name: English

lines.value: due to his complete unquestioned authority he never had to cite or give a single statistic fact or figure
lines.name: English

lines.value: while most of the figures were overstated stalin was able to announce truthfully that the plan had been achieved ahead of schedule however the many investments made to the west were excluded
lines.name: English

lines.value: while many factories were built and industrial production did increase exponentially they were not close to reaching their target numbers
lines.name: English

lines.value: while there was great success there were also many problems with not just the plan itself but how quickly it was completed
lines.name: English

lines.value: its approach to industrialization was very inefficient and extreme amounts of resources were put into construction that in many cases was never completed
lines.name: English

lines.value: these resources were also put into equipment that was never used or not even needed in the first place
lines.name: English

lines.value: many of the consumer goods produced during this time were of such low quality that they could never be used and were wasted
lines.name: English

lines.value: a major event during the first five year plan was the great famine
lines.name: English

lines.value: the famine peaked during the winter of 1932-1933 claiming the lives of an estimated five to seven million people
lines.name: English

lines.value: millions more permanently disabled
lines.name: English

lines.value: the famine was the direct result of the industrialization and collectivization implemented by the first five year plan
lines.name: English

lines.value: many of the peasants who were suffering from the famine began to sabotage the fulfillment's of their obligations to the state and would as often as they could stash away stores of food
lines.name: English

lines.value: although stalin was aware of this he placed the blame of the hostility onto the peasants saying that they had declared war against the soviet government
lines.name: English

lines.value: because of the successes made by the first plan stalin did not hesitate with going ahead with the second five year plan in 1932 although the official start date for the plan was 1933
lines.name: English

lines.value: the second five year plan gave heavy industry top priority putting the soviet union not far behind germany as one of the major steel producing countries of the world
lines.name: English

lines.value: further improvements were made in communications especially railways which became faster and more reliable
lines.name: English

lines.value: as was the case with the other five year plans the second was not as successful failing to reach the recommended production levels in such areas as the coal and oil industries
lines.name: English

lines.value: the second plan employed incentives as well as punishments and the targets were eased as a reward for the first plan being finished ahead of schedule in only four years
lines.name: English

lines.value: with the introduction of childcare mothers were encouraged to work to aid in the plan's success
lines.name: English

lines.value: by 1937 the tolkachi emerged occupying a key position mediating between the enterprises and the commissariat
lines.name: English

lines.value: this five year plan from 1932 to 1937 also included the liquidation of houses of worship with the goals of closing churches between 1932-1933 and the elimination of clergy by 1935-1936
lines.name: English

lines.value: the third five year plan ran for only 3 years up to 1941 when germany invaded the soviet union during the second world war
lines.name: English

lines.value: as war approached more resources were put into developing armaments tanks and weapons as well as constructing additional military factories east of the ural mountains
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first two years of the third five year plan proved to be even more of a disappointment in terms of proclaimed production goals
lines.name: English

lines.value: still a reported 12% to 13% rate of annual industrial growth was attained in the soviet union during the 1930s
lines.name: English

lines.value: the plan had intended to focus on consumer goods
lines.name: English

lines.value: the soviet union mainly contributed resources to the development of weapons and constructed additional military factories as needed
lines.name: English

lines.value: by 1952 industrial production was nearly double the 1941 level five-year plans
lines.name: English

lines.value: stalin's five year plans helped transform the soviet union from an untrained society of peasants to an advanced industrial economy
lines.name: English

lines.value: stalin in 1945 promised that the ussr would be the leading industrial power by 1960
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ussr at this stage had been devastated by the war
lines.name: English

lines.value: officially 98000 collective farms had been ransacked and ruined with the loss of 137000 tractors 49000 combine harvesters 7 million horses 17 million cattle 20 million pigs 27 million sheep 25% of all capital equipment had been destroyed in 35000 plants and factories 6 million buildings including 40000 hospitals in 70666 villages and 4710 towns 40% urban housing were destroyed leaving 25 million homeless about 40% of railway tracks had been destroyed officially 7.5 million servicemen died plus 6 million civilians but perhaps 20 million in all died
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1945 mining and metallurgy were at 40% of the 1940 levels electric power was down to 52% pig iron 26% and steel 45% food production was 60% of the 1940 level
lines.name: English

lines.value: after poland the ussr had been the hardest hit by the war
lines.name: English

lines.value: reconstruction was impeded by a chronic labor shortage due to the enormous number of soviet casualties in the war between 20-30 million
lines.name: English

lines.value: moreover 1946 was the driest year since 1891 and the harvest was poor
lines.name: English

lines.value: the usa and ussr were unable to agree on the terms of a us loan to aid reconstruction and this was a contributing factor in the rapid escalation of the cold war
lines.name: English

lines.value: however the ussr did gain reparations from germany and made eastern european countries make payments in return for the soviets having liberated them from the nazis
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1949 the council for mutual economic assistance comecon was set up linking the eastern bloc countries economically
lines.name: English

lines.value: one third of the fourth plan's capital expenditure was spent on ukraine which was important agriculturally and industrially and which had been one of the areas most devastated by war
lines.name: English

lines.value: another plan to improve industry was carried out in 1956 by nikita khrushchev following stalin's death in 1953
lines.name: English

lines.value: some of khrushchev's policies included nationalization the virgin lands campaign creation of a minimum wage alongside overall wage reform and the production of consumer goods which raised the living standards of the soviet people in return
lines.name: English

lines.value: unlike other planning periods 1959 saw the announcement of a seven year plan (, semiletka approved by the 21st congress of the communist party of the soviet union in 1959
lines.name: English

lines.value: this was merged into a seventh five year plan in 1961 which was launched with the slogan catch up and overtake the usa by 1970 the plan saw a slight shift away from heavy industry into chemicals consumer goods and natural resources
lines.name: English

lines.value: the eighth plan led to the amount of grain exported being doubled
lines.name: English

lines.value: about 14.5 million tonnes of grain were imported by the ussr
lines.name: English

lines.value: detente and improving relations between the soviet union and the united states allowed for more trade
lines.name: English

lines.value: the plan's focus was primarily on increasing the amount of consumer goods in the economy so as to improve soviet standards of living
lines.name: English

lines.value: while largely failing at that objective it managed to significantly improve soviet computer technology
lines.name: English

lines.value: leonid brezhnev declared the slogan plan of quality and efficiency for this period
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the eleventh five year plan the country imported some 42 million tons of grain annually almost twice as much as during the tenth five year plan and three times as much as during the ninth five year plan 1971-1975
lines.name: English

lines.value: the bulk of this grain was sold by the west in 1985 for example 94% of soviet grain imports were from the non socialist world with the united states selling 14.1 million tons
lines.name: English

lines.value: however total soviet export to the west was always almost as high as import for example in 1984 total export to the west was 21.3 billion rubles while total import was 19.6 billion rubles
lines.name: English

lines.value: the last 12th plan started with the slogan of uskoreniye the acceleration of economic development quickly forgotten in favor of a more vague motto perestroika ended in a profound economic crisis in virtually all areas of soviet economy and a drop in production
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 1987 law on state enterprise and the follow up decrees about khozraschyot and self financing in various areas of the soviet economy were aimed at the decentralization to overcome the problems of the planned economy
lines.name: English

lines.value: this plan which would have run until 1995 only lasted about one year due to the dissolution of the soviet union in 1991
lines.name: English

lines.value: state planning of the economy required processing large amounts of statistical data
lines.name: English

lines.value: the soviet state had nationalized the odhner arithmometer factory in saint petersburg after the revolution
lines.name: English

lines.value: the state began renting tabulating equipment later on
lines.name: English

lines.value: by 1929 it was a very large user of statistical machines on the scale of the us or germany
lines.name: English

lines.value: the state bank had tabulating machines in 14 branches
lines.name: English

lines.value: other users included the central statistical bureau the soviet commissariat of finance soviet commissariat of inspection soviet commissariat of foreign trade the grain trust soviet railways russian ford russian buick the karkov tractor factory and the tula armament works
lines.name: English

lines.value: the minor planet 2122 pyatiletka discovered in 1971 by soviet astronomer tamara mikhailovna smirnova is named in honor of five year plans of the ussr

lines.value: the free hanseatic city of bremen (, ) is the smallest and least populous of germany's 16 states
lines.name: English

lines.value: a more informal name but used in some official contexts is land bremen state of bremen
lines.name: English

lines.value: the state consists of the city of bremen as well as the small exclave of bremerhaven in northern germany surrounded by the larger state of lower saxony
lines.name: English

lines.value: the state of bremen consists of two separated enclaves
lines.name: English

lines.value: these enclaves contain bremen officially the city stadtgemeinde bremen which is the state capital and located in both enclaves and the city of bremerhaven stadt bremerhaven
lines.name: English

lines.value: both are located on the river weser bremerhaven is further downstream than the main parts of bremen and serves as a north sea harbour the name bremerhaven means bremen's harbour
lines.name: English

lines.value: both enclaves are completely surrounded by the neighbouring state of lower saxony niedersachsen
lines.name: English

lines.value: the two cities are the only administrative subdivisions the state has
lines.name: English

lines.value: the highest point in the state is in friedehorst park 32.5m
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the unwinding of the holy roman empire in 1806 the free imperial city of bremen as of 1646 after earlier privileges of autonomy of 1186 was not mediatised but became a sovereign state officially titled free hanseatic city of bremen
lines.name: English

lines.value: its currency was the bremen thaler until 1873
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1811 the first french empire annexed the city state
lines.name: English

lines.value: upon the first albeit only preliminary defeat of napoleon bonaparte bremen resumed its pre 1811 status as city state in 1813
lines.name: English

lines.value: the vienna congress of 1815 confirmed bremen's as well as frankfurt's hamburg's and lubeck's-independence after pressuring by bremen's emissary and later burgomaster johann smidt
lines.name: English

lines.value: bremen became one of 39 sovereign states of the german confederation
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1827 the state of bremen bought the tract of land from the kingdom of hanover where future bremerhaven would be established
lines.name: English

lines.value: bremen became part of the north german confederation in 1867 and became an autonomous component state of the new founded german empire in 1871 and stayed with germany in its following forms of government
lines.name: English

lines.value: bremen which in 1935 had become a regular city at the de facto abolition of statehood of all component german states within the third reich was reestablished as a state in 1947
lines.name: English

lines.value: being at that time actually located in the british zone of occupation the control commission for germany british element and the office of military government for germany us omgus agreed in 1947 to constitute the cities of bremen and then wesermunde-in their borders altered in 1939-as a german state named again free hanseatic city of bremen becoming at that occasion an exclave of the american zone of occupation within the british zone
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1949 the city state joined the then west german federal republic of germany
lines.name: English

lines.value: the legislature of the state of bremen is the burgerschaft citizens assembly elected by the citizens in the two cities of bremen and bremerhaven
lines.name: English

lines.value: the executive is constituted by the senate of bremen elected by the burgerschaft
lines.name: English

lines.value: the senate is chaired by the president of the senate senatsprasident who is also one of the mayors of the city of bremen burgermeister and is elected directly by the burgerschaft
lines.name: English

lines.value: the senate selects of its members as a second mayor who serves as deputy of the president
lines.name: English

lines.value: in contrast to the federal chancellor of germany or other german states the president of the senate has no authority to override senators on policy which is decided upon by the senate collectively
lines.name: English

lines.value: since 1945 the senate has continuously been dominated by the social democratic party
lines.name: English

lines.value: on a municipal level the two cities in the state are administered separately
lines.name: English

lines.value: dr henning scherf spd remained mayor and senate president in an spd cdu grand coalition
lines.name: English

lines.value: as promised he resigned after half of the legislative period
lines.name: English

lines.value: the mayor and senate president from 8 november 2005 until 17 july 2015 was jens bohrnsen
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 2007 elections were held on 13 may
lines.name: English

lines.name: English

lines.value: the university of bremen is the largest university in bremen
lines.name: English

lines.value: furthermore bremen has a university of the arts bremen a university of applied sciences in bremen and another one in bremerhaven and more recently the jacobs university bremen
