lines.value: the nashville sounds are a minor league baseball team of the pacific coast league pcl and the triple a affiliate of the oakland athletics
lines.name: English

lines.value: they are located in nashville tennessee and are named for the city's association with the music industry
lines.name: English

lines.value: the team plays its home games at first tennessee park which opened in 2015 and is partially located on the site of the historic sulphur dell ballpark
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds previously played at herschel greer stadium from its opening in 1978 until the end of the 2014 season
lines.name: English

lines.value: established as an expansion team of the double a southern league in 1978 the sounds were replaced by a triple a american association team in 1985
lines.name: English

lines.value: the triple a sounds carried on the history of the double a team that preceded it
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds later joined the pcl in 1998
lines.name: English

lines.value: the team has served as a farm club for seven major league franchises
lines.name: English

lines.value: a total of 27 managers have led the club and its nearly 1200 players
lines.name: English

lines.value: through the 2017 season the team has played in 5726 regular season games and compiled a win loss record of 2945-2781 ().
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds have reached the postseason on 14 occasions
lines.name: English

lines.value: they have won ten division titles two conference titles and three league championships
lines.name: English

lines.value: most recently they won the pcl championship in 2005 as the triple a affiliate of the milwaukee brewers
lines.name: English

lines.value: previous league titles won by the team are the southern league championship in 1979 as the double a affiliate of the cincinnati reds and again in 1982 as the double a affiliate of the new york yankees
lines.name: English

lines.value: the team has an overall postseason record of 42 41 ).the team fielded in 1980 was recognized as one of the 100 greatest minor league teams of all time
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 2006 team tied the record for the longest game in pcl history 24 innings
lines.name: English

lines.value: of the three nine inning perfect games in the history of the pcl two have been pitched by members of the sounds
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2016 forbes listed the sounds as the 19th-most valuable minor league baseball team with a value of $30.5 million
lines.name: English

lines.value: nashville has hosted minor league baseball teams since the late 19th century
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city's professional baseball history dates back to 1884 with the formation of the nashville americans who were charter members the original southern league from 1885 to 1886 and played their home games at athletic park later to be called sulphur dell
lines.name: English

lines.value: this ballpark was the home of nashville's minor league teams through 1963
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1887 nashville's southern league team was called the nashville blues
lines.name: English

lines.value: the nashville tigers competed for the city in the same league from 1893 to 1894
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1895 the nashville seraphs won the city's first professional championship in the southern league
lines.name: English

lines.value: the nashville centennials played in the central league in 1897 but relocated to henderson indiana during the season before the league's collapse
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city's longest operating baseball team first known as only the nashville baseball club and later nicknamed the nashville vols short for volunteers was formed in 1901 as a charter member of the southern association
lines.name: English

lines.value: they remained in the league through 1961 winning eight pennants nine playoff championships and four dixie series titles
lines.name: English

lines.value: the league disbanded after the 1961 season and no team was fielded in 1962 but the vols played one final season in the south atlantic league in 1963
lines.name: English

lines.value: sulphur dell was demolished in 1969 and the city went without a professional team for 14 years until 1978
lines.name: English

lines.value: larry schmittou head coach of the vanderbilt commodores baseball team from 1968 to 1978 was instrumental in bringing professional baseball back to nashville
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was inspired to get involved with minor league baseball when he observed the success chattanooga tennessee experienced when it acquired the birmingham barons relocated the team and renamed them the chattanooga lookouts in 1976
lines.name: English

lines.value: schmittou was told by multiple major league baseball teams that they would be willing to put a minor league affiliate in nashville if he provided a suitable ballpark
lines.name: English

lines.value: schmittou learned from a member of the metro board of parks and recreation that neither the park board or the city of nashville would be willing to pay for such a park
lines.name: English

lines.value: so schmittou along with help from country music star conway twitty put together a group of investors including other country stars cal smith larry gatlin jerry reed and richard sterban bass singer of the oak ridge boys as well as other nashvillians in order to finance a stadium and a minor league team
lines.name: English

lines.value: twenty shares valued at us$15000 each were issued with schmittou purchasing 2 shares or 10 percent of the team
lines.name: English

lines.value: the metro parks board agreed to lease to schmittou the site of nashville's former softball fields on the grounds of fort negley an american civil war fortification approximately two miles 3 km south of downtown for a period of 20 years as long he built a stadium with a minimum capacity of 6500 at a cost of at least $400000 within 10 years
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the second ten years he would be required to pay the city seven percent of the team's total revenue
lines.name: English

lines.value: the projected construction cost of the stadium was between $300000 and $500000 but the actual cost was over $1 million
lines.name: English

lines.value: schmittou looked to local suppliers to donate construction materials took out a $30000 loan from a bank sold season tickets and even mortgaged his own home to help pay for the stadium
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ballpark would be named herschel greer stadium in posthumous honor of herschel lynn greer a prominent nashville businessman and the first president of the nashville vols baseball team whose family donated $25000 for stadium construction
lines.name: English

lines.value: having secured a stadium schmittou and general manager farrell owens attended the 1976 winter meetings in hopes of landing a team
lines.name: English

lines.value: after sending letters to all 26 farm team directors the pair received a letter from sheldon chief bender of the cincinnati reds
lines.name: English

lines.value: bender met with schmittou and owens and he agreed to put a team in nashville provided a stadium was built
lines.name: English

lines.value: the team was then granted membership in the southern league a class double a league at an enfranchisement cost of $7500
lines.name: English

lines.value: schmittou invited fans to submit suggestions for the team's name which would be voted on by a group that included local sports writers and county musicians
lines.name: English

lines.value: among the finalists were stars notes hits strings kats pickers and vols
lines.name: English

lines.value: the chosen name sounds is a play on the term nashville sound a subgenre of american country music that traces its roots to the area in the late 1950s
lines.name: English

lines.value: the team's wordmark and color scheme were lifted from the memphis sounds of the american basketball association aba who used them from 1974 to 1975
lines.name: English

lines.value: when the aba merged with the national basketball association in 1976 some of the copyrights were allowed to lapse and nashville's baseball team adopted the abandoned scheme
lines.name: English

lines.value: the color blue was added to memphis red and white palette
lines.name: English

lines.value: nashville's original logo which was used from 1978 into 1998 and was initially sketched by schmittou reflected the city's association with the country music industry
lines.name: English

lines.value: it depicted a mustachioed old time baseball player nicknamed slugger swinging at a baseball with a guitar a staple of country music in place of a bat
lines.name: English

lines.value: further illustrating the city's musical ties was the typeface with letters resembling musical notes and treble clefs used to display the team name
lines.name: English

lines.value: with a team in place and a stadium under construction the nashville sounds were set to begin play in 1978 as an expansion team of the southern league
lines.name: English

lines.value: as the double a affiliate of the cincinnati reds the sounds played their first game on april 15 1978 against the memphis chicks at memphis tim mccarver stadium which they lost 4 2
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds recorded their first win the next evening defeating memphis 3 0
lines.name: English

lines.value: meanwhile construction on greer stadium continued in order to be ready for the home opener
lines.name: English

lines.value: the team had requested to open the season on the road and had to swap a series with the chattanooga lookouts in order to have enough time to complete the stadium
lines.name: English

lines.value: on april 26 the sounds played their first home game a 12 4 victory against the savannah braves in front of a sellout crowd of 8156 fans
lines.name: English

lines.value: the greer home opener was scheduled to take place the previous evening but was rained out
lines.name: English

lines.value: tractors and grading machines were still preparing the field on game day and the electricity was turned on only five minutes before the gates opened
lines.name: English

lines.value: much of the sod that been laid that winter died and the replacement sod arrived late leaving it to be laid the day before the scheduled opening game
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds finished their inaugural 1978 season under manager chuck goggin with a 64 77 record and failed to win either half of the southern league's split season leaving them out of the championship playoffs
lines.name: English

lines.value: bruce berenyi was selected as the league's most outstanding pitcher
lines.name: English

lines.value: the team incurred more success at the turnstiles than on the field
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds led all of minor league baseball in attendance by drawing 380000 fans in their first season
lines.name: English

lines.value: in fact nashville went on to lead the southern league in attendance in each of their seven seasons as a member of the league
lines.name: English

lines.value: larry schmittou's business philosophy revolved around earning profits not from ticket sales but from the sale of souvenirs and concessions
lines.name: English

lines.value: this philosophy also involved promoting entertainment value or fun as much or more than promoting the baseball game
lines.name: English

lines.value: the franchise was recognized for its promotion efforts when it won the larry macphail award for outstanding minor league promotions in 1978 1980 and 1981
lines.name: English

lines.value: schmittou was awarded the sporting news double a and southern league executive of the year awards in 1978 and 1981
lines.name: English

lines.value: under manager george scherger the sounds started the 1979 season poorly before rallying to win 20 of 31 games in late may and june
lines.name: English

lines.value: they entered the last day of the first half of the season in first place but lost their game to cross state rivals the memphis chicks and finished in second place
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds and chicks met again on the last day of the second half in a split doubleheader both games were won by nashville
lines.name: English

lines.value: the two teams then faced off in a best of three series to determine the western division champion
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds won the series two games to one before advancing to the southern league championship series against the columbus astros
lines.name: English

lines.value: nashville captured their first southern league championship by defeating the astros three games to one
lines.name: English

lines.value: schmittou wanted to give each player a $1000 bonus for winning the pennant but as that would have been against the national association's rules he settled for buying them championship rings instead
lines.name: English

lines.value: geoff combe with a league leading 27 saves won the league's most outstanding pitcher award
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds compiled an 83 61 record that season
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the all star break between the halves of the season nashville played host to the southern league all star game
lines.name: English

lines.value: the contest pitted a team of the league's all stars against the major league atlanta braves
lines.name: English

lines.value: the all stars defeated the braves five to two
lines.name: English

lines.value: nashville's duane walker was named the game's mvp
lines.name: English

lines.value: originally the reds allowed nashville to use a designated hitter dh in their lineups
lines.name: English

lines.value: however this allowance was later revoked as the reds were a part of the national league which did not use a dh
lines.name: English

lines.value: larry schmittou issued an ultimatum if cincinnati would not let the sounds use a dh in their lineups they would not renew their contract and would look for a new major league affiliate
lines.name: English

lines.value: the reds did not budge on their decision to prohibit the designated hitter so the sounds looked for a new affiliate after 1979
lines.name: English

lines.value: schmittou was then approached by five or six clubs looking to enter the southern league as a sounds affiliate
lines.name: English

lines.value: larry schmittou had originally been encouraged by the new york yankees organization to establish the sounds as a triple a team but he refused to go back on his previous promise to partner with the reds at double a
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the split with cincinnati the sounds made their first affiliation switch in 1980 becoming the double a affiliate of the yankees
lines.name: English

lines.value: under manager stump merrill the 1980 sounds finished the first half of the season one and a half games behind the memphis chicks
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the second half the team finished in first place 14 games ahead of the second place montgomery rebels
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the western division championship series nashville lost to memphis three games to one
lines.name: English

lines.value: nine southern league records were set during the season the team's pitching staff led the league in era and strikeouts and steve balboni the league mvp led the league with 101 runs 34 home runs 122 rbi and 288 total bases
lines.name: English

lines.value: pitcher andy mcgaffigan was selected as the league's top pitcher
lines.name: English

lines.value: the team also set a league attendance record when a total of 575676 fans visited greer stadium
lines.name: English

lines.value: this record still stands as of the completion of the 2016 season
lines.name: English

lines.value: their 97 46 record is the franchise's all time best
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2001 the 1980 sounds were ranked as the sixty ninth greatest minor league baseball team of all time by baseball historians
lines.name: English

lines.value: on april 16 1981 the new york yankees made a stop in nashville to play an exhibition game against the sounds
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 10 1 yankees victory was played in front of a standing room only crowd of 17318 fans
lines.name: English

lines.value: also on hand for the game were yankees owner george steinbrenner coach yogi berra and players reggie jackson bucky dent lou piniella bobby murcer goose gossage tommy john and johnny oates
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds won the second half of the season and went on to win the western division championship after defeating the memphis chicks in three straight games
lines.name: English

lines.value: the team suffered in the best of five league championship series falling to the orlando twins 3 1
lines.name: English

lines.value: nashville compiled an 81 62 record during the season under stump merrill
lines.name: English

lines.value: jamie werly won the southern league most outstanding pitcher award after leading the circuit with 18 complete games and 193 strikeouts
lines.name: English

lines.value: don mattingly and willie mcgee who both played for the sounds in 1981 were later promoted to the major leagues
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1985 mattingly was named the american league most valuable player and mcgee named the national league mvp
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 1982 sounds under manager johnny oates won the second half of the season and met the knoxville blue jays in the division playoffs
lines.name: English

lines.value: after defeating the blue jays 3 1 the sounds advanced to the league championship series to play against the jacksonville suns
lines.name: English

lines.value: nashville defeated the suns three games to one clinching the southern league championship giving the franchise their second league title
lines.name: English

lines.value: the team finished with a 77 67 record
lines.name: English

lines.value: brian dayett was selected as the southern league mvp
lines.name: English

lines.value: stefan wever who had a league leading 191 strikeouts was the league's most outstanding pitcher
lines.name: English

lines.value: wever was the fifth sounds pitcher in five years to win the award
lines.name: English

lines.value: otis nixon set the career franchise record in stolen bases during the 1981 to 1982 seasons
lines.name: English

lines.value: the new york yankees returned for another exhibition game against the sounds on april 28 1983
lines.name: English

lines.value: new york had a four run lead going into the bottom of the ninth inning but a five run rally with two outs propelled the sounds to a 5 4 win in front of 13641 fans
lines.name: English

lines.value: among the yankees in attendance for the game were billy martin yogi berra goose gossage ken griffey sr dave winfield lou piniella and willie randolph
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the season manager doug holmquist frustrated with the team's disappointing first half instituted a system of fines for player infractions or poor performance on the field
lines.name: English

lines.value: the program ranged from a us$10 fine for a pitcher walking a batter with one on and two outs to a us$100 fine for missing curfew
lines.name: English

lines.value: rebounding nashville won the second half pennant earning the team a shot at the western division championship
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds however lost the fifth game of the best of five series to the birmingham barons by a score of seven runs to five ending their season
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds finished 30 games over .500 with an 88 58 record
lines.name: English

lines.value: pitcher jamie werly set the career franchise strikeout record 352 when he played for the sounds in 1980 1981 and 1983
lines.name: English

lines.value: on june 21 during a road trip to orlando florida teammates scott bradley mike pagliarulo erik peterson and buck showalter were walking back to their hotel when peterson was hit by an automobile
lines.name: English

lines.value: when he began to convulse bradley put his fingers down peterson's throat to keep him from swallowing his tongue
lines.name: English

lines.value: he survived but with a bruised leg and several lacerations to the head and he returned to play later in the season
lines.name: English

lines.value: the southern league all star game returned to nashville in 1983
lines.name: English

lines.value: not only did the sounds host the event but they also served as the all star team's competition
lines.name: English

lines.value: the all stars recorded the victory with a score of three runs to two
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds were one game shy of winning the first half pennant in 1984
lines.name: English

lines.value: winning the first half title is something that eluded the team during its entire seven year span in the southern league
lines.name: English

lines.value: one important highlight of the first half of 1984 took place on may 4 when jim deshaies pitched the club's first no hitter against the columbus astros in the second game of a seven inning doubleheader
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 5 1 sounds victory was cut short of being a perfect game following three walks and a batter being hit by a pitch advancing the runner home for the only astros run of the game
lines.name: English

lines.value: nashville went on to capture the second half title however for the sixth consecutive season after defeating the knoxville blue jays in a playoff game
lines.name: English

lines.value: the two teams met again in the divisional playoffs but the blue jays emerged the victor eliminating the sounds from the playoffs
lines.name: English

lines.value: skipper jim marshall led his sounds to a 74 73 record
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1983 sounds president larry schmittou noticed a 5% drop in season ticket sales a higher ratio of no shows from season ticket holders and a slight decline in overall attendance
lines.name: English

lines.value: these issues with spectator turnout were accompanied by a decline in local media coverage particularly in regard to road games
lines.name: English

lines.value: in order to boost interest in the team schmittou tried unsuccessfully to purchase a triple a franchise late in the 1983 season
lines.name: English

lines.value: his desire to land a triple a team was part of a larger plan to put nashville in a position to contend for a major league franchise in the future
lines.name: English

lines.value: attendance continued to drop in 1984 as season ticket sales were down 12% and overall attendance was down almost 20%
lines.name: English

lines.value: schmittou and team owners arrived at terms in june 1984 to purchase the triple a evansville triplets of the american association with plans to move the franchise from evansville indiana to nashville for the 1985 season
lines.name: English

lines.value: in order to prove to the team's nashville banks which would back the purchase that the move was financially viable schmittou commissioned a survey to evaluate the potential turnout for a triple a team versus a double a team
lines.name: English

lines.value: though the research proved to team owners that the move was a sensible decision the banks were not impressed
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a result the team switched banks and went ahead with the purchase and relocation
lines.name: English

lines.value: the southern league wanted schmittou to surrender his franchise to the league but he had plans to relocate the team instead
lines.name: English

lines.value: schmittou wanted to send nashville's existing southern league franchise to evansville to continue as the triplets at double a
lines.name: English

lines.value: however a combination of the league's disapproval of the move and the city of evansville being unwilling to upgrade bosse field resulted in a move to huntsville alabama where the team became the huntsville stars
lines.name: English

lines.value: the triple a sounds carried on the history of the double a team that preceded it
lines.name: English

lines.value: the triplets legacy was retired and the stars were established as an entirely new franchise
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds entered the triple a playing level in 1985 as an affiliate of the detroit tigers playing in the american association
lines.name: English

lines.value: they played their first triple a game on april 11 a 3 1 win against the buffalo bisons at greer stadium
lines.name: English

lines.value: the next day nashville competed in an exhibition game against their major league affiliate
lines.name: English

lines.value: the tigers outlasted the sounds winning by a score of 9 3 in the tenth inning
lines.name: English

lines.value: seven games into the season manager lee walls came down with an illness and nashville outfielder leon roberts became the acting manager for seven games until gordon mackenzie was brought on to lead the club for the rest of year
lines.name: English

lines.value: on july 17 bryan kelly pitched the club's second no hitter against the oklahoma city 89ers in which the sounds won 6 0
lines.name: English

lines.value: nashville ended the season with a 71 70 record and in second place in the eastern division two and a half games out of first behind the eventual league champion louisville redbirds
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 1986 team was managed by former player leon roberts who had temporarily lead the team the previous season
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds finished third in their division with a 68 74 regular season record their first losing season since the inaugural 1978 season
lines.name: English

lines.value: also that year the sounds were enlisted to serve as the competition in the southern league all star game held in huntsville
lines.name: English

lines.value: the game was won by nashville with a score of four runs to two
lines.name: English

lines.value: the team ended their affiliation with detroit after two seasons of poor attendnace and a lackluster 1986 campaign
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds rejoined the cincinnati reds farm system in 1987 this time as their triple a affiliate
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a result a number of minor leaguers played in the reds organization at two different levels with nashville
lines.name: English

lines.value: spending the beginning of the 1987 season around the top of the standings the team hit a slump after losing a few key players midseason
lines.name: English

lines.value: the result was a 64 76 record under skipper jack lind and a last place finish
lines.name: English

lines.value: one player lost due to injuries was third baseman chris sabo
lines.name: English

lines.value: sabo was promoted to cincinnati in 1988 and was named the national league rookie of the year a first for any former sounds player
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 1988 sounds were in last place and had a losing record until making numerous management changes late in the season
lines.name: English

lines.value: during a two week period in july and august 1988 the sounds went through five different managers
lines.name: English

lines.value: the team started the season with jack lind who left due to health problems
lines.name: English

lines.value: his position was filled on an interim basis by pitching coach wayne garland until former manager george scherger manager of the 1979 southern league championship sounds was brought in
lines.name: English

lines.value: he retired after one game and was replaced by jim hoff who stayed a few days before taking up a position with the reds front office
lines.name: English

lines.value: finally former texas rangers manager frank lucchesi was hired to lead the sounds for the rest of the season
lines.name: English

lines.value: lucchesi managed the team's last 39 games leading them to a final record of 73 69
lines.name: English

lines.value: they finished second in the eastern division sixteen games behind the indianapolis indians who went on to win the league championship
lines.name: English

lines.value: greer stadium was home to a rare baseball occurrence on august 6 and august 7 1988 when nashville and indianapolis exchanged no hitters on back to back nights
lines.name: English

lines.value: first indianapolis randy johnson and pat pacillo combined for a no hit loss against the sounds a 1 0 nashville win
lines.name: English

lines.value: that game was won by nashville when lenny harris walked to first base stole second base stole third base and then came home scoring on a groundout
lines.name: English

lines.value: the next night nashville's jack armstrong pitched a no hit game against the indians a 4 0 sounds victory
lines.name: English

lines.value: this was the first time in american association history that teams played in back to back no hit games and was the third no hitter in sounds franchise history
lines.name: English

lines.value: frank lucchesi continued to manage the sounds in 1989 leading the team to a third place finish with a 74 72 record
lines.name: English

lines.value: pitcher hugh kemp set the career franchise records for games started 73 and walks 207 while playing for the team from 1987 to 1989
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds returned in 1990 to experience their most successful season in the american association when they compiled an 86 61 record under manager pete mackanin
lines.name: English

lines.value: ending the regular season in a tie with the buffalo bisons the sounds won the eastern division championship in a one game playoff
lines.name: English

lines.value: the extra inning affair was ended by chris jones two run homer in the top of the eighteenth inning
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds advanced to their first american association championship series where they lost to the omaha royals three games to two
lines.name: English

lines.value: left hander chris hammond won the league's most valuable pitcher award for 1990 having led the league with 15 wins and 149 strikeouts
lines.name: English

lines.value: that year nashville set their all time attendance record when a total of 605122 fans came out to greer stadium
lines.name: English

lines.value: skeeter barnes who played with nashville in 1979 and from 1988 to 1990 holds three career franchise records games played 514 at bats 1848 and hits 517
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1991 the sounds started the year in first place where they remained for only ten days
lines.name: English

lines.value: by may 1 they had fallen into third place in the eastern division where they remained for the rest of the season
lines.name: English

lines.value: mackanin's sounds posted a losing record every month during the season and finished the year 16 games behind first place buffalo with 65 78 record
lines.name: English

lines.value: from 1988 to 1991 american association teams participated in interleague play with teams from the triple a international league in a partnership called the triple a alliance
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds had an interleague record of 90 78 over this four year period
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1992 pete mackanin was dismissed from his managerial duties on june 28
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was replaced by dave miley who was managing the reds double a affiliate the chattanooga lookouts
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 1992 sounds posted a 67 77 record winding up in fourth place
lines.name: English

lines.value: greer stadium once one of the best stadiums in triple a baseball began to be out shined by newer state of the art ballparks being built in the late 1980s
lines.name: English

lines.value: the reds let their player development contract pdc with the sounds expire so they could place their triple a affiliate in indianapolis which was closer to cincinnati and was planning to build a new stadium
lines.name: English

lines.value: nashville entered the offseason unsure of their next major league affiliate
lines.name: English

lines.value: with few options available the sounds signed a pdc with the chicago white sox who wanted to move their triple a farm club closer to home than their previous location in vancouver
lines.name: English

lines.value: the white sox presented schmittou with a list of complaints about the relatively poor condition of greer stadium
lines.name: English

lines.value: schmittou was unable to convince mayor phil bredesen or the metro council to pay for new stadium to replace greer
lines.name: English

lines.value: he considered moving the team to a surrounding county and explored sites in la vergne cool springs and mount juliet
lines.name: English

lines.value: he even tried unsuccessfully to get the metro council to pass a referendum to let taxpayers vote on a temporary tax increase to pay off a proposed $40 million stadium in three years
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the end schmittou elected to keep the sounds at greer but make significant improvements to the stadium
lines.name: English

lines.value: one of those improvements was the addition of greer's signature guitar shaped scoreboard which was installed in 1993
lines.name: English

lines.value: in their first year with the white sox the sounds clinched the eastern division title with an 81 62 record
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the league championship series the sounds lost to the iowa cubs four games to three in a decisive extra inning game seven
lines.name: English

lines.value: nashville's rick renick who managed the club from 1993 to 1996 was named the american association manager of the year in his first season
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds shared greer stadium with the southern league's nashville xpress previously known as the charlotte knights during the 1993 and 1994 seasons
lines.name: English

lines.value: this came about when charlotte acquired a triple a expansion franchise in 1993 leaving the city's double a team without a home
lines.name: English

lines.value: larry schmittou offered greer as a temporary home ballpark for the team
lines.name: English

lines.value: in order to accommodate an additional club at greer the xpress scheduled its home games during the sounds road trips
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1995 the xpress relocated to wilmington north carolina and became the port city roosters
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1994 the sounds earned an 83 61 record placing them in second
lines.name: English

lines.value: this qualified them for their second consecutive appearance in the league playoffs
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the first round nashville swept the new orleans zephyrs in three straight games to advance to the league finals
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the best of five championship series the indianapolis indians defeated the sounds three games to one
lines.name: English

lines.value: nashville hosted the mid summer triple a all star game in 1994
lines.name: English

lines.value: nashville's rick renick managed the team of american league affiliated all stars which included sounds players ray durham drew denson and scott ruffcorn however ruffcorn was later placed on the disabled list and replaced by steve schrenk
lines.name: English

lines.value: durham won the all star game's most valuable player award
lines.name: English

lines.value: ruffcorn who led the american association with 15 wins was selected as the association's most valuable pitcher for 1994
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds compiled a 68 76 record 20 games out of first place in 1995
lines.name: English

lines.value: originally michael jordan who played with the white sox's double a birmingham barons in 1994 was signed to play the 1995 season as a non drafted free agent for the sounds
lines.name: English

lines.value: however with the ongoing mlb strike jordan decided to quit the sport rather than becoming a replacement player and being labeled a strikebreaker
lines.name: English

lines.value: the team improved their record in 1996 ending up with 77 wins and 67 losses
lines.name: English

lines.value: despite a decent winning percentage nashville failed to secure a spot in the playoffs
lines.name: English

lines.value: outfielder jeff abbott won the rookie of the year award and rick renick earned his second manager of the year award
lines.name: English

lines.value: joey vierra pitched in a career franchise record 238 games from 1990 to 1992 and 1994 to 1995
lines.name: English

lines.value: this 1996 season marked the last that larry schmittou was the team's principal owner and president
lines.name: English

lines.value: with the city prepared to welcome a national football league franchise the tennessee titans schmittou felt that revenue would be drawn away from his baseball team
lines.name: English

lines.value: he sold his entire financial interest in the sounds to al gordon president of amerisports companies llc
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1997 nashville under the guidance of manager tom spencer put together a 74 68 campaign again failing to win either half of the season excluding them from the playoffs
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition to being selected for both the midseason and postseason all star teams outfielder magglio ordonez won the triple a all star game mvp award and garnered the league's most valuable player and rookie of the year awards
lines.name: English

lines.value: ordonez had led the league with 172 hits and tied for first with a .329 batting average and 249 total bases
lines.name: English

lines.value: the american association of which the sounds had been members since 1985 disbanded after the 1997 season
lines.name: English

lines.value: its teams were absorbed by the two remaining triple a leagues the international league and pacific coast league
lines.name: English

lines.value: nashville joined the pacific coast league pcl making it the eastern most team in the league
lines.name: English

lines.value: the franchise also picked up a new major league affiliation becoming the top farm club of the pittsburgh pirates
lines.name: English

lines.value: for the first time since the team's foundation in 1978 the sounds began to adopt a new logo color scheme and uniforms over the course of the 1998 and 1999 seasons
lines.name: English

lines.value: the original red white and blue colors were replaced by black and red
lines.name: English

lines.value: the new team logo replacing the original slugger consisted of a black red and white music note enclosed in a circle of the same colors bearing the team name in a more modern font
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1998 the team's first season as a pirates affiliate the sounds finished last in the american conference east division with a 67 76 record
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds were led by manager trent jewett who would go on to win 320 games from 1998 to 2000 and 2003 to 2004 placing him first on the all time wins list for sounds managers
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds experienced their longest winning streak in franchise history when they won 15 consecutive games from june 2 to june 20 1999
lines.name: English

lines.value: overall the team improved from the previous year putting together an 80 60 record but their second place finish left them out of the pcl playoffs where only division winners advance to the postseason
lines.name: English

lines.value: nashville ended the 2000 season with a 63 79 record resulting in a last place finish in the divisional standings
lines.name: English

lines.value: richie hebner the sounds pitching coach replaced trent jewett as manager when he became the pirates third base coach on june 6
lines.name: English

lines.value: former all star sounds infielder marty brown returned to the club to serve as its 25th manager in 2001 becoming the third former nashville player to serve as the team's skipper
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds compiled a 64 77 record leaving them in third place
lines.name: English

lines.value: on june 30 tike redman became the first sounds player to hit for the cycle
lines.name: English

lines.value: redman also holds the sounds franchise record for the most triples 30 during his career with the team
lines.name: English

lines.value: despite finishing the 2002 season with a 72 71 record under brown it was only good enough for a third place finish two and a half games out of first place
lines.name: English

lines.value: chad hermansen who played for the sounds from 1998 to 2002 holds three career franchise records runs 303 home runs 92 and runs batted in 286
lines.name: English

lines.value: right hander john wasdin pitched the first perfect game in nashville sounds history in his first start of the season against the albuquerque isotopes on april 7 2003
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 4 0 sounds win was only the second nine inning perfect game in pcl history
lines.name: English

lines.value: that year trent jewett returned to led the sounds to an 81 62 record
lines.name: English

lines.value: the team clinched the american conference eastern division title giving them their first postseason berth in pacific coast league and first postseason appearance since 1994
lines.name: English

lines.value: nashville met albuquerque in the american conference championship series defeating the isotopes three games to one
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds then lost the best of five league championship series in three straight games to the sacramento river cats
lines.name: English

lines.value: on may 21 2004 catcher j r house became the second sounds player to hit for the cycle
lines.name: English

lines.value: the team completed the 2004 campaign with a 63 79 record finishing last in the division under jewett
lines.name: English

lines.value: early in the season jason bay played four games in nashville before being promoted to pittsburgh
lines.name: English

lines.value: following the major league season he was named the national league rookie of the year
lines.name: English

lines.value: this made him the second former player from nashville to receive such honors
lines.name: English

lines.value: closer mark corey set the career franchise record for saves during the 2003 and 2004 seasons
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds changed affiliates in 2005 welcoming the milwaukee brewers as their sixth different major league franchise
lines.name: English

lines.value: coincidentally the major minor league sports connection between nashville and milwaukee was duplicated from 2005 to 2014 but with reverse roles in ice hockey as the milwaukee admirals were the top level minor league affiliate of the national hockey league's nashville predators
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds also debuted a new oval shaped logo with a baseball player silhouetted against a yellow background hitting a ball toward the nashville skyline with the city's name written above within a red border and the team name written in red and black script below
lines.name: English

lines.value: the new brewers affiliate was managed by frank kremblas and featured top prospects such as rickie weeks prince fielder nelson cruz and corey hart
lines.name: English

lines.value: the affiliation started well as the club won the american conference northern division title on the second to last day of the season with a 75 69 record
lines.name: English

lines.value: the team went on to win the american conference title against the oklahoma redhawks three games to two before sweeping the tacoma rainiers in three straight games in the finals to win the 2005 pacific coast league championship
lines.name: English

lines.value: outfielder nelson cruz clinched the title with a three run home run with two outs in the 13th inning
lines.name: English

lines.value: this was nashville's first title since their previous league crown in 1982 and their first championship as a triple a team
lines.name: English

lines.value: on july 15 2006 nashville pitchers carlos villanueva mike meyers and alec zumwalt combined to pitch the fifth no hitter in team history a 2 0 win over the memphis redbirds
lines.name: English

lines.value: on may 5 6 the sounds participated in a 24-inning game against the new orleans zephyrs
lines.name: English

lines.value: the contest played over the course of two days lasted a total of eight hours and seven minutes
lines.name: English

lines.value: this game matched the longest game in terms of innings played in pcl history
lines.name: English

lines.value: additionally several team and league records were broken by both clubs
lines.name: English

lines.value: the record was originally set on june 8 1909 in a game between the san francisco seals and oakland oaks
lines.name: English

lines.value: a few years later on september 10 1911 the record was tied by a contest between the sacramento solons and portland beavers
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds finished the season with a 76 68 record under kremblas tied with the iowa cubs for first place in the american conference northern division
lines.name: English

lines.value: nashville won the division title and advanced to the postseason by means of a tiebreaker winning the regular season series versus iowa nine games to seven
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the conference championship series nashville lost to the round rock express three games to two
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 2007 sounds included top brewers prospects yovani gallardo and ryan braun
lines.name: English

lines.value: braun who made his major league debut on may 25 was named national league rookie of the year following the season making him the third former sounds player to receive this honor
lines.name: English

lines.value: on june 25 manny parra pitched the club's second perfect game only the third nine inning perfect game in pcl history against the round rock express
lines.name: English

lines.value: the team led by pcl manager of the year frank kremblas captured the american conference northern division title for the third straight year and finished the season with a league best 89 55 record
lines.name: English

lines.value: they were defeated by the new orleans zephyrs three games to one in the conference championship series
lines.name: English

lines.value: nashville native knuckleball pitcher and 13-game winner ra dickey won the pcl pitcher of the year award
lines.name: English

lines.value: massive flooding in the midwest resulted in the sounds and the iowa cubs played a game with an official attendance of zero on june 14 2008
lines.name: English

lines.value: though downtown des moines was under a mandatory evacuation team officials received permission from the city to play the game as long as no fans were allowed into principal park
lines.name: English

lines.value: in order to keep fans away the lights and scoreboard were not turned on the game was not broadcast in the local market and a message on the team's website announced that the game was postponed
lines.name: English

lines.value: pcl commissioner branch rickey iii believed that this was the first time such actions were taken out of necessity
lines.name: English

lines.value: kremblas sounds ended with a 59 81 record the second lowest in the team's history
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds had planned to leave greer stadium in the mid 2000s for a new ballpark to be called first tennessee field but the project was abandoned after the city developers and team could not come to terms on a plan to finance its construction
lines.name: English

lines.value: on october 30 2008 following this failure to secure a new ballpark amerisports companies llc entered into an agreement to sell the sounds to mfp baseball a new york based group of investors consisting of masahiro honzawa steve posner and frank ward
lines.name: English

lines.value: keeping the team in nashville was one of the pcl's top criteria for approval of the sale
lines.name: English

lines.value: the transaction received final approval from major league baseball and the pcl on february 26 2009
lines.name: English

lines.value: mfp made significant renovations to greer stadium while it continued to explore options for building a new downtown ballpark for the club
lines.name: English

lines.value: rebounding from their 2008 campaign the 2009 sounds achieved a 75 69 record under new manager don money
lines.name: English

lines.value: despite a winning record and spending the majority of the season in first place the sounds finished the season two games behind their cross state rivals and eventual league champions the memphis redbirds
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 2010 season proved to be reminiscent of the previous campaign
lines.name: English

lines.value: though nashville finished the year with a winning 77 67 record under money it was only good enough to place fourth last in the division
lines.name: English

lines.value: sounds right fielder caleb gindl became the third player in team history to hit for the cycle when he accomplished the feat on july 10 2011
lines.name: English

lines.value: center fielder logan schafer garnered national media attention when he initiated a triple play on august 20 2011 against the omaha storm chasers
lines.name: English

lines.value: what made the rare occurrence even more unusual is that the ball first bounced off schafer's glove and head before landing in his glove for the first out
lines.name: English

lines.value: he then returned the ball to the infield where second baseman eric farris and first baseman mat gamel completed the triple play by stepping on their respective bases
lines.name: English

lines.value: with money at the helm nashville ended the year with a 71 73 record placing third in their division
lines.name: English

lines.value: managed by mike guerrero the 2012 sounds finished the season in second place with a losing 67 77 record sixteen games behind first place omaha
lines.name: English

lines.value: nashville set a franchise record low win loss record in 2013
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 57 87 season eclipsed the previous franchise record set in 2008
lines.name: English

lines.value: despite the team's performance pitcher johnny hellweg won the pcl pitcher of the year award and guerrero was selected for the mike coolbaugh award in recognition for his contributions to the game
lines.name: English

lines.value: tim dillard who pitched for the sounds from 2007 to 2014 set three career franchise records during his sounds career wins 39 innings pitched 556⅔ and runs allowed 302
lines.name: English

lines.value: prior to the 2014 season the sounds metro nashville and the state of tennessee finalized a plan to build a new ballpark to replace greer stadium at the beginning of the 2015 season
lines.name: English

lines.value: on august 27 2014 the sounds hosted the final game at greer stadium an 8 5 loss to the sacramento river cats
lines.name: English

lines.value: in his only plate appearance nashville catcher lucas may struck out swinging with a full count and the bases loaded to end the game
lines.name: English

lines.value: the announced attendance at the game was a standing room only crowd of 11067 the first sellout since 2010 and the largest crowd since 2007
lines.name: English

lines.value: the team led by veteran minor league manager rick sweet finished the season with a 76 67 record in second place two and a half games behind memphis
lines.name: English

lines.value: jimmy nelson the brewers top prospect at the start of the season was elected pcl pitcher of the year he received all but one of the votes
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds severed ties with the brewers with whom they had had the longest affiliation in franchise history after the 2014 season citing poor on field performance from recent brewers triple a teams
lines.name: English

lines.value: having parted with milwaukee nashville entered into a four year player development contract with the oakland athletics that runs from 2015 through 2018
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds also adopted a new color scheme set of logos and uniforms before the 2015 season
lines.name: English

lines.value: the team hired sports design firm brandiose to create their new visual identity
lines.name: English

lines.value: at one point the firm was asked to explore new team nicknames which included platinums hits fireflies picks drumsticks and roosters
lines.name: English

lines.value: nashville chose to stick with the sounds moniker but elected to embrace a new color scheme that originally included broadway burnt orange sunburst tan neon orange and cash black
lines.name: English

lines.value: however the team returned to the previous red and black color scheme with the addition of platinum silver as an accent color before the start of the season following mixed feedback from team fans
lines.name: English

lines.value: the new logos incorporated elements that reflect nashville's music city nickname such as guitars guitar picks and a guitar's sound hole as well as neon signs such as those in the city's broadway entertainment district
lines.name: English

lines.value: the start of the 2015 season marked the first time that the sounds played at the new downtown first tennessee park which is located at the former site of the historic sulphur dell ballpark
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds defeated the colorado springs sky sox 3 2 in 10 innings in the inaugural home opener in front of an announced paid attendance of 10459
lines.name: English

lines.value: first baseman max muncy secured the win with a walk off rbi double scoring billy burns from first base before being mobbed by his sounds teammates on the field
lines.name: English

lines.value: under manager steve scarsone nashville finished their first season as an a's affiliate in third place with a 66 78 record
lines.name: English

lines.value: barry zito who won the american league cy young award in 2002 made his return to professional baseball with the sounds in 2015 after sitting out the 2014 season
lines.name: English

lines.value: zito was lauded by his nashville teammates for embracing the triple a lifestyle and for his commitment to the team charting pitches between starts coaching first base and even buying dinner for the entire team on his birthday
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2016 pcl manager of the year steve scarsone led the sounds to a league best 83 59 record and the american conference southern division title sending the team to the postseason for the first time since 2007
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds lost the american conference series versus the oklahoma city dodgers three games to two including a dramatic back and forth game seven
lines.name: English

lines.value: ryan christenson managed the club in 2017
lines.name: English

lines.value: sounds pitchers chris smith 6 ip sean doolittle 1 ip tucker healy 1 ip and simon castro 1 ip combined to pitch the franchise's seventh no hitter on june 7 2017 against the omaha storm chasers a 4 0 nashville win
lines.name: English

lines.value: all star renato nunez whose three run home run propelled the pcl past the international league to win the 2017 triple a all star game was selected as the game's mvp
lines.name: English

lines.value: joey wendle set the career franchise record for doubles 102 during the year
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds finished their 40th anniversary season in second place with a 68 71 record
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 2018 team is managed by fran riordan
lines.name: English

lines.value: nashville's chief rivals have been those based in memphis tennessee
lines.name: English

lines.value: located approximately 200 mi to the southwest and connected to nashville by interstate 40 memphis has fielded several teams which have competed in the same leagues as nashville's teams since the late 19th century
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds entered the rivalry when they joined the southern league in 1978
lines.name: English

lines.value: nashville played in the western division against the memphis chicks
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1979 the chicks won the first half of the division and the sounds won the second half
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the best of three division finals the sounds defeated the chicks in two out of three games before going on to win the southern league championship
lines.name: English

lines.value: memphis and nashville each won the first and second halves respectively of the 1980 season
lines.name: English

lines.value: this time however memphis won the western division title defeating nashville in three out of four games
lines.name: English

lines.value: the teams met again under the same circumstances in 1981
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds swept the chicks in three straight games to win the western division finals
lines.name: English

lines.value: the intrastate rivalry was interrupted when nashville moved to the american association in 1985 but was renewed when the sounds joined the pacific coast league in 1998
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds and the memphis redbirds have been division rivals ever since
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2009 memphis clinched the american conference northern division title finishing the season just two games ahead of nashville which spent the majority of the season in first place
lines.name: English

lines.value: similarly nashville finished the 2014 season two and a half games behind memphis after having led the division for most of the season
lines.name: English

lines.value: from 2012 to 2015 the two teams competed in the i 40 cup series a season long 16-game series between the clubs
lines.name: English

lines.value: whichever of the two won the most games played between them was declared the winner and received a trophy cup to keep until the next season
lines.name: English

lines.value: the losing team donated game tickets to a charity selected by the winner
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds won the inaugural 2012 contest 9-7 and memphis won the 2013 series 7-9
lines.name: English

lines.value: the teams tied the 2014 and 2015 series both 8 8 the redbirds retained the title in both instances
lines.name: English

lines.value: the teams discontinued the trophy cup friendly wager and promotional references to the series after 2015
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds originally played at herschel greer stadium from 1978 through 2014
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ballpark which has been abandoned but still stands is located on the grounds of fort negley an american civil war fortification approximately two miles 3 km south of downtown nashville
lines.name: English

lines.value: the venue experienced numerous expansions and contractions after its completion in 1978 but seated 10300 spectators during its final 2014 season
lines.name: English

lines.value: the largest attendance occurred on august 18 1982 when 22315 people saw the sounds take on the columbus astros
lines.name: English

lines.value: greer's best known feature installed in 1993 is the giant guitar shaped scoreboard behind the left field wall
lines.name: English

lines.value: following the construction of newer relatively luxurious minor league ballparks greer stadium had fallen below the standards set for triple a stadiums by professional baseball in 1990
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the time team president larry schmittou tried to convince the city to approve a new ballpark but was unsuccessful
lines.name: English

lines.value: throughout the 2000s the team continued in its attempts to gather approval and financing for a new ballpark to replace greer
lines.name: English

lines.value: at one point a new stadium first tennessee field was planned for construction on the west bank of the cumberland river in downtown
lines.name: English

lines.value: disagreements over who would pay for the ballpark repeatedly pushed back opening day at the stadium and eventually resulted in the cancellation of the project altogether
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the meantime numerous upgrades and repairs including over $2.5 million worth of improvements from 2008 to 2009 were made to greer in order to preserve its functionality until a new stadium could be built
lines.name: English

lines.value: a deal for such a new ballpark was achieved in late 2013
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds played their final game at greer on august 27 2014
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sounds current home ballpark is first tennessee park which opened on april 17 2015
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is located in downtown nashville at the location of the former sulphur dell ballpark
lines.name: English

lines.value: the $91 million stadium has a fixed seating capacity of 8500 people but can accommodate up to 10000 people with additional grass berm seating
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ballpark's attendance record was set on july 3 2017 when 11764 people watched the sounds play against the oklahoma city dodgers on the night of the team's independence day celebration
lines.name: English

lines.value: the stadium features wide concourses with direct views of the playing field
lines.name: English

lines.value: its design which incorporates the use of musical and baseball imagery is meant to connect the park with the city's baseball and musical heritage
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is accomplished through the use of directional signage displaying information on nashville's former teams and players the grandstand's light stanchions reminiscent of those found at sulphur dell and the use of the team's guitar pick logo throughout the park
lines.name: English

lines.value: one of first tennessee park's most recognizable features like greer stadium before it is a guitar shaped scoreboard beyond the right center field wall
lines.name: English

lines.value: unlike greer's guitar which was only able to display basic in game information such as the line score count and brief player statistics the new larger version is also capable of displaying colorful graphics animations and videos the batting order fielding positions expanded statistics and player photographs
lines.name: English

lines.value: other distinguishing features at the ballpark include the band box an outdoor restaurant and bar which serves variations on traditional ballpark foods and the country club at the band box a 9-hole miniature golf course which exhibits art from different local and regional artists
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2016 the sounds added the country legends race similar to major league mascot races such as the sausage race and presidents race to the between innings entertainment at the park
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the middle of the fifth inning people in oversized foam caricature costumes depicting country musicians johnny cash george jones reba mcentire and dolly parton race around the warning track from center field through the visiting bullpen and to the home plate side of the first base dugout
lines.name: English

lines.value: nashville's current uniforms adopted in 2015 utilize the team's red black and platinum silver color palette and incorporate elements that reflect nashville's music city moniker

lines.value: four former members of the sounds have been elected to the national baseball hall of fame

lines.value: closing pitcher trevor hoffman who was inducted in 2018 played the majority of the 1992 season with nashville while working his way up through the cincinnati reds organization
lines.name: English

lines.value: hoffman appeared in 42 games working out of the bullpen on 37 occasions and achieved a record with a 4.27 earned run average era and 63 strikeouts over innings of work

lines.value: he later made two major league rehabilitation appearances while with the milwaukee brewers in 2009

lines.value: two other hall of fame players appeared in games for nashville solely on rehab assignments

lines.value: shortstop barry larkin who was inducted in 2012 appeared in two games with the team in 1989
lines.name: English

lines.value: outfielder tim raines who played three games with nashville in 1993 was inducted in 2017

lines.value: hoyt wilhelm who served as the team's pitching coach from 1982 to 1984 was inducted in 1985
lines.name: English

lines.value: under his three years guidance the team's pitching staff amassed a 239 198 record with a 3.73 era and 2357 strikeouts

lines.value: the sounds are also represented in the southern league hall of fame

lines.value: larry schmittou who helped bring baseball to nashville in 1978 and was the principal owner through 1996 was inducted in 2016

lines.value: the sterile cuckoo released in the uk as pookie is a 1969 american comedy drama film released by paramount pictures that tells the story of an eccentric young couple whose relationship deepens despite their differences and inadequacies
lines.name: English

lines.value: it stars liza minnelli wendell burton and tim mcintire
lines.name: English

lines.value: the film was adapted by alvin sargent from the 1965 novel by john nichols and directed by alan j pakula in his directing debut
lines.name: English

lines.value: the film received two academy awards nominations for the 42nd academy awards liza minnelli for best actress in a leading role and fred karlin and dory previn's song come saturday morning for best original song
lines.name: English

lines.value: mary ann pookie adams is an oddball quirky teenager who meets the quiet reserved jerry payne while waiting for a bus heading to their colleges
lines.name: English

lines.value: their colleges are near each other and they have each enrolled as freshmen
lines.name: English

lines.value: jerry immediately sees that pookie is different even strange
lines.name: English

lines.value: she lies to a nun on the bus so the nun will switch seats with her
lines.name: English

lines.value: jerry is beginning to settle into college life with his roommate charlie schumacher when the aggressive pookie arrives unannounced one saturday morning
lines.name: English

lines.value: pookie and jerry spend much time together over the weekend and soon begin to see each other regularly
lines.name: English

lines.value: jerry falls in love with pookie but their different personalities starts to pull them apart
lines.name: English

lines.value: after having sex pookie tells jerry she might be pregnant
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the pregnancy scare is over jerry wants to spend spring break alone to catch up on his studies
lines.name: English

lines.value: pookie pleads to stay with him and he relents
lines.name: English

lines.value: a week alone with the needy and somewhat unstable pookie makes jerry realize that they need time apart
lines.name: English

lines.value: discovering later that she has dropped out of her college jerry finds her in the same boarding house where she had stayed on the first day she came to visit
lines.name: English

lines.value: he puts her on a bus for home and the young lovers part ways
lines.name: English

lines.value: much of the sterile cuckoo was filmed at hamilton college in clinton new york
lines.name: English

lines.value: some of it was filmed in sylvan beach new york including the sylvan beach union chapel
lines.name: English

lines.value: some scenes including the bus stop scenes were filmed at the park in vernon center new york
lines.name: English

lines.value: the film was well received by critics and holds an 88% fresh rating on the review aggregate website rotten tomatoes
lines.name: English

lines.value: it grossed $13982357 at the north american box office making it the 13th highest grossing film of 1969
lines.name: English

lines.value: * list of american films of 1969
lines.name: English

lines.value: * filming of the sterile cuckoo at hamilton college

lines.value: baleen is a filter feeder system inside the mouths of baleen whales
lines.name: English

lines.value: the baleen system works by a whale opening its mouth underwater and taking in water
lines.name: English

lines.value: the whale then pushes the water out and animals such as krill are filtered by the baleen and remain as food source for the whale
lines.name: English

lines.value: baleen is similar to bristles and consists of keratin the same substance found in human fingernails and hair
lines.name: English

lines.value: baleen is a skin derivative
lines.name: English

lines.value: some whales such as the bowhead whale have longer baleen than others
lines.name: English

lines.value: other whales such as the gray whale only use one side of their baleen
lines.name: English

lines.value: these baleen bristles are arranged in plates across the upper jaw of the whale
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a material for various human uses baleen is usually called whalebone
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is not to be confused but often is with whale bone or whale's bone meaning the actual bones of whales used in carving for cutlery handles and other uses for the bones of various large species
lines.name: English

lines.value: like other bone materials this often functioned as a substitute for ivory
lines.name: English

lines.value: depending on the species a baleen plate can be long and weigh up to
lines.name: English

lines.value: its hairy fringes are called baleen hair or whalebone hair
lines.name: English

lines.value: they are also called baleen bristles which in sei whales are highly calcified with calcification functioning to increase their stiffness
lines.name: English

lines.value: baleen plates are broader at the gumline base
lines.name: English

lines.value: the plates have been compared to sieves or venetian blinds
lines.name: English

lines.value: the word "" derives from the latin , related to the greek phalaina - both of which mean whale
lines.name: English

lines.value: the oldest true fossils of baleen are only 15 million years old because baleen rarely fossilizes and scientists believe it originated considerably earlier than that
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is indicated by baleen related skull modifications being found in fossils from considerably earlier including a buttress of bone in the upper jaw beneath the eyes and loose lower jaw bones at the chin
lines.name: English

lines.value: baleen is believed to have evolved around 30 million years ago possibly from a hard gummy upper jaw like the one a dall's porpoise has it closely resembles baleen at the microscopic level
lines.name: English

lines.value: the initial evolution and radiation of baleen plates is believed to have occurred during early oligocene when antarctica broke off from gondwana and the antarctic circumpolar current was formed increasing productivity of ocean environments
lines.name: English

lines.value: this occurred because the current kept warm ocean waters away from the area that is now antarctica producing steep gradients in temperature salinity light and nutrients where the warm water meets the cold
lines.name: English

lines.value: the transition from teeth to baleen is proposed to have occurred stepwise from teeth to a hybrid to baleen
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is known that modern mysticetes have teeth initially and then develop baleen plate germs in utero but lose their dentition and have only baleen during their juvenile years and adulthood
lines.name: English

lines.value: however developing mysticetes do not produce tooth enamel because at some point this trait evolved to become a pseudogene
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is likely to have occurred about 28 million years ago and proves that dentition is an ancestral state of mysticetes
lines.name: English

lines.value: using parsimony to study this and other ancestral characters suggest that the common ancestor of aetiocetids and edentulous mysticetes evolved lateral nutrient foramina which are believed to have provided blood vessels and nerves a way to reach developing baleen
lines.name: English

lines.value: further research suggests that the baleen of aetiocetus was arranged in bundles between widely spaced teeth
lines.name: English

lines.value: if true this combination of baleen and dentition in aetiocetus would act as a transition state between odontocetes and mysticetes
lines.name: English

lines.value: this intermediate step is further supported by evidence of other changes that occurred with the evolution of baleen that make it possible for the organisms to survive using filter feeding such as a change in skull structure and throat elasticity
lines.name: English

lines.value: it would be highly unlikely for all of these changes to occur at once
lines.name: English

lines.value: therefore it is proposed that oligocene aetiocetids possess both ancestral and descendent character states regarding feeding strategies
lines.name: English

lines.value: this makes them mosaic taxa showing that either baleen evolved before dentition was lost or that the traits for filter feeding originally evolved for other functions
lines.name: English

lines.value: it also shows that the evolution could have occurred gradually because the ancestral state was originally maintained
lines.name: English

lines.value: therefore the mosaic whales could have exploited new resources using filter feeding while not abandoning their previous prey strategies
lines.name: English

lines.value: the result of this stepwise transition is apparent in modern day baleen whales because of their enamel pseudogenes and their in utero development and reabsorbing of teeth
lines.name: English

lines.value: if it is true that many early baleen whales also had teeth these were probably used only peripherally or perhaps not at all again like dall's porpoise which catches squid and fish by gripping them against its hard upper jaw
lines.name: English

lines.value: intense research has been carried out to sort out the evolution and phylogenetic history of mysticetes but much debate surrounds this issue
lines.name: English

lines.value: a whale's baleen plates play the most important role in its filter feeding process
lines.name: English

lines.value: to feed a baleen whale opens its mouth widely and scoops in dense shoals of prey such as krill copepods small fish and sometimes birds that happen to be near the shoals together with large volumes of water
lines.name: English

lines.value: it then partly shuts its mouth and presses its tongue against its upper jaw forcing the water to pass out sideways through the baleen thus sieving out the prey which it then swallows
lines.name: English

lines.value: people formerly used baleen usually referred to as whalebone for making numerous items where flexibility and strength were required including backscratchers collar stiffeners buggy whips parasol ribs crinoline petticoats and corset stays
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was commonly used to crease paper its flexibility kept it from damaging the paper
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was also occasionally used in cable backed bows
lines.name: English

lines.value: synthetic materials are now usually used for similar purposes especially plastic and fiberglass
lines.name: English

lines.value: baleen serves as a habitat for some species from the gastropod families pyropeltidae cocculinidae osteopeltidae and neolepetopsidae
lines.name: English
