lines.value: in 1645 the french mathematician blaise pascal invented the pascaline
lines.name: English

lines.value: though not an odometer the pascaline utilized gears to compute measurements
lines.name: English

lines.value: each gear contained 10 teeth
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first gear advanced the next gear one position when moved one complete revolution the same principle employed on modern mechanical odometers
lines.name: English

lines.value: odometers were developed for ships in 1698 with the odometer invented by the englishman thomas savery
lines.name: English

lines.value: benjamin franklin us statesman and the first postmaster general built a prototype odometer in 1775 that he attached to his carriage to help measure the mileage of postal routes
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1847 william clayton a mormon pioneer invented the roadometer which he attached to a wagon used by american settlers heading west
lines.name: English

lines.value: the roadometer recorded the distance traveled each day by the wagon trains
lines.name: English

lines.value: the roadometer used two gears and was an early example of an odometer with pascaline style gears in actual use
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1895 curtis hussey veeder invented the cyclometer
lines.name: English

lines.value: the cyclometer was a mechanical device that counted the number of rotations of a bicycle wheel
lines.name: English

lines.value: a flexible cable transmitted the number of rotations of the wheel to an analog odometer visible to the rider which converted the wheel rotations into the number of miles traveled according to a predetermined formula
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1903 arthur p and charles h warner two brothers from beloit wisconsin introduced their patented auto meter
lines.name: English

lines.value: the auto meter used a magnet attached to a rotating shaft to induce a magnetic pull upon a thin metal disk
lines.name: English

lines.value: measuring this pull provided accurate measurements of both distance and speed information to automobile drivers in a single instrument
lines.name: English

lines.value: the warners sold their company in 1912 to the stewart & clark company of chicago
lines.name: English

lines.value: the new firm was renamed the stewart warner corporation
lines.name: English

lines.value: by 1925 stewart warner odometers and trip meters were standard equipment on the vast majority of automobiles and motorcycles manufactured in the united states
lines.name: English

lines.value: by the early 2000s mechanical odometers would be phased out on cars from major manufacturers
lines.name: English

lines.value: the pontiac grand prix was the last gm car sold in the usa to offer a mechanical odometer in 2003 the canadian built ford crown victoria and mercury grand marquis were the very last fords sold with one in 2005
lines.name: English

lines.value: whilst an odometer is used to record distance units can vary usually between miles and kilometres a mileometer specifically records only in miles
lines.name: English

lines.value: the equivalent used to record kilometres is sometimes referred to as a kilometreometer
lines.name: English

lines.value: most modern cars include a trip meter trip odometer
lines.name: English

lines.value: unlike the odometer a trip meter is reset at any point in a journey making it possible to record the distance traveled in any particular journey or part of a journey
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was traditionally a purely mechanical device but in most modern vehicles it is now electronic
lines.name: English

lines.value: luxury vehicles often have multiple trip meters
lines.name: English

lines.value: most trip meters will show a maximum value of 999.9
lines.name: English

lines.value: the trip meter may be used to record the distance traveled on each tank of fuel making it very easy to accurately track the energy efficiency of the vehicle another common use is resetting it to zero at each instruction in a sequence of driving directions to be sure when one has arrived at the next turn
lines.name: English

lines.value: a form of fraud is to tamper with the reading on an mileometer odometer and presenting the incorrect number of miles kilometers traveled to a prospective buyer this is often referred to as clocking in the uk and busting miles in the us
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is done to make a car appear to have been driven less than it really has been and thus increase its apparent market value
lines.name: English

lines.value: most new cars sold today use digital odometers that store the mileage in the vehicle's engine control module making it difficult but not impossible to manipulate the mileage electronically
lines.name: English

lines.value: with mechanical odometers the speedometer can be removed from the car dashboard and the digits wound back or the drive cable can be disconnected and connected to another odometer speedometer pair while on the road
lines.name: English

lines.value: older vehicles can be driven in reverse to subtract mileage a property that provides the premise for a classic scene late in the comedy film ferris bueller's day off but modern odometers add mileage driven in reverse to the total as if driven forward thereby accurately reflecting the true total wear and tear on the vehicle
lines.name: English

lines.value: the resale value of a vehicle is often strongly influenced by the total distance shown on the odometer yet odometers are inherently insecure because they are under the control of their owners
lines.name: English

lines.value: many jurisdictions have chosen to enact laws which penalize people who are found to commit odometer fraud
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the us and many other countries vehicle mechanics are also required to keep records of the odometer any time a vehicle is serviced
lines.name: English

lines.value: companies such as carfax then use these data to help potential car buyers detect whether odometer rollback has occurred
lines.name: English

lines.value: research by irish vehicle check specialist cartell found that 20% of vehicles imported to ireland from great britain and northern ireland had had their mileometers altered to show a lower mileage
lines.name: English

lines.value: most odometers work by counting wheel rotations and assume that the distance traveled is the number of wheel rotations times the tire circumference which is a standard tire diameter times pi 3.1416
lines.name: English

lines.value: if nonstandard or severely worn or underinflated tires are used then this will cause some error in the odometer
lines.name: English

lines.value: the formula is actual distance traveled = ( final odometer reading initial odometer reading ) * actual tire diameter standard tire diameter
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is common for odometers to be off by several percent
lines.name: English

lines.value: odometer errors are typically proportional to speedometer errors
lines.name: English

lines.value: the courts of the united kingdom are separated into three separate jurisdictions the courts of england and wales courts of scotland and the courts of northern ireland as the united kingdom does not have a single unified judicial system
lines.name: English

lines.value: however in the area of immigration law the respective jurisdictions of the asylum and immigration tribunal and the special immigration appeals commission cover all of the united kingdom in employment law employment tribunals and the employment appeal tribunal have jurisdiction in the whole of great britain i.e not in northern ireland
lines.name: English

lines.value: the constitutional reform act 2005 created a new supreme court of the united kingdom to take over the judicial functions of the house of lords and devolution cases from the judicial committee of the privy council
lines.name: English

lines.value: the supreme court began work in 2009 and serves as the highest court of appeal in england and wales and in northern ireland and for civil cases in scotland
lines.name: English

lines.value: the high court of justiciary remains the court of last resort in scotland for criminal cases

lines.value: texel () is a municipality and an island with a population of 13641 in the province of north holland in the netherlands
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is the largest and most populated island of the west frisian islands in the wadden sea
lines.name: English

lines.value: the island is situated north of den helder northeast of noorderhaaks also known as razende bol and southwest of vlieland
lines.name: English

lines.value: the name texel is frisian but because of historical sound changes in dutch where all x sounds have been replaced with s sounds compare for instance english fox frisian fokse german fuchs with dutch vos the name is typically pronounced tessel in dutch
lines.name: English

lines.value: the all saints flood 1170 created the islands of texel and wieringen from north holland
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the 13th century ada countess of holland was held prisoner on texel by her uncle william
lines.name: English

lines.value: texel received city rights in 1415
lines.name: English

lines.value: texel was involved in the battle of scheveningen 1653 during the first anglo dutch war and the battle of texel 1673 during the third anglo dutch war
lines.name: English

lines.value: texel is also famous in military history as the only place where a navy was defeated on horseback
lines.name: English

lines.value: occupying holland in january 1795 the french continental army learned that the mighty dutch navy had been frozen into the ice around texel so commandant louis joseph lahure and 128 men rode up to it and demanded surrender
lines.name: English

lines.value: no shots were fired
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1797 texel was involved in the battle of camperdown during the french revolutionary wars
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the american revolution texel was used as a haven port for the uss bonhomme richard before it sank off the coast of flamborough head in britain in september 1779
lines.name: English

lines.value: in that final action john paul jones defeated and captured the british ship hms serapis which he sailed to texel for desperately needed repairs
lines.name: English

lines.value: this event further complicated anglo dutch relations
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the first world war in 1914 the battle off texel took place off the coast of texel
lines.name: English

lines.value: on the night of 31 august 1940 the sea to the northwest of texel was the scene of the sinking of two british destroyers and the severe damage of a third by german mines in what is known as the texel disaster
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the end of second world war in 1945 the georgian uprising of texel took place on the island
lines.name: English

lines.value: the municipality is located at north of the mainland of the province of north holland and west of the mainland of the province of friesland
lines.name: English

lines.value: the island of texel is situated north of the city of den helder northeast of the uninhabited island of noorderhaaks which is part of the municipality and southwest of the island of vlieland
lines.name: English

lines.value: the island includes the seven villages de cocksdorp de koog de waal den burg den hoorn oosterend and oudeschild and the small townships of bargen de nes dijkmanshuizen driehuizen harkebuurt t horntje midden eierland molenbuurt nieuweschild noorderbuurt ongeren oost spang spijkdorp tienhoven westermient zevenhuizen and zuid eierland
lines.name: English

lines.value: the island of texel was originally made up of two islands texel proper to the south and eierland to the northeast which were connected by shoals
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the early seventeenth century the islands were connected by a dyke to keep the north sea from ravaging the coastal areas of texel proper
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the mid nineteenth century a polder completed the northern half of the island
lines.name: English

lines.value: today texel forms the largest natural barrier between the north sea and the wadden sea
lines.name: English

lines.value: the dune landscape on texel is a unique habitat for wildlife
lines.name: English

lines.value: notable areas include de slufter where the tide comes in and meets the dunes forming a marshy environment rich in both fauna and flora
lines.name: English

lines.value: texel is known for its wildlife particularly in winter when birds of prey and geese take up residence
lines.name: English

lines.value: about one third of texel is a protected nature reserve
lines.name: English

lines.value: a wetland called utopia has been designed for birds to nest in
lines.name: English

lines.value: the tourism industry forms a substantial part of the economy in texel
lines.name: English

lines.value: approximately 70% of activities on texel are in some way related to tourism
lines.name: English

lines.value: popular forms of tourism on texel include cycling walking swimming and horse riding
lines.name: English

lines.value: the municipal council of texel consists of 15 seats which are divided as follows [as of april 2014]
lines.name: English

lines.value: transport around the island is typically by bicycle bus texelhopper or car
lines.name: English

lines.value: texel has an extensive cycle path network
lines.name: English

lines.value: transport to texel is usually by ferry royal teso from den helder or by air via texel international airport
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ferry texelstroom uses 80% compressed natural gas
lines.name: English
