lines.value: goshen is a town in orange county new york united states
lines.name: English

lines.value: the population was 13687 at the 2010 census
lines.name: English

lines.value: the town is named after the land of goshen
lines.name: English

lines.value: the town of goshen contains a village also called goshen the county seat of orange county
lines.name: English

lines.value: the town is centrally located in the county
lines.name: English

lines.value: settlement began around 1714 even though plans for its settlement were made around 1654
lines.name: English

lines.value: the town was established in 1789
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1830 part of goshen was used to form the new town of hamptonburgh and in 1845 another part was used to form the town of chester
lines.name: English

lines.value: the region was important in the development of harness racing
lines.name: English

lines.value: goshen is the birthplace of the former army chief of staff and former chairman of the joint chiefs of staff general martin dempsey
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2007 michael kohn a goshen volunteer firefighter started the fire that destroyed a house at 113 webster ave kohn pleaded guilty to arson and was sentenced to five to fifteen years in prison
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2014 devin giordano and jennifer molyneaux murdered helen mills in her goshen home
lines.name: English

lines.value: the pair pleaded guilty to second degree murder in 2015
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2018 lego announced plans to open a legoland theme park in 2020 in goshen
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to the united states census bureau the town has a total area of 44.0 square miles 113.9 km² of which 43.8 square miles 113.6 km² of it is land and 0.1 square miles 0.3 km² of it 0.27% is water
lines.name: English

lines.value: as of the census of 2000 there were 12913 people 4074 households and 2912 families residing in the town
lines.name: English

lines.value: the population density was 294.5 people per square mile 113.7/km²
lines.name: English

lines.value: there were 4320 housing units at an average density of 98.5 per square mile 38.0/km²
lines.name: English

lines.value: the racial makeup of the town was 88.69% white 6.72% black or african american 0.16% native american 1.71% asian 0.04% pacific islander 1.82% from other races and 0.86% from two or more races
lines.name: English

lines.value: hispanic or latino of any race were 7.36% of the population
lines.name: English

lines.value: goshen is also home to a yiddish speaking community which operates several farms in the area
lines.name: English

lines.value: there were 4074 households out of which 35.4% had children under the age of 18 living with them 60.2% were married couples living together 8.1% had a female householder with no husband present and 28.5% were non families
lines.name: English

lines.value: 24.4% of all households were made up of individuals and 11.9% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older
lines.name: English

lines.value: the average household size was 2.73 and the average family size was 3.27
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the town the population was spread out with 24.4% under the age of 18 7.2% from 18 to 24 28.5% from 25 to 44 23.0% from 45 to 64 and 16.9% who were 65 years of age or older
lines.name: English

lines.value: the median age was 39 years
lines.name: English

lines.value: the gender makeup of the town was relatively equal as for every 100 females there were 100.4 males and for every 100 females age 18 and over there were 96.9 males
lines.name: English

lines.value: the median income for a household in the town was $60066 and the median income for a family was $71497
lines.name: English

lines.value: males had a median income of $50768 versus $32648 for females
lines.name: English

lines.value: the per capita income for the town was $24275
lines.name: English

lines.value: about 2.7% of families and 4.5% of the population were below the poverty line including 3.1% of those under age 18 and 8.8% of those age 65 or over
lines.name: English

lines.value: the juilliard string quartet is a classical music string quartet founded in 1946 at the juilliard school in new york by william schuman
lines.name: English

lines.value: the original members were violinists robert mann and robert koff violist raphael hillyer and cellist arthur winograd current members are joseph lin and ronald copes violinists violist roger tapping and cellist astrid schween
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2010 nick eanet resigned from the quartet because of health issues and was replaced by joseph lin in 2011
lines.name: English

lines.value: former second violinist later first after mann's retirement joel smirnoff left the quartet after its 2008-2009 season to become president of the cleveland institute of music
lines.name: English

lines.value: since the quartet's inception in 1946 it has been the quartet in residence at the juilliard school
lines.name: English

lines.value: it has received numerous awards including four grammys and membership in the national academy recording arts and sciences hall of fame
lines.name: English

lines.value: in february 2011 the juilliard quartet received the naras lifetime achievement award for its outstanding contributions to recorded classical music
lines.name: English

lines.value: the quartet plays a wide range of classical music and has recorded works by composers such as beethoven mendelssohn bartok debussy and shostakovich while also promoting more contemporary composers such as elliott carter ralph shapey henri dutilleux and milton babbitt
lines.name: English

lines.value: it has performed with other noted musicians such as aaron copland glenn gould benita valente and also in its earlier days with the famous scientist albert einstein
lines.name: English

lines.value: they have participated on the soundtrack of immortal beloved movie
lines.name: English

lines.value: the quartet began recording with sony classical formerly columbia records and cbs masterworks in 1949 and the group's discography currently numbers over 100 items including repertoire well traveled and unfamiliar
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1950 the quartet made the first of at least three appearances at the peabody mason concerts in boston
lines.name: English

lines.value: at that performance they made a world performance premiere of martin boykan's string quartet of 1949
lines.name: English

lines.value: their early 1950s recordings of the six bartok string quartets on the columbia records label and various works recorded for the rca living stereo label c
lines.name: English

lines.value: 1958-1962 are particularly acclaimed
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2015 the quartet released an app for apple's ios entitled juilliard string quartet - an exploration of schubert's death and the maiden
lines.name: English

lines.value: the recording was issued separately on audio by ulysses arts
lines.name: English

lines.value: the app was co produced by the london based app developer touchpress and the juilliard school
lines.name: English

lines.value: the app features the quartet in a performance of franz schubert's celebrated string quartet no

lines.value: wnet channel 13 branded as thirteen is a non commercial educational public television station licensed to newark new jersey united states
lines.name: English

lines.value: with its signal covering the new york metropolitan area wnet is a member station of and a primary program provider to the public broadcasting service pbs
lines.name: English

lines.value: wnet's main studios and offices are located in midtown manhattan with an auxiliary street level studio in the lincoln center complex on the upper west side
lines.name: English

lines.value: the station's transmitter is on the empire state building with a planned relocation to one world trade center pending in 2018
lines.name: English

lines.value: owned by wnet.org formerly known as the educational broadcasting corporation wnet is also the parent of the long island based pbs station wliw channel 21 and the operator of the new jersey pbs network njtv
lines.name: English

lines.value: wnet commenced broadcasting on may 15 1948 as watv a commercial television station owned by atlantic television a subsidiary of bremer broadcasting corporation
lines.name: English

lines.value: frank v bremer the ceo also owned two northern new jersey radio stations waat 970 am now wnym and waat fm 94.7 mhz now wnsh
lines.name: English

lines.value: the three stations were based in the mosque theatre now symphony hall at 1020 broad street in newark
lines.name: English

lines.value: watv was the first of three new stations in the new york city television market to sign on the air during 1948 and was also the first independent station
lines.name: English

lines.value: one unusual daytime program daywatch consisted of a camera focused on a teletypewriter printing wire service news stories interspersed with cut aways to mechanical toys against a light music soundtrack
lines.name: English

lines.value: another early series by the station was stairway to stardom 1950-1951 one of the first tv series with an african american host
lines.name: English

lines.value: on october 6 1957 bremer broadcasting announced it had sold its stations for $4.5 million to national telefilm associates nta an early distributor of motion pictures for television joining its nta film network
lines.name: English

lines.value: on may 7 1958 channel 13's callsign was changed to wnta tv to reflect the new ownership the radio stations adopted these call letters as well
lines.name: English

lines.value: nta's cash resources enabled wnta tv to produce a schedule of programming with greater emphasis on the people and events of new jersey in comparison to the other commercial television stations
lines.name: English

lines.value: nta also sought to make channel 13 a center of nationally syndicated programming and produced several such entries notably the anthology drama series play of the week the talk show open end hosted by david susskind children's show the magic clown and a popular dance program emceed by clay cole
lines.name: English

lines.value: but wnta tv continued to lag behind new york's other independent stations - wnew tv channel 5 now wnyw wor tv channel 9 now wwor tv and wpix channel 11 - in terms of audience size and nta incurred a large debtload
lines.name: English

lines.value: national telefilm associates put the wnta stations up for sale in february 1961
lines.name: English

lines.value: at least three prospective purchasers expressed interest in wnta tv
lines.name: English

lines.value: the most prominent was the new york city based group educational television for the metropolitan area etma a consortium of businesspeople cultural leaders and educators who intended to turn channel 13 into an educational station
lines.name: English

lines.value: by this time it was obvious that the non commercial frequency that the federal communications commission fcc originally allocated to the city uhf channel 25 would not be nearly adequate enough to cover a market that stretched from fairfield county connecticut in the north to ocean county new jersey in the south
lines.name: English

lines.value: prior to 1964 when the fcc required television manufacturers to include uhf tuners in newer sets as per the all channel act most viewers could not view uhf stations except with an expensive converter only a few manufacturers made sets with built in uhf tuning
lines.name: English

lines.value: even for those who could access uhf stations reception was marginal even under the best conditions
lines.name: English

lines.value: with assistance from the university of the state of new york etma had attempted to purchase channel 13 and convert it into a non commercial station in 1957 when bremer broadcasting first put the station on the block this bid was later withdrawn
lines.name: English

lines.value: this time etma was competing with nta founding president ely landau who had resigned from the company in order to head his own venture for this and by david susskind who received financial backing from paramount pictures
lines.name: English

lines.value: etma's initial bid of $4 million was rejected by nta but the citizens group remained persistent
lines.name: English

lines.value: with the support and guidance of national educational television net already in their pocket etma later received an endorsement from newly appointed fcc chairman newton minow who established public hearings to discuss the fate of channel 13
lines.name: English

lines.value: the pendulum quickly shifted in favor of channel 13 going non commercial and the private firms withdrew their interest
lines.name: English

lines.value: on june 29 1961 etma agreed to purchase wnta tv for $6.2 million
lines.name: English

lines.value: about $2 million of that amount came from five of the six remaining commercial vhf stations wpix was the lone holdout all of whom were pleased to see a competitor eliminated
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition cbs later donated a facility in manhattan to etma and net for production uses
lines.name: English

lines.value: the fcc approved the transfer in october and converted channel 13's commercial license to non commercial
lines.name: English

lines.value: the outgoing new jersey governor robert b meyner addressing state lawmakers concerns over continued programming specific to new jersey and fearing the fcc would move the channel 13 allocation to new york city petitioned the united states court of appeals on september 6 1961 to block the sale of wnta tv
lines.name: English

lines.value: the court ruled in the state's favor two months later
lines.name: English

lines.value: the unsettled deal almost caused national telefilm associates to reconsider its decision to sell the station altogether and nta made plans to go forward wnta tv made a play to acquire broadcast rights for the new york mets baseball team for its inaugural 1962 season
lines.name: English

lines.value: but faced with either consummating the transaction or seeing it cancelled etma settled their differences with new jersey officials on december 4 1961
lines.name: English

lines.value: after a few last minute issues arose to cause further delays the transfer became final on december 22
lines.name: English

lines.value: later that evening wnta tv signed off for the final time
lines.name: English

lines.value: etma and net then went to work converting the station which they said would return with its new format within three months
lines.name: English

lines.value: ten months later channel 13 was ready to be reborn
lines.name: English

lines.value: with legendary cbs reporter edward r murrow at the helm on the maiden broadcast etma - now the non profit educational broadcasting corporation - flipped the switch to wndt for " n ew d imensions in t elevision on september 16 1962
lines.name: English

lines.value: the return of channel 13 as wndt gave the new york city market its first educational station and with a dial position on the coveted vhf band in many other cities including large ones educational stations had to make do with uhf frequencies
lines.name: English

lines.value: new york's non commercial uhf channel on the other hand signed on as wnye tv four and a half years later in april 1967
lines.name: English

lines.value: richard heffner was appointed as wndt's first general manager serving in that position in its first year heffner continued to appear on channel 13 as producer and host of the public affairs program the open mind until his death in december 2013
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the transition and after the inaugural broadcast wndt faced an immediate crisis
lines.name: English

lines.value: the american federation of television and radio artists aftra was concerned about the use of teachers - some of whom were union certified performers - on non commercial television and how they would be compensated should their work be distributed nationally
lines.name: English

lines.value: aftra called a strike on the morning of wndt's debut
lines.name: English

lines.value: engineers and technicians who were members of the international brotherhood of electrical workers refused to cross the aftra picket line leaving the station's management and other non union employees to produce the three hour inaugural broadcast
lines.name: English

lines.value: immediately afterwards channel 13 went off the air again as the strike continued for nearly two weeks
lines.name: English

lines.value: the striking workers returned wndt to the air after ten days and on september 28 the labor dispute was settled
lines.name: English

lines.value: but the station's financial resources were drained requiring an infusion of cash from the ford foundation to help keep the station running
lines.name: English

lines.value: net originally wanted to merge its operations with wndt which would have given the station a direct line of funding as well as make channel 13 net's flagship station
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ford foundation which supported both groups stopped the proposed mergers on at least two different occasions in 1962 and 1965
lines.name: English

lines.value: events that began in 1967 led the ford foundation to change its stance and push for a wndt net merger
lines.name: English

lines.value: the newly formed corporation for public broadcasting created by an act of the united states congress initially supported net's network role while providing government funding for programming
lines.name: English

lines.value: but that move was followed two years later with the establishment of the public broadcasting service as the cpb's own distribution system - which was a direct threat to net's territory
lines.name: English

lines.value: it has been intimated that the cpb's creation was an attempt to curb net's production of controversial documentaries and replace it with a less controversial government friendly broadcaster less hostile in particular to the johnson and later the nixon administrations net ignored the demand and continued on with the production of the critically acclaimed documentaries
lines.name: English

lines.value: at one point president nixon frustrated with net's documentaries criticizing his administration especially its handling of the vietnam war almost managed to cut net's $20 million funding grant in half
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a result this led both ford and the cpb to threaten net with funding withdrawal in early 1970 unless it merged with the station
lines.name: English

lines.value: not long after ford brokered the merger of wndt and net which took effect on june 29 1970
lines.name: English

lines.value: channel 13's callsign was changed to the present wnet on october 1 1970
lines.name: English

lines.value: net ceased network operations three days later though wnet continued to produce some shows for the national pbs schedule with the net branding until about 1972
lines.name: English

lines.value: following the merger david loxton established the tv lab in 1972 with support from the rockefeller foundation and new york state council on the arts
lines.name: English

lines.value: tv lab provided artists with equipment to produce video pieces through an artist in residence program
lines.name: English

lines.value: the independent documentary fund and video tape review series were both produces of tv lab
lines.name: English

lines.value: tv lab ended in 1984 when the corporation for public broadcasting withdrew funds
lines.name: English

lines.value: channel 13's studios and offices were originally located in the mosque theater at 1020 broad street in newark with transmitter on first mountain in west orange new jersey eventually moving to the empire state building and later the world trade center
lines.name: English

lines.value: for a short time studios were located at the gateway center office building in newark
lines.name: English

lines.value: the station eventually moved its operations to manhattan in 1982 and was based on west 58th street in the hudson hotel while retaining the gateway center studios for a few more years
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1998 it moved to 450 west 33rd street straddling the railroad tracks going into pennsylvania station
lines.name: English

lines.value: the associated press and numerous other media groups have headquarters in the same building
lines.name: English

lines.value: channel 13's transmitter facilities including a newly installed digital transmission system were destroyed in the terrorist attacks of september 11 2001
lines.name: English

lines.value: gerard rod coppola channel 13's head transmitter engineer was among those who died when the north tower collapsed
lines.name: English

lines.value: his remains were discovered on december 25 2001
lines.name: English

lines.value: for the next ten months wnye tv headquartered in brooklyn became wnet's surrogate transmitter and airwave for those without cable repeats of wnet's prime time schedule were broadcast on wnye until channel 13 could reestablish transmission facilities back at the empire state building
lines.name: English

lines.value: some time later in february 2003 wnet completed its merger with long island pbs broadcaster wliw licensed to garden city and based in plainview combining the two stations into one operation
lines.name: English

lines.value: while most of the two stations operations have been merged they still have separate studio facilities separate governing boards and conduct separate fundraising efforts
lines.name: English

lines.value: during 2009 wnet's parent company wnet.org sustained financial difficulties and in january the company pared its workforce from 500 employees to 415 due to severe problems with its budget and fundraising
lines.name: English

lines.value: in october wnet announced that its studios at 450 west 33rd street would soon be up for sale as it no longer needed the extra space
lines.name: English

lines.value: in november wnet announced that all wnet.org employees would take an unpaid furlough for three to five days between christmas and new year's day with a skeleton crew of engineers remaining during that time to keep the stations on the air however they too would have to go on furloughs at the start of 2010
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2011 wnet moved its studios and offices to worldwide plaza
lines.name: English

lines.value: wnet has been digital only since june 12 2009
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2014 the tisch wnet studios at lincoln center were built at the southwest corner of 66th and broadway this versatile state of the art facility houses two television studios
lines.name: English

lines.value: the space can also accommodate lectures screenings and intimate concerts
lines.name: English

lines.value: the new facility is named in honor of james s tisch and his wife merryl h tisch whose $15 million gift is the single largest donation from individuals in wnet's nearly 50-year history
lines.name: English

lines.value: on july 1 2011 wnet took over the programming of the new jersey network which was relaunched as njtv
lines.name: English

lines.value: the network features increased coverage of news and issues pertinent to new jersey as well as programming from the wnet and pbs libraries
lines.name: English

lines.value: the transfer of programming to wnet was part of governor chris christie's plan for the new jersey government's exit from public broadcasting
lines.name: English

lines.value: as part of the deal wnet airs njtv's nightly statewide newscast nj today which was later renamed to njtv news on november 4 2013 to meet its local programming obligations since it still operates on a frequency allocated to newark
lines.name: English

lines.value: previously it had aired njn's newscast njn news which it co produced with njn
lines.name: English

lines.value: on may 9 2017 it was announced that wnet would resume broadcasting from the top of the world trade center at one world trade center by the end of the year
lines.name: English

lines.value: the station's digital channel is multiplexed
lines.name: English

lines.value: wnet is carried in all of mercer county new jersey on comcast cablevision and verizon fios
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is also carried in certain areas of connecticut particularly those adjoining the new york city market in fairfield county
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is also carried on cable in abaco in the bahamas
lines.name: English

lines.value: wnet has produced created and or presented a number of pbs shows
lines.name: English

lines.value: this includes but is not limited to wnet has also produced programming for public televisions stations distributed outside of the pbs system including
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2010 the office of the united states attorney for the southern district of new york filed a lawsuit asserting that the wnet subsidiary the educational broadcasting corporation misused grant money worth $13 million donated by the national science foundation the national endowment for the humanities and the national endowment for the arts between september 2001 and january 2008
lines.name: English

lines.value: the suit asserted that wnet had used grant money that was given for the production of programs including american masters great performances and cyberchase for other purposes
lines.name: English

lines.value: wnet settled the lawsuit in june 2010 by paying back the united states government $950000 pledging to instate a program to ensure they honored all future federal grant requirements and agreeing to not receive $1015046 in federal grant money that was about to be awarded wnet vice president and general counsel robert feinberg said to the new york times this is not a scenario we want to repeat and we have no intention of repeating it
lines.name: English

lines.value: in november 2012 wnet was scheduled to air alex gibney's film park avenue money power and the american dream produced by independent lens
lines.name: English

lines.value: the film compared the wealth gap between the new york residents of park avenue in the bronx and the wealthy residents of an exclusive manhattan apartment block at 740 park avenue including david koch a billionaire businessman and political activist
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the time koch was a board member of wnet and was planning on making a seven figure donation - maybe more to wnet
lines.name: English

lines.value: a furor erupted when the new yorker revealed in may 2013 that to appease koch the president of wnet neal shapiro called koch offering him the opportunity to screen gibney's film before broadcast and rebut it after it aired with a written statement
lines.name: English

lines.value: shapiro said to the new yorker that he just called david koch
lines.name: English

lines.value: he's on our board
lines.name: English

lines.value: he's the biggest main character
lines.name: English

lines.value: no one else just david koch
lines.name: English

lines.value: because he's a trustee
lines.name: English

lines.value: it's a courtesy
lines.name: English

lines.value: i can't remember doing anything like this [before] wnet replaced the film's introduction by stanley tucci with a new introduction calling the film controversial and provocative
lines.name: English

lines.value: immediately after the broadcast they aired a statement from koch industries criticizing the film as disappointing and divisive although a koch spokesperson said david koch had only watched the trailer
lines.name: English

lines.value: wnet followed the statement with an on air round table discussion where the moderator repeatedly mentioned that koch's philanthropic contributions totaled a billion dollars
lines.name: English

lines.value: gibney was not invited to appear at the round table and was quoted as saying why is wnet offering mr koch special favors
lines.name: English

lines.value: and why did the station allow koch to offer a critique of a film he hadn't even seen
lines.name: English

lines.value: money
lines.name: English

lines.value: money talks
lines.name: English

lines.value: they tried to undercut the credibility of the film and i had no opportunity to defend it
lines.name: English

lines.value: koch did not make the large donation to wnet and resigned from their board on may 16 2013
lines.name: English

lines.value: in september 2013 wnet launched a series called the pension peril examining the economic sustainability of public pensions and promoting cuts to their funding
lines.name: English

lines.value: on december 18 2013 neal shapiro president and ceo of wnet was quoted in a press release saying this is the type of complex public policy story that only public television covers in an in depth and ongoing way
lines.name: English

lines.value: wnet is poised to lead and further the dialogue about this challenging situation all across public media on pbs public radio and online
lines.name: English

lines.value: on february 12 2014 pandodaily reported that the sole sponsor of the pension peril was former enron trader john d arnold who had financially backed efforts to cut public employee pension benefits
lines.name: English

lines.value: stephen segaller wnet's vice president for programming told the new york times on february 13 2014 that he had absolute conviction that the laura and john arnold foundation was an admissible funder and the funding did not violate pbs's perception rule
lines.name: English

lines.value: on february 14 segaller told the new york times that wnet had reversed course after discussing with pbs both the facts and the optics
lines.name: English

lines.value: we all take very very seriously any suggestion that there's a perception problem about the integrity of our work or the sources of our funding and we came to the conclusion that it's better to err on the side of caution
lines.name: English

lines.value: wnet and pbs issued a joint statement notifying that the series would go on hiatus and wnet would return the $3.5 million grant it had received from the laura and john arnold foundation
lines.name: English

lines.value: segaller said in the statement we made a mistake pure and simple pbs ombudsman michael getler commented that the pandodaily's article shines a light once again on what seems to me to be ethical compromises in funding arrangements and lack of real transparency for viewers caused in part by the complicated funding demands needed to support public broadcasting and in part by managers who make some questionable decisions getler added that wnet went seriously wrong and that their decision to accept a grant of $3.5 million from the arnold foundation with a stated interest in public employee benefits reform flunks pbs's own perception test which is part of the service's funding standards and practices
lines.name: English

lines.value: in late 2014 wnet programming chief stephen segaller received widespread criticism for proposing to push the multi award winning documentary strands independent lens and pov tv series out of a prime time slot and onto a secondary station wliw channel 21
lines.name: English

lines.value: over 2000 documentarians signed a petition stating that wnet's action would lead to the shows being marginalized by pbs affiliates nationwide and have a severe effect on cutting edge documentary film making
lines.name: English

lines.value: among the prominent opponents of rescheduling pov and independent lens were filmmakers alex gibney and laura poitras who had campaigned against a similar move by wnet in 2012
lines.name: English

lines.value: tv producer norman lear wrote an op ed in the new york times accusing wnet and pbs of a ratings chase that could devastate independent documentary film making he criticized the broadcaster for threatening for the second time in four years to downgrade documentaries which are at the heart of its public mission
lines.name: English

lines.value: many of the subjects pov and independent lens covered - like the koch brothers influence on american politics in alex gibney's film park avenue money power and the american dream - have been controversial leading the indie caucus a group of independent filmmakers to speculate if the provocative subjects they explored might also be relegating them to the more obscure tv schedule
lines.name: English

lines.value: segaller said it was preposterous to suggest that wnet had a censorship agenda when both programs had run for more than a decade
lines.name: English

lines.value: one disputatious moment in a many year history does not a conspiracy make he declared
lines.name: English

lines.value: in april 2015 wnet relented and restored both strands to their original slots
lines.name: English

lines.value: in june 2015 a media furor forced wnet to postpone the third season of finding your roots when the sony pictures hack revealed via hacked emails that a subject of the series ben affleck had lobbied for material relating to a relative owning slaves be removed from the show
lines.name: English

lines.value: those edits which violated pbs ethics standards brought strong criticism from the media to wnet and the producers of the show
lines.name: English

lines.value: pbs issued a statement saying the series co producers violated pbs standards by failing to shield the creative and editorial process from improper influence and by failing to inform pbs or wnet of mr affleck's efforts to affect program content the statement promised the episode would be withdrawn from distribution and that the series would employ an independent genealogist to review all versions of program episodes for factual accuracy
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the suspension of the series adweek commented the network clearly understands that its integrity has been thrown into question by this controversy
lines.name: English

lines.value: even if they understood where the producers of the show were coming from when they decided to entertain the request pbs and the veracity of all that's included in their documentaries requires decisive action that conveys just how serious this infraction was the series returned to the air in january 2016
lines.name: English

lines.value: billy joel a native of the greater new york area mentioned wnet in one of the lyrics to his 1982 song pressure
lines.name: English

lines.value: in it joel is describing the state of the song's character who is going in and out of psych ward 1 and psych ward 2
lines.name: English

lines.value: he then says all your life is channel 13
lines.name: English

lines.value: sesame street what does it mean wnet is also shown in the pledge drive an episode of the nbc sitcom seinfeld

lines.value: the lady amherst's pheasant chrysolophus amherstiae is a bird of the order galliformes and the family phasianidae
lines.name: English

lines.value: the genus name is from ancient greek khrusolophos with golden crest
lines.name: English

lines.value: the english name and amherstiae commemorates sarah countess amherst wife of william pitt amherst governor general of bengal who was responsible for sending the first specimen of the bird to london in 1828
lines.name: English

lines.value: the species is native to southwestern china and far northern myanmar but has been introduced elsewhere and has established a self supporting but now believed extinct feral population in england the stronghold of which was in west bedfordshire
lines.name: English

lines.value: lady amherst first introduced the ornamental pheasant on her estates near the duke of bedford's woburn abbey where they were also shot for game and the introduced populations in england will interbreed
lines.name: English

lines.value: however since late 2015 the species has been believed to be extinct in the wild in great britain with no confirmed sightings since march 2015
lines.name: English

lines.value: the adult male is 100 120 cm 23 in in length its tail accounting for 80 cm of the total length
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is unmistakable with its nuchal cape white black with a red crest
lines.name: English

lines.value: the long grey tail and rump is red blue dark green white and yellow plumage
lines.name: English

lines.value: the cape can be raised in display
lines.name: English

lines.value: this species is closely related to the golden pheasant c
lines.name: English

lines.value: pictus but has a yellow eye blue green bare skin around it
lines.name: English

lines.value: the bill is horn coloured and they had blue gray legs
lines.name: English

lines.value: the female is much less showy with a duller mottled brown plumage all over similar to that of the female common pheasant p
lines.name: English

lines.value: colchicus but with finer barring
lines.name: English

lines.value: she is very like the female golden pheasant but has a darker head and cleaner underparts than the hen of that species
lines.name: English

lines.value: despite the male's showy appearance these birds are very difficult to see in their natural habitat which is dense dark forests with thick undergrowth
lines.name: English

lines.value: consequently little is known of their behaviour in the wild
lines.name: English

lines.value: they feed on the ground on grain leaves and invertebrates but roost in trees at night
lines.name: English

lines.value: whilst they can fly they prefer to run but if startled they can suddenly burst upwards at great speed with a distinctive wing sound
lines.name: English

lines.value: the male has a gruff call in the breeding season
lines.name: English

lines.value: widespread throughout its large range the lady amherst's pheasant is evaluated as least concern on the iucn red list of threatened species
lines.name: English

lines.name: English

lines.value: baron arlington is a title in the peerage of england which was created on 14 march 1665 for sir henry bennet younger brother of john bennet 1st baron ossulston with a special remainder allowing it to descend to male and female heirs rather than only male heirs as was customary with most peerages
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1672 he was made earl of arlington and viscount thetford and was regranted the title of baron arlington with the same special remainder
lines.name: English

lines.value: its territorial designation is the birthplace of its first holder harlington london which was also known as arlington
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first earl died as anticipated without male heirs so the titles went to his daughter isabella
lines.name: English

lines.value: at age five isabella was engaged to henry fitzroy the illegitimate son of charles ii of england and his mistress barbara villiers
lines.name: English

lines.value: henry would be created duke of grafton in 1679
lines.name: English

lines.value: as this boy charles was an illegitimate son of king charles ii he therefore took the norman style surname fitzroy
lines.name: English

lines.value: upon the death of his parents charles fitzroy inherited the arlington and grafton substantive titles
lines.name: English

lines.value: the two titles continued united until the death of the 9th duke in a high speed racecar accident in 1936
lines.name: English

lines.value: the grafton dukedom passed to a cousin yet the three arlington/thetford titles fell into abeyance under the principle of moieties between his two sisters neither of whom petitioned the sovereign to terminate this
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the death of the elder sister her eldest child jennifer petitioned the sovereign and the abeyance of the barony of arlington was terminated in her favour restoring it upon her rather than her aunt's descendants
lines.name: English

lines.value: the earldom of arlington however remains abeyant along with the viscountcy of thetford
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the peerage of the united kingdom the earldom including the viscountcy being a courtesy title presents a rare example of a hereditary peerage title of a higher rank than baron falling into abeyance another case being that of the earldom of cromartie in 1893
lines.name: English

lines.value: tai lam country park (), established on 23 february 1979 is a country park located in the tai lam at the south of yuen long and east of tuen mun in the western new territories of hong kong
lines.name: English

lines.value: this country park has an area of 54 km²
lines.name: English

lines.value: a series of barbecue and picnic sites are provided along route twisk the shek kong pat heung catchwater and the tuen mun catchwater
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition there are a lot of trails
lines.name: English

lines.value: for example the maclehose trail and the kap lung forest trail start from the top of route twisk near the country park management centre
lines.name: English

lines.value: the twisk nature trail near the country park management centre introduces the natural environment and human impacts in the area
lines.name: English

lines.value: the fitness trail at so kwun wat catchwater provides 14 sets of fitness equipment for visitors and morning walkers
lines.name: English
